file.author: sodalimonada176
file.title: Blue Is The Darkest Shade
file.description:
Small blue medieval castle map for vanilla Quake.

"Since this is my second map, i decided to experiment more on the Z-axis with rooms on top of rooms and splitting paths. Still kinda small though, have fun =)"

file.author: sock
file.title: One Thousand Cuts
file.description: Expanded standalone version of sock's map from Func Map Jam 2: a medium-sized, IKblue-themed, partially ruined temple with two individual routes for replayablility. It comes with a set of medieval-style item boxes.

file.author: Aardappel, Blitz, czg, FredTheFishSlayer, Hanz, Necros, Rcktrob, Scragbait
file.title: 100 Brush Competition #2
file.description:
Results for the second 100 brush mapping competition. Contains 10 Quake Single Player maps, all made using 100 brushes or less. Includes a start map to access them all from.
  1. Biotoxin by CZG
  2. The Secret Castle by Aardappel
  3. CZG's Moonshot by CZG
  4. Cenotaph Of Seqqarra by Rcktrob
  5. Tower of 100 pieces by FredTheFishSlayer
  6. oH gOd by Necros
  7. Spring Cleaning by Scragbait
  8. Raj Maul by -=Blitz=-
  9. School Assassin by Hanz
  10. Titanic by Hanz

file.author: distrans, necros, RPG, Stargazer
file.title: 100 Brush Competition #3
file.description:
Results for the third 100 brush mapping competition organized by Grindspire. Contains 4 Quake Single Player maps, all made using 100 brushes or less.
  • Dismembered Crate by distrans
  • S4wk by RPG
  • Fired Ice by Stargazer
  • 100b3 by necros

This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Artistical, DelusionalBear, Digs, dumptruck_ds, ionous, JCR, Newhouse, Redfield, Roman, Shamblernaut, Shotro, Spipper, Spud, ww
file.title: 100 Brush Competition #4
file.description:
Results of the fourth 100b contest (=maps made using <100 brushes): 19 singleplayer levels by various authors, and a start hub to select each of them. Some of the maps come with additional content such as models, sounds, and skyboxes. The map sources are included.

Final results:

1. Deflan'Ka by ww
2. Ioian Shorelines by ionous
3. Immortal Reach by Spipper
4. The Di[g]stortion by Digs
5. Frostbitten by ionous
6. With Apologies to Insomniac by Spud
7. The Vale of Dream by Redfield
8. (tie) The Teleportation Complex by Newhouse
8. (tie) Beyond and Within by Artistical
8. (tie) Between Dimensions by JCR
11. (tie) Locus Genus by Artistical
11. (tie) Pyro's Barbecue by Newhouse
11. (tie) The Forgotten Station by Artistical
14. (tie) Cerebral Edema by Shotro
14. (tie) The Engineering Department by JCR
16. The Tutorial by dumptruck_ds
17. N-Titties by Shamblernaut
18. Unwarranted Phlebotomy by DelusionalBear
19. Ela-V8 by Roman

Note: These maps require Quoth 2.2 and in parts a source port with increased limits.

file.author: DaMaul, Edgecrusher, Fat Controller, Fern, Gilt, Grahf, Iikka "Fingers" Keränen, JAJ, Killazontherun, Palldjon, Scragbait, XeNoN, Zibbie
file.title: 100 Brush Competition #1
file.description:
100 Brush Competition (rules: Q1 map with 100 brushes at most) - organized by Aardappel:
  • 1. Ouverture (Gilt)
  • 2. Valley of Kings (Iikka "Fingers" Keränen)
  • 3. Stamppot (Zibbie)
  • 4.-14. by JAJ, DaMaul, XeNoN, Scragbait, Palldjon, Fat Controller, Edgecrusher, Fern, Grahf, Killazontherun

file.author: James Bernard Roth
file.description:
Small level that aims to recreate the horrors of World War I. Comes with a custom music track and the map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

Note: This version has the music misplaced so that upon extraction it needs manual placement. Use 1916_v2 for a fixed release.

file.author: James Bernard Roth
file.description:
Small level that aims to recreate the horrors of World War I. Comes with a custom music track and the map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

Note: In this version the music track is in the right place in the zip.

file.author: mukor, Naitelveni, NewHouse
file.title: 24h Jam - Base theme
file.description:
Result of a 24-hour map jam following a Base theme: three small maps in different base settings. The map sources are included.

Note: Due to improper packaging these maps cannot be run from the Quake Injector.

file.author: Chris Sanders
file.title: 2 Factions
file.description: Small level for the NavySeals Mod.

file.author: Mazu
file.title: 37th Relic Retrieval
file.description:
Huge nonlinear IKbase level with over 900 enemies. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits and BSP2 support.

file.author: Zied Rieke
file.title: Three of Clubs
file.description: A small base level with lots of monsters and little ammo. Features 'new' flying enforcer enemy.

file.author: Trace Stuart
file.title: Three's Arena
file.description:
Small base/prison, created for the Escape For Quake conversion.
Bleh.

file.author: Trace Stuart
file.title: Three's Canyon
file.description:
Small canyon with an ice cave, created for the Escape For Quake conversion.
Bleh.

file.author: Trace Stuart
file.title: Sector 3 - The Sewage Plant
file.description: Small sewage plant, created for the Escape For Quake conversion.

file.author: George J. Fiffy II
file.title: REoL TOUGH: Demise!
file.description: Small, unspectacular Metal map with some water bits.

file.author: George J. Fiffy II
file.title: REoL TOUGH: Fortress!
file.description: Medium sized, partly cramped Wizard map.

file.author: George J. Fiffy II
file.title: REoL TOUGH: Damnation!
file.description: Small, partly cramped Wizard map with a few traps.

file.author: George J. Fiffy II
file.title: REoL TOUGH: Antichrist!
file.description: Medium Wizard/Metal map with a Chthon battle.

file.author: George J. Fiffy II
file.title: REoL TOUGH: Base!
file.description: Medium sized Base map.

file.author: George J. Fiffy II
file.title: REoL TOUGH: O-Negative!
file.description: Medium sized plain Base map with overly bright outside areas and a tech station. Barely average.

file.author: 4LT
file.title: Askisi Gamma
file.description:
Medium to large terracotta-themed map. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Copper.

file.author: JPL
file.title: The Five Rivers Land
file.description: Mini campaign in DOOM 3 hell-style with three small to medium sized, dark and scrary maps, D3 textures (needless to say) and some ambient sounds.

file.author: FifthElephant
file.title: Squad 768
file.description:
Small metal/base map with many crates and jumping puzzles. It is inspired by the 768/vertical contest and Metal Monstrosity. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Quoth.

file.author: negke
file.title: Skinny Norris
file.description:
"A large tower-like Quoth single player map with an unusual texture theme and independent puzzles/traps routes," originally started for the Vertical Competition (=768*768 base with unlimited vertical height, no player teleportation).

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Lurker, rudl, Spirit, Trinca
file.title: Vertical Map Pack
file.description:
Results of the 2007 Vertical map event at Func_Msgboard. According to the rules all brushwork and entities remain within a 768*768 unit base with unlimited vertical height, the maps make no use of player teleportation, support singleplayer and are based on Quoth.

The pack includes four around medium sized maps of varying themes by lurker, rudl, Spirit and Trinca.

file.author: Russell McKenzie
file.title: Welcome to The Terrors
file.description: Very square and cramped "my house" type level. Comes with a difficulty selecting start level.

file.author: Pingu
file.title: A2D2 - Ambush Keen Pilgrims
file.description: Fairly small egypt style map with excellent brushwork and great gameplay! Created from Pingu's deathmatch map A2: Return to Atlantis.

file.author: Pingu
file.title: The Journey Home
file.description: Small egypt style outpost surrounded by snowy mountains. Great brushwork and gameplay!

file.author: Aardappel
file.title: The Secret Castle
file.description: Aardappel's entry for the QMap 100 Brush Competition of Dec00-Jan01: a medium-sized canyon with a small castle. It comes with an optional progs.dat which removes dead bodies and gibs for better performance. The map source is included.

file.author: MadFox
file.title: Abandon
file.description:
An interesting map pack made of 25 levels.

"If you want straight Quake1 levels, don't try this. Levels are quite irrational, with no common sense way out, arised more by intuition than logical interpretation,and never intended to publish as an official pack."

file.author: Jim Hughes
file.title: All Black Within
file.description: Medium sized metal level.

file.author: Vondur
file.title: Adamantine Cruelty
file.description: A large brick/metal sewer-type map with an optional secret area. Comes with an extra skill selection map.

file.author: Jonathan G. aka SalaCious Crumb/H8 bReEDEr
file.title: Acerbus
file.description: Smallish Metal level.

file.author: Calluna Vulgaris
file.title: Acid Worship
file.description:
Small industrial base station inside an underground acid cave.

Note: This map requires Rubicon 2 and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Tyrann
file.title: Escape from Actaltraz
file.description: Medium sized based map, escape from prison theme.

file.author: sock
file.title: The Tenacious Tentacle
file.description:
Small level created in the spirit of the 100b competitions (using not more than 100 world brushes). The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions.

file.author: Comrade Beep
file.title: Deep Research
file.description:
Small base map using Speedbase textures. Comes with a new skybox and a custom music track.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.71 and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Comrade Beep
file.title: The Lima Project
file.description:
Medium-sized industrial facility using cr8 and Doom 3 textures. It comes with a custom skybox and a music track.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Zothique
file.title: Oozing Blasphemy
file.description:
Large challenging dark industrial runic map with 16 secrets and custom sounds, built for Arcane Dimensions 1.81 (NOT included).

"... Real wickedness is something that bleeds through spacetime, when it tears at the fabric of reality, discharging its obscene effluvium: oozing blasphemy."

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits and BSP2 support.

file.author: bmFbr
file.title: Dead Cold Fortess
file.description:
Late entry for Xmas Jam 2020: a small Knave-themed level built inside a 1024³ units space. It comes with a custom sky box. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.8 or Xmas Jam 2020.

file.author: Comrade Beep
file.title: Candles of the Damned
file.description:
Remake of E1M2 from Quake: a medium-sized medieval castle with many candles. The map was previously released as part of Halloween Jam 2. Among other things, this version features even more candles! Comes with a new bat model and some ambient sounds.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Blaze, Chris Holden, FifthElephant, Greenwood, ish, Omni, PoolboyQ, Pinchy, quasiotter
file.title: Chotex Jam
file.description:
Mapping jam event based on a custom texture set created by Chris Holden: nine small to medium-sized levels including a start map. It comes with a skybox and a few new models. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.
A patch for three of the maps is available here.

file.author: Shambler
file.title: Acidophilus
file.description:
Around medium-sized copper/metal level; a singleplayer remix of stock DM2 - Claustrophobopolis, based on the original map source. It comes with a custom skybox (already included in AD).

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Doug Wheeler aka Bullseye8841
file.title: Office Offense
file.description:
Medium-sized realism map using Kingpin textures and set in a prestigeous office building, complete with a cantina, a parking garage, and maintenance areas. Comes with three custom sounds.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits (Quakespasm-Spike fork recommended).

file.author: Giftmacher
file.title: Forgotten Sepulcher - Beta
file.description:
Old unfinished 2016 beta version of the Forgotten Sepulcher level in Arcane Dimensions, before it was significantly changed for final release in 2017. It was arguably a completely different map.

This map is archived here mostly for academic / historical interest. Keep in mind it is a non-final test version built for an older version of AD, so there will likely be bugs or broken features.

Note: requires Arcane Dimensions v1.5+ (NOT included) as well as a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: mfx
file.title: The Faults Within
file.description:
Remake/remix of stock Quake map E3M2 - The Vaults of Zin. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions, updated with v1.4patch2 or later.

file.author: Henrik Oresten (Giftmacher)
file.title: Tomb of Fenrir
file.description:
Medium to large medieval-style dungeon in a subterranean lava cave. The map source and the texture wad are included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Cthulhu
file.title: Fireplace
file.description:
Small medieval castle. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits.
An updated version of this map is available here.

file.author: sock
file.title: Grendel's Blade
file.description:
Large runic fortress built around a huge sword thrust into the ground. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.71 and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Heresy
file.title: Oxyblack Fortress
file.description:
Huge lava fortress using custom textures by Makkon. It comes with a few new sounds, a custom skybox and a music track. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.7 and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support
[The new sound effects may not work on case-sensitive operating systems]

file.author: Heresy
file.title: Imhotep's Legacy
file.description:
Large Egyptian temple with tech elements using sock textures. It comes with statue models, a few sounds, custom skyboxes and a music track. The map source is included.

Note: This level requires Arcane Dimensions 1.8 and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: JPal
file.title: The Battery
file.description:
Medium-sized military base with an artillery battery. Comes with a custom skybox. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Juzley
file.title: Network Unreachable
file.description:
Smallish industrial/base map using socktech textures. It comes with two new sound effects. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.71 and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support

file.author: Juzley
file.title: Retribution Revisited
file.description:
Small to medium-sized level (albeit with a high monster count). A singleplayer remake of Q3DM7- Temple of Retribution using custom textures. Comes with a music track. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Makt
file.title: Atrocity Arise
file.description:
Large Knave-textured castle with libraries and a courtyard. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Mittens for Kittens
file.title: The Dreamer's Demesne
file.description:
Medium-sized blue desert castle, made for Arcane Dimensions v1.81+ (NOT included).

"You awaken to the whistling of a chill wind and the sight of dunes illuminated by moonlight. Through the crackling of nearby torches, you hear a shrill, otherworldly cry in the distance behind you. This is the demesne of the Dreamer, where nightmares beyond measure creep through sleepless, azure halls..."

Probably requires a source port / modern engine with increased limits. Map source is included.

file.author: mukor
file.title: Trench Foot
file.description:
Smallish linear Mayan/Koohoo-textured dungeon.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: mukor
file.title: Diminutive Abyss
file.description:
Small void map with a focus on exploration.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions.

file.author: mukor
file.title: Duel, In Towers
file.description:
Small medieval-style level with two towers in a canyon. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions.

file.author: Redfield
file.title: Paradise Sickness
file.description:
Large Egyptian level with an archeological research base built into a tomb below a pyramid. The map features several popcultural references and the map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.60 and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: sock
file.title: Nyarlathotep's Sand Castle
file.description:
Large Egyptian-themed temple. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Giftmacher, Sock
file.title: The Forgotten Sepulcher
file.description:
Huge and intricately detailed map set in a medieval swampy environment. Loosely based on e1m3.

The map source and the texture wad are included.

Note: The download includes an update to Arcane Dimensions 1.5, which is required.

Note: This release requires an engine with dramatically raised limits, such as Quakespasm 0.93.0 or higher.

file.author: Shadesmaster
file.title: The Refinery
file.description:
Base level.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Shambler
file.title: Annihilith Of Abhorration
file.description:
Small Zerstörer-themed level.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Shambler
file.title: Symphony of Steel
file.description:
Small industrial base map; the layout is a tribute to ztn's Bloodrun. It comes with a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Tonhao
file.title: Smells Like Rust
file.description:
"A big base map with intense fights... you are a treasure hunter who seeks riches in abandoned places. You heard about a factory that did brutal tests on people and decide to go there to see if there's anything left."

Requires Arcane Dimensions v1.81 or later (NOT included).

Note: probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: sock, mfx, necros, Lunaran, Scampie, FifthElephant, ionous, EricW, Preach
file.title: Arcane Dimensions 1.42
file.description:
This is version 1.42 - the newer, more feature-rich version 1.5 is available here.

Large-scale single player campaign with many new levels, some of them labeled as "test" maps, featuring a whole line-up of new monsters and items as well as several tweaks and changes to the gameplay. It is also meant to serve as a tool box for level designers. Map and QC sources are included.

Note: These maps require an engine port with increased limits, support for BSP2 and transparent textures. They are designed to be played with QuakeSpasm 0.91.0 or later.

A patch is available here.

file.author: sock, mfx, necros, Lunaran, Scampie, FifthElephant, ionous, EricW, Preach, PulSaR, necros, others
file.title: Arcane Dimensions 1.50
file.description:
Large-scale single player campaign with many new levels, some of them labeled as "test" maps, featuring a whole line-up of new monsters and items as well as several tweaks and changes to the gameplay. It is also meant to serve as a tool box for level designers. Map and QC sources are included.

This is version 1.5 which features even more new levels, enemies, items, and level functions. A patch for 1.5 is available here.

Note: These maps require an engine port with increased limits as well as support for BSP2 and transparent textures. They are mainly designed to be played with QuakeSpasm 0.92.0 or later.

file.author: sock, mfx, necros, Lunaran, Scampie, FifthElephant, ionous, EricW, Preach, PulSaR, necros, Giftmacher, others
file.title: Arcane Dimensions 1.70
file.description:
Large-scale single player campaign with many new levels, some of them labeled as "test" maps, featuring a whole line-up of new monsters and items as well as several tweaks and changes to the gameplay. Furthermore, it is meant to serve as a tool box for level designers, offering a large number of modified and new things to use in custom-made maps. Map and QC sources are included.

This is version 1.7 which includes various bug-fixes, additional features, and two new maps in addtition to ad_sepulcher.

Note: These maps (and likely all subsequent maps based on AD) require a source port with increased limits as well as support for BSP2 and transparent textures. Quakespasm 0.93+ is strongly recommended.

An additional bug-fix patch is available: here

file.author: sock
file.title: Arcane Dimensions 1.70 Patch 1
file.description:
Arcane Dimensions version 1.71 patch featuring various bug-fixes and an additional level: a remake/remix of Ademantine Cruelty.

Note: This patch requires Arcane Dimensions 1.70 to be installed.

file.author: sock, Bal, mfx, necros, Lunaran, Scampie, FifthElephant, ionous, EricW, Preach, PulSaR, necros, Giftmacher, others
file.title: Arcane Dimensions 1.81
file.description:
Large-scale single player campaign with many new levels, some of them labeled as "test" maps, featuring a whole line-up of new monsters and items as well as several tweaks and changes to the gameplay. Furthermore, it is meant to serve as a tool box for level designers, offering a large number of modified and new things to use in custom-made maps. Map and QC sources are included.

This is version 1.8 (including patch 1) which includes various bug-fixes, additional features, and four additional maps: Grendel's Blade and Nyarlathoteps Sand Castle as well as Ak-Alakha by PulSaR and Tears of the False God by Bal.

Note: These maps (and all subsequent maps based on AD) require a source port with increased limits as well as support for BSP2 and transparent textures. Quakespasm 0.93+ is strongly recommended.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: A Desert Dusk
file.description:
Large desert themed SP level that also supports coop and deathmatch.
Design and gameplay are top-notch, the style is very original. Uses some SOA entities.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: ADD2: Scorpion Garrison
file.description: Sequel of "A Desert Dusk" - Large desert themed SP level that also supports coop and deathmatch. Design and gameplay are top-notch, the style is very original. Uses some SOA entities.

file.author: czg & Greenwood
file.title: Aerospace Vitriol
file.description:
Large DOOM-style UAC base, using Lun3DM3 textures, made from two unfinished maps by czg.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.7 and a source port with increased limits

file.author: DeSoto
file.title: The Ascent from Hell
file.description: Medium sized, confusing mashup of texture themes with some paintings by H.R. Giger, Boris Vallejo and Olivia.

file.author: Kevin Haley
file.title: Abode of Agony
file.description: Small to medium blueish medieval map with a few nasty traps.

file.author: Dr. Gomez Inigo Bombay
file.title: House of Bombay
file.description: Medium sized map with barely average gameplay and horrible textures.

file.author: nathnolt
file.title: AI Textures
file.description:
A small weird experimental map for vanilla Quake, using custom made AI-generated textures with Stable Diffusion. Map source file is included. "No real monsters."

"I think that more people should make new and unique stuff, rather than creating maps that are like Quake maps. I also think that people should release stuff with less effort. I have created a ton of levels for Mega Man Maker, and that game has a lot more variety. Certainly a lot of great stuff, but also a lot of experimental stuff and bad stuff, made very quickly."

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: AlekswithaK
file.title: Cradle
file.description:
Around medium-sized blue brick level.

Note: This map requires Copper.

file.author: Cocerello
file.title: Pleasant murder
file.description: A small base map originally created by the author in 1997.

file.author: Neil Manke, Einar Saukas (QC)
file.title: Road to Inverurie
file.description: First map of the Alba TC. Set in 14th century Scotland. A small canyon level.

file.author: Neil Manke, Einar Saukas (QC)
file.title: Inverurie
file.description: Second map of the Alba TC. Set in 14th century Scotland. A dark medium-sized town with several houses, cellars, a chapel and a cemetary.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: The Savage Sanguine
file.description: Fourth in the Mel Soaring series, this map has you invading the mid-size base known as Sanguine. The level design looks great, a rusty old Strogg base, but is a bit confusing for having extra doors that lead to rooms you've already been in. The gameplay is solid as most other user-created maps. You start with both shotguns and a nailgun. There is a new enemy, Snakeman, who attacks you with two uzis which make a slightly faster nailgun. The final area may be a little tough for making you fight four Snakemen then two Shamblers in an area with only a pillar for cover. The pillar doesn't even help you since the Shamblers come from both sides of the room...

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Egyptian Myth
file.description: An excellent large Egyptian temple themed map that will keep you in the action almost the whole time. The level's new textures and geometry compliment each other quite nicely. The gameplay is very tight and recomended for intermediate Quake players. Every room has at least two enemies and often times after defeating them, a new set of enemies will spawn in the same room and assault you much by suprise. Most of the level contains Hell Knights followed by Knights, a few Shamblers & Vores, and the new Snakeman, who attacks you with two uzis (much like a nailgun). There is even a High Hell Knight for a boss, but he is mostly as tough as a Vore.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Charmhood
file.description: Small deathmatch level with a unique style and wave-based arena combat in SP mode. A DM-only version is included as well.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Permutations of the Rotten
file.description:
"A new Nehahra episode by a non-Nehahra member, with a new story and setting. I believe the original idea of Quake was to be a dark world of rotting metal, wood and brick medieval, full of horrible monsters. The addition of base maps didn't help this theme at all. This is the way I imagined Nehahra to be, medieval fortresses combined with wastelands and industrial regions. So, inspired by Zerstorer, I set out to create a mini-episode that is dark and scary. Industrial mixed with medieval and metal, using ID's textures."

Four about medium sized tough maps in a strange and unique Metal-ish theme. Nice.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Grisly Manifest
file.description: Large interconnected blue/brown Wizard map with several new monsters such as deadlier Ogres, axe knights, improved Hell Knights and the Scourge from SOA; a few new textures and quite tough gameplay. Nice.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Fearcraft
file.description: "Three small-medium sized levels that are almost a horror Hexen2 theme. The setting is a dark fantasy castle showing hints of industrial growth, built upon terrain and cliffs, and disappearing into the void. The last in the 'Alk' series, it wouldn't be an Alk map without the onslaught of custom monsters. Fearcraft includes the SOA enemies, Baron, Axeman and some tougher Quake monsters. Not high in difficulty, Fearcraft will provide some enjoyable gameplay." Nice.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: The Looming Madness
file.description: Large egyptian map with a unique mix of textures. Features a few custom monsters such as the SOA goblin and the Snakeman.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Brumal Quest
file.description: Large snowy medieval village, using Daikatana and Hexen2 textures, and coming with snow-themed monster skins.

file.author: Alkado
file.title: The Alkado Adventure
file.description: Episode with seven small levels varying in theme, including start and boss map. Most monsters and items have new, strange-looking skins and sounds, some custom weapon models (e.g. from zer), and a bunch of new textures.

file.author: Bal, Bloodshot, bmFbr, Greenwood, grome, Juzley, khreathor, Makkon, Mista Heita, Scampie, Shamblernaut, zigi
file.title: Alkaline
file.description:
Nine large, open industrial/base levels and a starting hub map. The underlying mod features a large number new and modified enemies, weapons and additional content like models, sounds, skyboxes and music tracks for each map. It is also meant to serve as a general toolbox for base-themed levels.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Bal, Bloodshot, bmFbr, DragonsForLunch, EmeraldTiger, Greenwood, Grome, Juzley, Makkon, Mazu, Mista Heita, Paul Lawitzki, Scampie, zigi
file.title: Alkaline 1.1
file.description:
Version 1.1 update of Alkaline, featuring fixes and polish to the original levels as well as several additional maps, enemies and music tracks.

Thirteen large, open industrial/base levels and a starting hub map. The underlying mod features a large number new and modified enemies, weapons and additional content like models, sounds, skyboxes and music tracks for each map. It is also meant to serve as a general toolbox for base-themed levels.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: alexUnder, Bal, Daizenzetsu, DragonsForLunch, EmeraldTiger, ionous & Chris Holden, Greenwood, Myki, Paul Lawitzki, RadiatorYang, Shadesmaster
file.title: Alkaline Jam
file.description:
Community map pack based on the Alkaline mod (included), featuring ten base-themed levels in various sizes and texture sets plus a start hub map. Comes with custom skyboxes and music tracks in addition to the new enemies and items from the mod.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Jeff Popplewell
file.title: The Alpha Project
file.description:
Small Base map, around id quality.
[This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip here]

file.author: Darin McNeil
file.title: ALSC Deathtrap
file.description: A office-like deathmatch map that has a few monster in SP too. Marbleous...

file.author: Alterzero
file.title: Alter's Hangar
file.description: Remake of E1M1 from DOOM: a small base map using mixed texture themes. The map source is included.

file.author: Travis Pease
file.title: Altus Mors
file.description: Small, poorly constructed mixed texture map.

file.author: Esrael
file.title: Amphitheater Of Abaddon
file.description:
Small to medium-sized Wizard-style level. It is the follow-up to The Subterrestrial Hangar and as such again features three distinct route choices. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Magicman
file.title: Anaconda
file.description: A short map where most action happens underwater. Comes with a new dual-uzi snake monster and a big boss snake.

file.author: Ankh
file.title: Ananke 17
file.description: A very short but appealing space/tech map.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert & Murderous Martin
file.title: An Old, Old Evil
file.description:
"This is the remnants of a project Tronyn and Murderous Martin worked on in 1997. It contains modified weapons and monsters mainly, as well as some experimental effects."

Barely an alpha version, slightly fixed up by aguirRe in 2006 - only listed here for archival purposes. The maps are unfinished and barely playable, either because they are bugged, lack monsters/gameplay, or are excessively hard. Furthermore, the cheat codes are disabled.

A few of the maps/areas eventually appeared in other projects by Tronyn, namely Soul of Evil and The Masque of Red Death. See anevil_readme.txt for more information.

file.author: Rob Marton
file.title: Anonca base: The shamblin
file.description: Medium sized blue metal base map with a unique theme.

file.author: Rob Marton
file.title: Anonca base 3
file.description: Medium sized blue metal base map with a unique theme.

file.author: Paul Cook
file.title: ANOXIA
file.description: A room with brushes in it.

file.author: John "metlslime" Fitzgibbons
file.title: Antediluvian
file.description: Medium sized Metal level inspired by "The Wind Tunnels" (e3m5), already started in 2001 but only finished four years later. A map with a strong old-school flair.

file.author: Impel Development Team
file.title: Abyss Of Pandemonium - The Final Mission v2.0
file.description: The previously commercial missionpack "Abyss Of Pandemonium" (aka impel) has been bugfixed and improved to be freely released in 2008. 2 single player episodes (11 maps) in decent to nice quality.

file.author: Impel Productions
file.title: Abyss of Pandemonium
file.description:
Two episode pack featuring 16 new levels (10 single player/6 deathmatch), six new foes, four new weapons, one power-up.
Very nice, despite a few mostly minor bugs.

Note: aop2m2 on hard skill can only be played in a high-limit engine.

file.author: Rutger Baks
file.title: Around the World!
file.description: Small egyptian map with a base part. Was created for speedrunning but works for the casual player too. ;)

file.author: Andrew 'than' Palmer
file.title: Pretend Dead Friend
file.description: Small wizard-style deathmatch arena with single player settings. The map source is included (in standard and WC format).

file.author: MERLIN
file.title: Make-shift Apocalypse Shelter
file.description: Very small cramped house/flat. The yellow armor is the exit.

file.author: Andrew 'than' Palmer
file.title: The Final Threat
file.description:
Medium to large, interconnected, professionally built IKBase map. Features the Mega Enforcer from Zerstörer.

Note: Some engine ports render the elevator at the beginning in the wrong position (not a critical bug). A hotfix is available for ports that support .ent files.

file.author: Andrew 'than' Palmer
file.title: Plumbers Don't Wear Ties (But They Do Carry Shotguns)
file.description:
A large submerged base with great attention to detail and exploratory gameplay. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Quoth and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Andrew 'than' Palmer
file.title: Subterranean Library
file.description:
Large ruined subterranean library with tight corridors, bloodfalls and eerie atmosphere. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Quoth and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Roger Staines
file.title: The Ancient Aqueduct
file.description: Fairly large aqueduct level split into three color sections, and some underwater bits. OK.

file.author: Jago
file.title: Apinaraivo / Monkey Rage
file.description: Large and exessively detailed IKbase level using some SOA entities and the Mega-Enforcer.

file.author: Matt Sefton
file.title: Arcane
file.description: Medium sized Metal/runic level.

file.author: Tronyn, PulSaR, PM
file.title: Arcanum
file.description:
Single player episode with five huge maps by Tronyn and Pulsar. Epic in style and scale. Tough battles with high numbers of enemies. Many modified and new monsters, weapons and items. Very hard. Includes a start map by distrans.

Note: These maps require Drake and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Tronyn & PM
file.title: Arcanum Demo
file.description: Small sized palace/catacomb map with a lot of close combat and strong Zerstörer vibes. A foretaste of an upcoming the upcoming "Arcanum" project.

file.author: Tronyn
file.title: Arcanum Bonus Maps
file.description: Two maps originally supposed to be featured as bonus levels in Arcanum. The first one is a small mediaval/fantasy cathedral - a remake of Heretic's E1M6, complete with original textures and music. The second one is a medium-sized arcane industrial complex with a similar vibe as Towers of Wrath from Dissolution of Eternity.

file.author: Isaac Barry (aka Clorox)
file.title: Arcol
file.description: Medium size Base map: some sort of pyramid. Barely average.

file.author: Murat Deligonul
file.title: Area 51
file.description: Ugly medium-sized Base map.

file.author: Anders Gustavsson
file.title: Area 51
file.description: Three small space base maps with unusual but not necessarily bad new textures. OK.

file.author: Bad Ash
file.title: Arenaq
file.description: Large leaked room with monsters and many rockets. Can only be played in a high-limit engine due to excessive lightmaps. Map source is included.

file.author: HeadThump
file.title: Ariadat
file.description: Fairly large wizard level.

file.author: Matthias Worch
file.title: Armageddon 2
file.description: Small Metal level.

file.author: Scott McNutt
file.title: Armour of God
file.description: Medium sized Wizard map. OK.

file.author: mariteaux
file.title: Arrogant Erratum & The Kuras Stronghold
file.description:
Two medium/large blue-themed maps plus a start map and a battle arena, featuring elements from some of the original Quake levels and certain old custom maps. Comes with three music tracks. The map sources are included.

Note: These levels require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Arttis
file.title: Feindlich Sewers v1.0
file.description:
UPDATE, 31 October 2022: v1.2 fixes a bug with the silver key. v1.0 is obsolete and not recommended.

Medium sized castle / medieval sewers map with Makkon textures. Requires Copper v1.19+ (NOT included). The author's first release.

"My first map that is finished and not been overhauled. Takes place in an underground sewer that is overtaken with over 100 monsters, has 4 secrets (+ 1 super secret) and full set of weapons. Takes about 10 minutes to complete."

NOTE: probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: Arttis
file.title: Feindlich Sewers v1.2
file.description:
Medium sized castle / medieval sewers map with Makkon textures. Requires Copper v1.19+ (NOT included). The author's first release.

Version 1.2 fixes a bug with the silver key.

"My first map that is finished and not been overhauled. Takes place in an underground sewer that is overtaken with over 100 monsters, has 4 secrets (+ 1 super secret) and full set of weapons. Takes about 10 minutes to complete."

NOTE: probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: PM & Tronyn
file.title: A Roman Wilderness Of Pain
file.description: Mini-episode consisting of three large levels and a start map. The maps follow an evil metal-egyptian-flesh texture theme and include many modified and new monsters, new items and weapons as well as other custom code (see arwop.txt). The episode also features background music inspired by The Doors (can be turned off with "impulse 17") and a hidden fifth difficulty mode. The gameplay is fast and very hard, blending in with the strong 'Doom vibe' it conveys - especially the boss battle is extremely tough.

file.author: Asl
file.title: Io. Lava Cleaning Base
file.description:
Large industrial factory/refinery level with a few arcane elements.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Asl
file.title: Io. Brimstoneburg.
file.description:
Large lava castle / tomb map for vanilla Quake. Difficulty settings are not implemented and all skill levels will play the same (436 monsters and 25 secrets).

"City Brimstoneburg on Jupiter's moon Io, where teleportation energy was produced from sulfur was attacked by Quake monsters."

Note: due to large map size, likely requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: Stuart Maine
file.title: Assassin
file.description: Medium-sized blue Metal map with a lot of spikes.

file.author: The Harb!ngeR of Fish
file.title: Assault
file.description: A mini-campaign with 5 small maps and a start map. New textures (e.g. Quake2 and Half-Life), some new code bits and sounds,as well as a few new monsters such as spiders and turrets. Starting with a shuttle crash, you fight your way through a collapsing enemy base in order to reach the rescuing teleporter. The idea is neat, but the levels lack in size and detail.

file.author: Dennis Katsonis
file.title: Astrus Base
file.description: Large, dark, mostly Wizard map with outdoor areas. Barely OK.

file.author: Phil Daniels
file.title: Trinity Asylum
file.description: Medium sized mental asylum with new textures, some SOA code/monsters, and a few Duke Nukem remarks.

file.author: Charles Daniel
file.title: The Asylum
file.description: Around medium-sized poorly designed and ugly "asylum". This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: ATF Team
file.title: After The Fall
file.description:
Total conversion featuring "18 new levels, 112 new models, 100's of new sounds, over 400 new textures, max size progs.dat", and other custom stuff - pretty much everything replaced.
The new textures, enemies and sounds are very strange. This is only for hardcore people or those who want to try something radically different.

file.author: Bruce W. Krueger
file.title: Atlantis
file.description: Small temple-themed level set on Atlantis, featuring two new enemy types: female temple guardians and hilarious pouncing jaws.

file.author: Jeff Aranyi
file.title: Atrocity
file.description: Medium sized brick map, somewhat reminiscent of Kingpin?! OK.

file.author: Auhsan
file.title: Firestarter
file.description: Small base map for the Badpak mod.

file.author: alexUnder
file.title: Amusement Inferno
file.description:
Medium sized dark fantasy castle map with industrial bits, with textures by Makkon. Map source and custom music is included. Requires Copper v1.19+ (NOT included).

"My first solo map. [...] Non-linear and therefore a bit confusing. Also map introduces some sort of stealth gameplay with the ability to eliminate some of the ambushes if appropriate secrets are found in time. All in all experience is harder than vanilla, closer to DOMA difficulty."

Note: probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: human[rus]
file.title: Early Autumn
file.description:
Large, spacious and somewhat empty castle with a focus on unusual shapes. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: David Kelvin
file.title: More Furious Madness from the Massed Gadgets of Auximenies
file.description: A showcase map for the "Director patch", nicely rotating entities and fun cutscenes. Worth a look and delivering a laugh.

file.author: Ben Watson
file.title: Avatar
file.description: Medium sized brick map with some questionable custom texture additions.

file.author: Andrew "Starfire21" White
file.title: Caelestis Tumultus
file.description: Large Wizard? map with a strange theme and some neat gameplay twists. OK.

file.author: Eric Stevens (Axeme)
file.title: axeme7
file.description: "designed mainly for deathmatch", newbie map.

file.author: skacky
file.title: A Quick One Before Azathoth Devours Fodrian
file.description: Small to medium-sized Knave-themed level. The map source and a texture wad are included.

file.author: Greg Watters
file.title: Inferno, The Plains of Purgatory
file.description: A pack of two maps that evokes the long blue corridors of e4m7 Azure Agony. (Don't miss the hint about going back to the start!)

file.author: GrazzasOnlyFan
file.title: Azure Moon
file.description:
A large base-themed map inspired by Half-Life 1 / Black Mesa with a ton of blue and green lighting, hence the name. The author's first release.

"My first Quake map and definitely not the last - I kept enemy numbers low (for such a big map) because I didn't want it to be super hard or anything, and I kind of just wanted a map that put into action everything I'd learned in Trenchbroom. Enjoy!"

Notes: Difficulty settings are not implemented. Map source is included. Probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: Noel Weer
file.title: Azurette
file.description: Medium sized map in azure/blue style.

file.author: c0j
file.title: Alena Kingdom
file.description: Small / medium brick castle in classic style. Note that only skill 1 (Normal) difficulty setting is implemented. Map source is included.

file.author: Marc Fontaine
file.title: Tower of Babel
file.description: Conversion of Doom's E2M7, complete with a Cyberdemon monster.

file.author: LTH
file.title: Forwards Compatible
file.description: A big rusty metal (rubicon) space station.

file.author: sock
file.title: Backsteingotik
file.description:
Large brick-style dungeon with wind tunnels. It has a built-in skill selection area and comes with custom medieval items. The map source is included in the PAK.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Derrick Dela Cruz
file.title: My BADASS Level
file.description: Medium sized map with mixed textures and a Cyberdemon arena fight in the end.

file.author: The_Pirate
file.title: Bad Decision
file.description: Small factory with machinery, a storage area and an office floor. The map source is included.

file.author: Chris Spain
file.title: BadLand1 : Break-In
file.description: Part of the BadLands series: Small medieval map with a church.

file.author: Chris Spain
file.title: BadLand2 : Countdown
file.description: Part of the BadLands series: Small military base with an underground rocket depot.

file.author: Chris Spain
file.title: BadLands : Mission HQ
file.description: Start map for the BadLands series (badland1 and badland2).

file.author: Ironhammer
file.title: Badpak
file.description: Small episode with 4 maps of medium size, each with a different texture theme (Base, Metal, Wizard) and a few custom monsters, namely grenade Grunts, nail and rocket Enforcers, and a buggy, poorly executed and out-of-place nail goblin (or something). There is hardly any information in the text file; apparently, the pack was released in an unfinished state, hence the ugly console image and the lack of a boss map. However, the four featured maps are very nice.

file.author: Bario
file.title: Pigro
file.description:
The author's first map. A small wizard-themed interior of a house, and some base/grotto bits.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Bario
file.title: Bario3
file.description: A four-level campaign with chemical lab, a sewer system, and a dark forest. A few new textures and reskinned monsters. The levels are dark and quite cramped.

file.author: Greenwood
file.title: Bunker of Barzai
file.description: Medium-sized metal/runic dungeon; uses a few custom textures.

file.author: Daniel Mikkelsen
file.title: Base-ic Instinct
file.description: Small base map with some metal textures.

file.author: Andrzej Mackiewicz
file.title: BASE-N
file.description: Small base-y map with a pool, traps and an outside area.

file.author: Peter Bisseker (tiddles)
file.title: Base-X2
file.description: Small, linear rusty metal/stone base map.

file.author: Biff Debris
file.title: Fort Ratsack
file.description: A fast and frantic base map for Quoth. Sweet looks and nice gameplay.

file.author: Doug Magee
file.title: Basetunnels Vertigo
file.description: Small base map with a focus on monster closets.

file.author: Ace
file.title: Missle Bunker Bravo 7 & The Bastardry
file.description: Two small maps: An orange base and a Wizard castle with a few tricks to kill monsters more easily.

file.author: Jason Ng
file.title: Battle at Home
file.description: Very small, leaked, custom textured house with a basement but no exit. Pointless.

file.author: Matthias Worch
file.title: Beyond Belief
file.description:
E1-style SP episode that features 8 small to medium-sized levels as well as a new start map - all of which also support co-op mode and DM - a few new textures, and a modified Chthon boss.

Note: There is a glitch in the sixth map that prevents the player from escaping a spike trap in modern engine ports. Here is a hotfix.

file.author: Matthias Worch
file.title: A Past and Future Secret
file.description: Medium-sized medieval stronghold surrounded by rocks and lava. A classic-style level in the spirit of Beyond Belief. The map source is included.

file.author: Matthias Worch & negke
file.title: Beyond Belief (in one map)
file.description:
This is the 1997 classic Q1SP episode Beyond Belief merged into a single level (excluding the start map).

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits and BSP2 support.

file.author: Darren Stabler
file.title: Basic Castle
file.description: "A Huge Level made to sort of resemble a castle" with the author's own editor (actually a bunch of simple brush editors).

file.author: The Partisan
file.title: B.C. Dwellings
file.description: Small watery caverns with a castle in Wizard style.

file.author: Kid
file.title: The Beaches Of Hell
file.description: Outdoor lava level, themed like an infernal beach.

file.author: Cristian Martinez
file.title: The Bellesh Base
file.description: Small base map. Includes a version with fewer monsters (ebellesh.bsp).

file.author: Leonardi
file.title: Berthe, Mistress of Novices
file.description: Small beginner's base map. Comes with a custom music track. The map source is included.

file.author: F14m3z
file.title: Bilious Outpost
file.description: Very small medieval level made for speedrunning.

file.author: Albert van Zyl
file.title: Binding Tower
file.description:
Large map with a castle in a dark forest. Comes with a custom skybox and the map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits and BSP2 support.

file.author: Cullen Wheeler
file.title: The Biogenetic Forge
file.description:
Smallish Basemetal map. Very basic in the looks department but features somewhat interesting rotation puzzles.

Note: This map has to be played with Scourge of Armagon.

file.author: Pritchard
file.title: Biome (Mr. Self Destruct)
file.description:
Industrial-themed 1024³ level with a lava-flooded foundry, a humid cave system and an icy outside area; originally started for the Xmas Jam 2019. It uses custom textures from various sources and comes with a new skybox. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Moz, Speedy, Tron, voodoochopstiks
file.title: Impromptu Speedmaps
file.description:
Four impromptu Speedmaps put together using the common theme of a texture wad thrown together by Speedy.
Nothing exciting but entertaining for some minutes if you like Speedmaps.

file.author: Drakkon (C.D. Roberts)
file.title: Bloodstone
file.description: Small to medium Metal map. "Upgraded" version of Decon.

file.author: Tony Boyer
file.title: Blister
file.description: Very small, plain Metal map. Barely average.

file.author: Tony Boyer
file.title: Blister2
file.description: Small, simple brick level with a few custom window textures.

file.author: alex_mmc & Skorly, bmFbr, Chris Holden, DragonsForLunch, FifthElephant, gnemeth, Greenwood, ish, Mista Heita, Myki, onetruepurple, Pinchy, Quasiotter, Qmaster, Shadesmaster, zigi
file.title: Blue Monday Jam
file.description:
"Blue"-themed community map pack with 15 mostly small to medium-sized levels including a start map. It comes with a few high-res textures, custom skyboxes, and music tracks. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require Quoth 2.2 and a source port supporting the -quoth commandline switch. Additionally, for some of these maps it must have increased limits and/or BSP2 support.

file.author: bmFbr
file.title: The Doomed Cathedral
file.description:
Medium-sized cathedral with a base area. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: bmFbr
file.title: The Mountains of Insanity
file.description:
Large level with a secret military research base in the mountains built on top of a runic/metal dungeon. It is based on the Progs_dump mod (included) and comes with a few modified models and a custom skybox. The map and QC sources are included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits

file.author: Jim Hendrickson
file.title: Bridges & Towers
file.description: Large interconnected Metal level.

file.author: Jim Hendrickson
file.title: The Hallowed Halls
file.description: Small to medium-sized wizmetal map with nice looks but somewhat easily confusing layout - similar-looking corridors demand a little exploration. It is meant as the successing map to bnt. OK.

file.author: spy
file.title: Tower Of Dal Gurak
file.description: A big castle using Quake III textures. Remake of a map with the same name from the game Blade of Darkness. Ok.

file.author: Dennis Katsonis
file.title: The Borax Factor
file.description: Pretty huge and pretty dull basemap.

file.author: Dennis Katsonis
file.title: Borax 3
file.description: Large Wizard mansion with a number of new textures. It also features some oversized furniture and computer terminals, and a graveyard.

file.author: Fairweather, Greenwood, Markie Music, Mazu, Shamblernaut, Voidforce
file.title: We got bored lol
file.description: Six small ~2-hour speedmaps + a start hub, all following different themes and based on the Copper mod (included). It comes with a custom music track. The map sources are included.

file.author: GreenHornet aka., Steven Anderson
file.title: The Borg
file.description:
The Borg cube from the Star Trek series, with new monster skins and sounds. Unfortunately, the map is utter crap - ugly, confusing, buggy.
Listen to the author: "Resistence is NOT futile!"

file.author: Tekno Tom
file.title: The Boss
file.description:
This is an attempt at a Chthon map, and not a good one at all. It's very buggy; you can press the switch that causes Chthon to spawn multiple times, which he will do.

Note: this map is designed to be used with Dave Weiden's mod (included), which modifies Chthon's behaviour and, among other things, makes him killable with regular weapons.

This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Zakalwe (Judson Eiloart)
file.title: Breakout
file.description: Medium sized Base map with a bunker/turrets area and a few custom textures. Originally designed for the Navy Seals mod. OK.

file.author: Brendy Caldwell
file.title: Big Boy's Birthday Party
file.description:
Large, open medieval castle with courtyards, a throne room, a wine cellar, and a dungeon. Comes with a custom skybox. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Brendy Caldwell
file.title: Hard Driven
file.description: Medium / large-feeling metal sci-fi playground with Makkon3 textures. "Big Boy is defragging his hard drive. He must be stopped." Map source is included.

file.author: Jason Booth
file.title: Bridges to the Highlands
file.description: Three small, boxed/leaked, ugly Medieval/Wizard/ Basemix maps. Comes with a simple skill selection map and a pointless linking map.

file.author: George Grotans
file.title: Bridges
file.description:
Lava with walkways above it and demonfaced-walls.
Note: This file was originally called bridges.zip
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: QBrt
file.title: brt01q1
file.description: Very small Medieval level. The author's first map.

file.author: QBrt
file.title: brt04q1
file.description: Small blue newbie map.

file.author: QBrt
file.title: brt06q1
file.description: Small blue/red bricks level. Barely average.

file.author: QBrt
file.title: brt07q1
file.description: Small and quite unfair blue brick Medieval map. Barely average.

file.author: QBrt
file.title: brt08hip
file.description: Same as brt08q1 but with -hipnotic monsters.

file.author: QBrt
file.title: brt08q1
file.description: Small to medium-sized red/blue brick level with some cave bit at the end. Lots of samey rooms.

file.author: Lord Asaki
file.title: BSQM Safe
file.description: Large April's fools level: long corridors with over 400 enemies, a rapid-fire shotgun, kickable gibs and Ranger voice-overs from Quake Champions. The qc source files are included.

file.author: Rob Albin
file.title: Bridge to Fire
file.description: Medium to large Medieval map with a few other textures mixed in, and confusing progression. Barely average.

file.author: Quiet-Emerald
file.title: Beneath The Mountain
file.description:
Large dungeon ruins beneath a mountain with a lava-filled central hall.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Bubbah
file.title: Bubbah's Slate
file.description: Very small metal map with a slate.

file.author: The Bubbah
file.title: Bubbah's Lair
file.description: Small odd Wizard level. Map sources are included.

file.author: Repus
file.title: Building
file.description: Mini-episode - a large brick building spanning across several maps which the player travels up and down trough. Mostly plain brick/mixed texture style with a somewhat maze-like and confusing layout. Barely average.

file.author: MadFox
file.title: Burgt
file.description: Large, somewhat confusing Wizard castle with several water and outdoor areas.

file.author: Sid
file.title: My Own Prison
file.description: A rather plain map. Starting outdoors in a metal theme, it goes into an zombie-infested underwater castle, and finishes in a lava/brick environment.

file.author: Jean-Pierre Raumer
file.title: Burrow
file.description: Medium-sized plain caverns level.

file.author: Chris Williams
file.title: Butcher Base
file.description: Medium sized boxy and ugly map with mixed texture themes.

file.author: Perro Seco
file.title: City 2000
file.description: A mini-episode consisting of three small urban realism-style maps, with some emphasis on exploration.

file.author: Nolcoz
file.title: Cutscene Test Map
file.description: Small non-playable machinima-type of map, made as a show-case for the cutscene features in the Progs_dump mod (included). It comes with a few new models, sounds, sprites and a music track. The map source is included.

file.author: Psycho
file.title: The Castle Amber
file.description: Small to medium-sized medieval castle with a dungeon and a lava cave beneath.

file.author: Ozzy Farinas
file.title: Canyon's Abode
file.description: Medium sized map, dark and cramped caves/canyon that lead to a dark and cramped abode. Quite hard.

file.author: Mick Brown
file.title: The Canal
file.description: Fairly large wizard canal system with boats, sluices and a cool flood wave. Quite hard.

file.author: Michael Cullum
file.title: The FloodGate
file.description: Medium sized, interconnected canal/water complex with a small medieval temple. It's OK.

file.author: Hrimfaxi
file.title: Cappuccino: The refill
file.description: Medium sized gothic fortress with Q3A textures <small>(second version)</small>. Very nice.

file.author: Benjamin "The Harb!ngeR of Fish" Martyn Skinner
file.title: The Cargo Hulk for STORM
file.description: Apparently a deathmatch map with some monsters thrown in. Not worth it.

file.author: Andrew Smith
file.title: Carnage
file.description: Medium sized Metal map.

file.author: Michael Casaday
file.title: Hell in a Can
file.description:
A medium sized cargo spacecraft with Zer and IKBase textures and somewhat unusual gameplay. There are three missions to be completed in which "you'll face all kinds of problems, from technical difficulties to unruly 'cargo'."

Note: Make sure the autoexec.cfg is loaded as it contains necessary key aliases (press F1 in game for a description of their functions).

file.author: sodalimonada176
file.title: The Beastial Castle
file.description:
A small classic-style medieval castle map. The author's first release.

Note: custom music is included, but unfortunately it is packaged in the wrong folder relative to the map files and requires manually moving files to the correct place after unzipping. Thus, the custom music won't work if installed via Quake Injector.

file.author: Paul Keefner
file.title: Castle Attack
file.description:
Medium-sized medieval castle map. Map source and custom skybox is included. Custom music is included too, but the map hasn't been configured to use it.

"This is my 3rd single player map. [...] I have a long way to go but still having fun with it."

file.author: Steve Rescoe
file.title: Castled!
file.description: Smallish castle. OK.

file.author: JCorvinus
file.title: Castle of Depravity
file.description: Small Wizard-style brick level with a runic finish.

file.author: unknown
file.title: no title
file.description: Arena fight in an oversized church. Needs to be played in a limit-removing engine due to excessive lightmaps.

file.author: Mike Melzer
file.title: The Catacombs
file.description: Small mine/catacombs/rooms map with mixed texture themes. Barely average.

file.author: RickyT23
file.title: Catatonic Fits of Despair
file.description:
Medium-sized spacious metal/runic-style fortress.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits (fog support recommended).

file.author: MadFox
file.title: In the Cave
file.description: Large cave/castle map. Requires some exploration. OK.

file.author: JerkOff (Mike Daugherty)
file.title: Cavern of Sin
file.description: A small and newbie-ish map with different styles. Pretty hard and dark. This version was fixed by jdhack, the original was crashing.

file.author: CommonCold
file.title: Adon's Quota
file.description:
Small space base arena map inspired by Turok 2, made for the official Horde Mode in the Dimension of the Machine expansion update in December 2021. Map source is included.

For best results in multiplayer, start with an official horde map first, then when in-game the host should use console command "map cchorde1" to change the level over.

Note: requires Dimension of the Machine (NOT included) and a modern engine / source port that can run the updated mg1 progs for horde mode. As of February 2022 that's basically just the official QuakeEx / Kex 2021 re-release engine, with inconvenient bugs in other source ports.

file.author: JPL
file.title: Castle of The Dark Ages
file.description:
Large, dark castle level with DKT3 textures.
Be sure to play it on a reasonably fast computer and in an engine supporting fog.

file.author: Sonya Roberts
file.title: Court Despair
file.description: Small medieval mansion with new textures.

file.author: Sonya Roberts
file.title: Destroy Base
file.description: A small to medium base map.

file.author: The Void (tim)
file.title: Cell Escape
file.description: Very small brick/base prison map.

file.author: Paul Keefner
file.title: Cemetery Castle
file.description:
Small castle courtyard map with a large cemetery, all in a classic style. The author's second release.

Note: only skill 1 ("Normal") is implemented. Map source is included.

file.author: nolcoz
file.title: The C.G.L Project
file.description:
Short arena-style map themed and timed to a techno music track.

Note: This map requires Quoth 2.2 a source port with support for external music.

file.author: Chris "Apollo" Houston
file.title: Higher-Synth
file.description: Medium sized green industrial map with Ogro and Jackboot textures. Gameplay becomes repetitive quickly.

file.author: Tyler McNamee
file.title: Cha Gheill
file.description: Large Wizard map with three linear 'arms' around a kind of hub. Comes with a simple skill selection map.

file.author: ChAiNeR
file.title: Dead Cell
file.description: Small Base warehouse. OK, but unnecessarily dark.

file.author: ChAiNeR
file.title: Twisted Fate
file.description: Medium sized, fairly dark Wizmetal map. OK.

file.author: John "metlslime" Fitzgibbons
file.title: The Crawling Chaos
file.description: Medium sized Wind Tunnels style Metal map with lots of slime.

file.author: necros
file.title: Are you yet Living?
file.description: Medium sized, somewhat nonlinear map using Knave textures.

file.author: Kell, necros, Eric, ionous, Vondur, Zwiffle
file.title: Contract Revoked: The Lost Chapters
file.description: Hub-based SP episode with 9 medium to large levels (including start and secret maps). Uses Knave textures and features new monsters/powerups - more information on Kell's website.

file.author: David Ottvall
file.title: Chess
file.description: A crampy confusing map with a "chess board" in the middle.

file.author: cheshire
file.title: Shrine of Skank
file.description: Small cramped metal map.

file.author: Quake Map Designer
file.title: Hospital Center Quake Map Designer
file.description: A hospital-based map. Basically a random deathmatch map with some zombies thrown in. Comes with two player skins for deathmatch (janitor and chef). Lots of fullbright pixels if you are using a GL engine.

file.author: Anders Gustafsson
file.title: Church
file.description:

Note: This map does not have an exit.

file.author: Sonnenblume
file.title: Cimmerian Night
file.description:
Three-map mini-episode with a small base level, a medium-sized nonlinear wizard-style map, and a large homage to E4M4- The Palace of Hate. It comes with custom music tracks. The map sources are incuded.

Note: The third map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Bal & Greenwood
file.title: The Circulation of Shadows
file.description:
Large underground industrial base with rocket silos and conveyor belts; and a small start map. It was originally started in 2005 for a Nehahra addon episode. It uses Daikatana textures and runs on the Rubicon 2 mod (included), featuring new and modified enemies and effects. Also comes with a music track and a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits

file.author: Russell "Krusty" Hayward
file.title: Citadel
file.description: Small linear tomb/citadel map - kind of odd, but still somewhat original brushwork in places...

file.author: Michael Reed
file.title: Citadel Of Doom
file.description: Medium sized Medieval citadel. OK.

file.author: George Grotans
file.title: City
file.description:
Small, dark and plain city with a few simple buildings and a 'zoo' arena.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Pete Jones
file.title: Secret Civilization
file.description: Small map inspired by some memorable areas in the first episode.

file.author: Chris Houston, 'Simulacrum'
file.title: The Katagean Redoubt
file.description: A big, interconnected, green-wizardish map with well thought-out secrets.

file.author: Glenn Ancheta
file.title: The Climb
file.description: Very small and plain vertical map with a few ogres. Pointless.

file.author: Käty Olup
file.title: Clock of Death
file.description:
Small / medium medieval castle level for vanilla Quake. The author's first release. Difficult settings are not implemented, map source is included.

"Quake level heavily influenced by love for castles and Stranger Things"

file.author: John Watson (Shoggoth)
file.title: The Cloning Facility
file.description: A large base, some non-linear gameplay in parts. Must be played with Scourge of Armagon.

file.author: Seth Williams
file.title: Close Quarters
file.description: Very small and very pointless medieval map.

file.author: JPL
file.title: Cheyenne Mountain Complex
file.description: Large underground base map with some Quake2 textures.

file.author: negke
file.title: Lower Forecourt
file.description:
A big, open, twisted, confusing, hard and unconventional coagula map. Sweet id texturing and a lot of fresh gameplay ideas. Can be frustating.

The progs.dat is for Darkplaces users only. Consult the readme in any case, you will regret it otherwise.

Note:
This map features two different game modes.

Skill 0/1: exploration mode (finding keys, pushing buttons, solving puzzles)
Skill 2: DMSP-like mode (deathmatch against monsters with respawning items)

file.author: Tim Elek
file.title: Coagula
file.description:
Small Metal space floater. Origin of the well-known Coagula style (tight space maps requiring the player to work his way upward).
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Tim Elek
file.title: Coagula2: Flesh
file.description:
Small Metal space level.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Tim Elek
file.title: Coagula3: Bone
file.description: Small blue/red space level using Daikatana textures. OK.

file.author: ericw, Golden boy, RickyT23, spy, Trinca, Willem, nonentity
file.title: Coagula Mappack #3
file.description:
Results of the third Coagula Contest (mid-2009):
Six small space maps by ericw, Golden boy, RickyT23, spy, Trinca, Willem, and a start map by nonentity. Some of them come with the map source and optional skyboxes.

file.author: Dilvish, Fat Controller, necros, Tronyn, Tim Elek
file.title: The Coagula Contest
file.description:
"This contest was run mid-September to mid-November of 2001, with the goal of creating maps in the tradition of Tim Elek's 'Coagula' series of maps - a series of structures floating in the void. The contest was run by Tronyn and the judges were Fern, Grindspire, and Xenon. The contest also includes a bit of custom QuakeC code, which was done by Necros.

There were 5 entries: Tronyn(2), Fat Controller, Dilvish, and Necros. In addition, a start map created by Tronyn is included, as well as the original Coagula series by Tim Elek."

file.author: Chainer, Pushplay, Tyrann, [anon], distrans, necros
file.title: The Coagula Contest 2
file.description:
Results of the second Coagula contest (judged by Underworldfan):

1st: tyrcoag: Outside In - Tyrann
2nd: pushcoag: The Vertical Mile - Pushplay
3rd: nesp10: Embers of Cruelty - necros
4th: jesus: Jesus Wants You - [anon]
4th: discoag2: Usher Recompiled - distrans
6th: chain3: Indigo - Chainer

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: Coven of Ebony
file.description:
Blue medieval episode with 4 levels (+start/end map), some new monsters and fairly tough gameplay.

Note: A patch is available here: coe_p.

file.author: Robert "Fat Controller" Cruickshank
file.title: Coven of Ebony PATCH
file.description: Coven of Ebony Patch - includes some tweaks to the COE code and a better-looking Necromancer model.

file.author: Speedy
file.title: Cogs Of Conflict
file.description: A nicely designed metal map with experimental gameplay. Instead of fighting the monsters directly, the player has to take a more stealth-based approach and lure them into traps.

file.author: Rebelvodka
file.title: Coliseum
file.description: Very small arena level.

file.author: Mark Turner
file.title: Colony
file.description: Medium sized map - a small base bit leading into a dark Wizard/brick dungeon.

file.author: Mark Turner
file.title: The Culling Station
file.description: Medium sized Base map with an outside area and a heavy tech bit.

file.author: epiplon
file.title: The Colosseum
file.description: Small colosseum/arena map with wave-based combat and a few environmental setups to lure monsters in. It features new weapons (sword, crossbow, lightning staff) and includes a custom skybox. The map and QC sources are included.

file.author: Ankh
file.title: Coma
file.description: Medium to large oldschool Wizard dungeon. OK.

file.author: Ace
file.title: Quake Combat School
file.description: Two small maps featuring a series of arena battles in rooms with varying texture themes. Somewhat challenging, but also somewhat boring.

file.author: Rick Troppman
file.title: The Comm Center
file.description: Medium sized base map inspired by The Slipgate Complex. Also features a few Ogres and Knights.

file.author: Fred Hite,Jr (DEVIANT)
file.title: COMPUGIB
file.description: Small metal map with some base textures. Nothing special.

file.author: Conrad Johnson
file.title: Con1
file.description: Very small rocky map.

file.author: Kell
file.title: Contract Revoked
file.description: Small episode consisting of 4 levels and a start map, with knave textures, some modified models and sounds.

file.author: Serge Jaeken
file.title: The Contract
file.description:
Medium-sized Knave-style flying cathedral with a courtyard and a crypt area. It comes with a start map and a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Anthony Hillman
file.title: Level by Tony Hillman
file.description:
The author's first map: A giant box with ugly textures, ugly lighting, ugly gameplay, ugly bugs and no exit.
Can only be played in a limit-removing engine.

file.author: Tom Cleghorn aka Murgatroyd
file.title: Trouble Down T'Pit
file.description: Medium sized Base/mine map with a Medieval temple area.

file.author: Ed Cope
file.title: Cope's first
file.description: Small base map with many unaligned textures.

file.author: Lunaran
file.title: Copper Quake
file.description:
A "Vanilla+" gameplay mod that introduces subtle tweaks to some of the game's core mechanics in order to make for a smoother experience. It is compatible with the original maps and most standard (id1-based) custom levels.

Summary:
  • Weapons fire is not blocked by monsters in death animations
  • Ring of Shadows makes enemies less accurate in combat
  • Vore missiles have a less-than-perfect turn rate
  • Ogres are 'partially' Z-aware
  • Zombie edge cases are fixed
  • Armor protection is proportional to current quantity
  • Nightmare skill is 50 max HP instead of turret-monsters
The mod is accompanied by a seperate custom episode: Underdark Overbright

Note: An updated version (1.17) is available here.

file.author: Lunaran
file.title: Copper - Version 1.11
file.description:
Updated version of Copper, featuring bug-fixes and further gameplay tweaks, particularly concerning coop mode. The mod source is included.

Note: This is a standalone version which does not require the previous one.
A newer version is available here.

file.author: Lunaran
file.title: Copper - Version 1.15
file.description:
Updated version of Copper, featuring bug-fixes and further gameplay tweaks. The mod source is included.

Note: This is a standalone version which does not require the previous one.

file.author: Lunaran
file.title: Copper - Version 1.16
file.description:
Updated version of Copper, featuring bug-fixes and further gameplay tweaks. The mod source is included.

Note: This is a standalone version which does not require the previous ones.

file.author: Lunaran
file.title: Copper - Version 1.17
file.description: Updated version of Copper, featuring bug-fixes and further gameplay tweaks, most notably compatibility to the KexQuake port from the official Quake "revitalization" update. The mod source is included.

file.author: Lunaran
file.title: Copper - Version 1.19
file.description:
Updated version of popular rebalance mod Copper. Best paired with the classic Underdark Overbright (pictured here).

Since the past major KEXQuake 2021 remaster compatibility update of v1.17, most of the new recent changes are small tweaks, improved mapper features, and bug fixes. The biggest gameplay change is probably from v1.18, where gibbed grunts and ogres now drop ammo.

Mod source is included.

file.author: Miko
file.title: The Core
file.description: Small ugly beginner map.

file.author: Gyro Gearloose
file.title: Corporal Punishment II
file.description: A small DM map with SP settings, ugly custom textures and modified Grunts (the progs.dat also includes some sort of DM/Team bots). This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Gyro Gearloose
file.title: Corporal Punishment
file.description: Strafing, jumping grunts. Lots of them. The map itself is not too bad but the gameplay is ...

file.author: Dogstar AKA Dan Thibadeau
file.title: Habeas Corpus
file.description: Medium sized Wizard map with many outside areas.

file.author: ShockedHorizon5

file.description:
Small otherworldly castle surrounded by mountains. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Rastrelly
file.title: Cathedral of the Doubt
file.description: Medium-sized cathedral with some base elements. The map source is included.

file.author: James Garrett
file.title: City Of The Undead
file.description:
Medium sized red brick map with a few outside areas. Playable but boring visuals.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: R.P.G.
file.title: And All That Could Have Been
file.description: Large, professionally built industrial map using Speedbase textures. Great brushwork and gameplay.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: Coven
file.description:
The SoE final proper map(s) merged back into one: A huge medieval fortress in an underground cavern system. Originally built as a whole like this, but had to be split for the SoE pack due to technical limitation at the time (the map became soe2m4: Whispers in Darkness and soe2m5: The Morbid Manse). This version was fixed up by aguirRe.

Note: This map requires Soul of Evil and an engine port with increased limits.

Fun trivia fact time! This was the first map that CZG ever downloaded!

file.author: Ben Fichter

file.description: Small symmetrical map in the shape of a framed cross.

file.author: Peter Bisseker (tiddles)
