file.title: Insaneninjaviper
file.description: Small packet overflow extreme horde arena combat map with a story. Map source is included.

file.author: Nick Godridge (Boss300)
file.title: Insides-Out
file.description:
Large abstract level floating in the void, with mixed texture themes and a very large enemy count / horde combat.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: mafon2
file.title: Intrusion
file.description:
Medium-sized, very dark metal fortress.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: mafon2
file.title: Intrusion 2021
file.description:
Medium-sized metal fortress; updated version of Intrusion with improved lighting.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Iain Bruce
file.title: Invein
file.description:
Large SP level with completely new textures and an outstanding atmosphere. The mission is to purge a waste purification facility of a parasite infestation.

This level requires Nehahra.

file.author: ionous
file.title: Der Wanderer über dem Säuremeer
file.description:
Small and tight vertical runic level. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: ionous
file.title: Luna in Silver Shards
file.description:
Small Hexen2-textured 100 brush map. Comes with a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires Quoth.

file.author: c0j
file.title: Iredent
file.description: Small level set in a water-filled mountain crevasse. The map source is included.

file.author: sock
file.title: In The Shadows [Demo v1.0]
file.description:
Demo version of an atmospheric singleplayer campaign with three small medieval levels (two of which are remakes of the orignal E1M1 and E1M2). It features both normal gameplay and a new, very unique stealth mode. The enemy AI has been vastly improved, and there are countless visual overhauls and miscellaneous additions. Very high quality throughout.

Note: This mod requires Fitzquake 0.85 or Fitzquake Mark V.

This is version 1.0. The newer version 1.1 is available here.

file.author: sock
file.title: In The Shadows [Demo v1.1]
file.description:
Demo version of an atmospheric singleplayer campaign with three small medieval levels (two of which are remakes of the orignal E1M1 and E1M2). It features both normal gameplay and a new, very unique stealth mode. The enemy AI has been vastly improved, and there are countless visual overhauls and miscellaneous additions. Very high quality throughout.

Note: This mod is designed to be played with Fitzquake 0.85 or Fitzquake Mark V.

This is version 1.1 which has several improvements and additions; version 1.0 can be found here.

file.author: sock
file.title: The Ivory Tower
file.description:
Medium-sized medieval towers in a mine canyon with many secret areas that allow for somewhat nonlinear gameplay, a built-in skill selection area, and custom medieval-themed items. The map source is included in the pak.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: phlamethrower
file.title: The Arena
file.description: Monster wave fighting in a ugly arena-style thing.

file.author: phlamethrower
file.title: The Pain Element
file.description: Big, empty and ugly base.

file.author: tiddles
file.title: Jackboot Hero
file.description: Medium sized industrial base map.

file.author: Psycho
file.title: Jailbreak
file.description: Smallish mix-style pseudo-prison map.

file.author: Daya
file.title: Manhattan's Left-Overs
file.description:
A late entry for Func Map Jam 6, following the theme "Fire and Brimstone": a ruined cityscape with lots of lava and jumping.

Note: This map requires an engine with support for coloured lighting and fog.

file.author: ionous, NewHouse, Pritchard, Shamblernaut
file.title: Func Map Jam 8 - Film Noir theme
file.description:
Func Map Jam #8 - a community project at Func_Msgboard.
This pack features four Film Noir / black&white-themed levels as well as a start map and comes bundled with Arcane Dimensions enemies. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits.
[rezipped for Quaddicted]

file.author: marilyn
file.title: welcome fuckhead(there is a story.too long)
file.description: Small surreal creepy wizard-themed map. Map source is included.

file.author: Greenwood, Hardcore Mazu, Heresy, JCR, Pinchy, Vurkka, Shadesmaster, Smilecythe
file.title: January Jump Jam
file.description:
Ten maps of varying themes based on the Jump mod (included) which adds double/triple-jump abilities. The map sources are included.

Note: Some of these maps require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Neil Manke
file.title: Outpost
file.description: Small castle with a few custom textures and many func_illusionaries.

file.author: Grey Fox (Jason)
file.title: Jason's first map pack
file.description: A bland, horizontal, linear Wizard castle divided into three medium sized maps.

file.author: Matt Sefton
file.title: Jawbreak
file.description: Fairly large idbase map with a lot of button pressing.

file.author: James Garrett
file.title: Jim's Dungeon
file.description:
Oh well, what do you expect from a '97 map called "It's a Dungeon" (in the map itself that is)? Very dull map.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: John Harley
file.title: The Chamber of Pain
file.description: Small red brick level with an ugly start map.

file.author: Bario
file.title: House of jilted boys
file.description:
Medium sized, partly boxed Wizard/Medieval map with reskinned monsters from various sources. Barely average.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Greenwood, DragonsForLunch, Eduardo Sánchez Barrios, GW_X9, Mazu, Ish, Juzley, Konig, Magnetbox, Omni, Paul Lawitzki, Quasiotter, Shadesmaster, Wiedo
file.title: January Jump Jam 2
file.description:
JJJ2 is a map jam pack made of 15 acrobatic maps, built with base-themed Alkaline mod kit (included in download) which adds a "jump boots" powerup for mid-air jumps.

Some of the maps are quite difficult. Expect floating platforms, bottomless pits, and void maps.

Includes start map, built-in difficulty select, YouTube-safe custom soundtrack, and map source.

Note: This mod requires a source port with increased limits.

See also: Alkaline 1.1, January Jump Jam 2020.

file.author: Vigil
file.title: Vigil of the Night
file.description: Short, simple map set in brown brickwork and metal trims.

file.author: Vigil
file.title: Unseen Assailant
file.description: Medium sized Wizmetal/industrial sky fortress. Nice, but dull lighting.

file.author: Vigil
file.title: Strength. Service. Honour.
file.description: Medium sized industrial complex using Ogro and Rorschach textures.

file.author: Artistical, BoxFigs, Greenwood, Markie Music, Nolcoz, omni, Pinchy, quasiotter, Scampi, starshipwaters, zigi, ZungryWare
file.title: Quake April Fools Mega Jokemap Extravaganza Incorporated (Jokejam)
file.description:
April's fools/joke-themed community map pack featuring twelve not-to-be-taken-seriously levels with deliberately goofy or trollish settings or gameplay. It is based on the progs_dump mod (included) and comes with three demos, many custom sounds, music, and skyboxes. The map sources are included as well.

Note: Some of these maps require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Gonzoj
file.title: Joseph's 1st Attempt
file.description: Small 'base' map.

file.author: JPal
file.title: The Darkstone Halls
file.description: Large metal/runic fortress. Comes with a custom skybox. The map source is included.

file.author: JPal
file.title: The Underkeep
file.description:
Large white brick/medieval fortress. Comes with a custom skybox. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: JPal
file.title: The Rust Forge
file.description:
Medium / large runic base map with "void vibes", built on progs_dump 3.0 (already included). Some sounds from Arcane Dimensions, custom music "Yss Éskiuth" by Immorpher. Map source is included.

There's no custom start map. Load via console: "game jpqm12; map jpqm12"

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits and BSP2 support.

file.author: JPal
file.title: Concrete Meltdown
file.description:
Medium / large base map with lots of lava. Built on progs_dump 3.0 (already included). Custom music is "Scratch My Surface" by Verbum Mentis. Map source is included.

There is no custom start map, so set your desired difficulty and load the map manually via console: "map jpqm13"

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits and BSP2 support.

file.author: JPal
file.title: Forgotten Fortress
file.description:
Large Wizard-textured castle. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.
An updated version is available here.

file.author: JPal
file.title: Chthonic Deities
file.description:
Large Knave-textured underground lava fortress. It is based on the Progs_dump mod (included) and comes with a few new models, sounds, and a custom music track. The map and qc sources are included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: JPal
file.title: Brick Red
file.description:
Medium-sized terracotta/red brick castle based on the Progs_dump mod (included). Comes with a custom skybox and a few new sounds/models. The map and QC sources are included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: JPal
file.title: Halls of the Void
file.description:
Medium-sized metal cathedral in the void. It is based on the Progs_dump mod (included) and comes with a custom music track. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: JPal
file.title: The Edge of Sanity
file.description:
Medium to large abstract metal/industrial-ish level floating in the void. It is based on the Progs_dump mod (included) and comes with a couple of new models and sounds. The map and qc sources are included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: JPal
file.title: Greymoor
file.description:
Large medieval castle with several nightly courtyards. It runs on the Progs_dump mod (included) and comes with a few custom models, sounds, a skybox and a music track. The map and qc sources are included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.
An updated version is available here.

file.author: Juha Koiste
file.title: Area 51
file.description: Medium sized map: a Metal temple with a warehouse leading into a Base.

file.author: Gotshun
file.title: Jump
file.description:
Large dark medieval brick map in the vein of Honey and Func Map Jam 1. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.
A version with colored lighting is available here.

file.author: JCR
file.title: Jumpmod 2 + Triune Discovery
file.description:
Map pack centered around a Jump Boots item that adds a double jump ability. There are five levels set in Mayan ruins in canyons and caves, a miliary bases, and a crumbling castle. It also features a few custom monsters from Rubicon 2, new skyboxes and music tracks. The QC and map sources are included.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Rodney Johnstone
file.title: Junk
file.description: Smallish, very dark Base map. Barely average.

file.author: EraserX
file.title: The Jurassic Cave
file.description: Small Metal map: a beach leading into cramped caves with a few petrified dinosaurs.

file.author: Jason Zukowski
file.title: Wolfenstein/Doom version 1.1
file.description: Two *very* small maps with Wolfenstein / Doom2 textures. Pointless.

file.author: Jason Zukowski
file.title: Blue Hell
file.description: Mini-campaign consisting of five *very* small maps and a start map with IKBlue textures. Also features a customized Chthon boss battle.

file.author: Ludovic Texier
file.title: Keep it dark!
file.description: Small Wizard-textured "building" in a water pool.

file.author: sock
file.title: Castle Kaahoo (SM175)
file.description: Small temple map using Kaahoo textures. A touched-up and expanded version of sock's entry from SM175.

file.author: Jacek Gordinier
file.title: Iron Decay
file.description: Two small unspectacular Base maps.

file.author: McRuli (Rodrigo Hernandez)
file.title: Kaos, el comienzo de una nueva era
file.description: Spanish 'realism' map with new monsters and textures. Comes with a start map. Some potentially nice bits, but overall lacking in quality.

file.author: Guilherme Nemeth
file.title: Keeper Of The Hell Gate
file.description: Medium-sized runic map. It is based on the progs_dump mod (included) and a few extra models and sounds as well as a music track by the author. The map source is included.

file.author: Kell
file.title: I Pity Thee Not
file.description:
Large Metal/ruinic map with a fairly open layout / progression and attention to detail.

Note: This map requires Quoth.

file.author: Bal & Greenwood
file.title: Kelluva Linna
file.description:
Large floating castle using Daiktana E3 textures. Based on an unfinished map for a canceled Nehahra expansion episode from 2005. Comes with a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Timothy R. Jervis (Kew)
file.title: Illhaven Winter & The Bastion of Skull
file.description: Two small to medium sized snowy castles with non-linear gameplay, extracted from the Rise of the Phoenix TC. The second map is a little confusing to finish. Both feel like DM maps in terms of layout.

file.author: Yvon Lariviere
file.title: KeyQuest
file.description: Small boxed Wizard map. It seems it can't be finished without cheating as it's impossible to get out of the water by regular means - hence the "poor" rating.

file.author: Kurt Kesler
file.title: Kfort1
file.description: Two medium sized levels: A tight metal-themed canyon map and a spacious and plain Metal/Wizard map. Fort2 has to be played first!

file.author: Daniel Gómez (Ratón)
file.title: Kill 'em All (Mátalos a Todos)
file.description: A small map set in a partly destroyed modern urban environment, inspired by the city levels of Duke Nukem 3D. The author's second Quake release.

file.author: Benjamin S. Clower
file.title: (The) Killing Complex
file.description: Fairly large, plain Metal map.

file.author: Matthias Kunze
file.title: Kill 'em all
file.description: A single room with a bunch of monsters and items.

file.author: Kinn
file.title: Bastion of the Underworld
file.description:
Q3stone/metal styled fortress of epic scale, with a few new monsters in lots of horde combat (about 300 monsters in total) and othe custom gameplay additions.
Awesome map, definitely a must-have.

file.author: Kinn
file.title: The Marcher Fortress
file.description:
Q3stone/metal styled fortress of epic scale, with a few new monsters in lots of hardcore horde combat (almost 400 monsters in total) and other custom gameplay additions.
A most impressive Quake level.

file.author: Killjoy
file.title: Avanipaala Praasaada (Palace of the Great Warriors)
file.description:
An elegant map in a unique texture theme (a white version of ikblue) with some nice brushwork and good exploration/secrets.
Memorable primarily for its Taj-Mahal-like ambience, but also fun to play.

file.author: George Vasiliev
file.title: Maked GEO special for GAME.EXE
file.description:
Second place in a competition of the Russian magazine Game.exe.
Small medieval-style level. A singleplayer demo is included.

file.author: Vondur
file.title: The Castle of Koohoo
file.description: Small mappack in a swamp/tribal setting. Features a start, main level and boss map.

file.author: KillPixel
file.title: Cartographer's Nightmare
file.description:
A large heavily scripted, meticulously crafted and sadly unfinished base map with a horror theme. The map source is included.

In the words of the author: "This doesn't play like a Quake map. I never had the intention of making a Quake map, it just happened to be the game that was available. I say that so you don't get your hopes up or go in guns blazing only to find yourself at spawn over and over again. It plays like a less forgiving Doom3. [...] No single section is 100% complete."

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits. DarkPlaces is recommended and texture filtering should be disabled.

This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash.

file.author: Samuel 'Kaiser' Villarreal
file.title: Quake: Harvester of Chaos (Demo)
file.description:
The demo version of an unfinished Quake episode.

Contains three medium to large SP maps and a skill selection map, and features some environmental and monster modifications.

file.author: krak
file.title: Slime Factory
file.description: Small medieval castle compound used as a slime factory. The map source is included.

file.author: Ace
file.title: King Solomon's Mines
file.description: Large blue brick/underground mine map with a base bit, many misaligned textures and frequent monster ambushes.

file.author: Kell
file.title: Contract Revoked - Part I (Libris Vertiginis)
file.description: Fairly large medieval library with Knave textures. Part 1 of the Contract Revoked series.

file.author: The Void (Tim Fairchild)
file.title: Kathedral
file.description: Small Wizard hub map with Base elements. OK.

file.author: J.F.Gustafsson
file.title: Keys to liberty
file.description: Medium sized Wizard prison map with a small mine bit.

file.author: Chris
file.title: Kuro
file.description: *Very* small Wizard map. Not much more than a test map according to the author. Map file is included.

file.author: Randall (blindtypist)
file.title: Kustok: Newcastle Brick Plant
file.description: Very small realism map: a brick plant with two buildings and a tool shed. Apparently made for PocketQuake.

file.author: Kayos
file.title: Entryway III - Quaked
file.description: A Doom2 MAP01 clone. Map file is included.

file.author: Kayos
file.title: HellSpawn
file.description: Medium sized map with mixed texture styles, extremely hard and unfair gameplay.

file.author: Andrew M@N
file.title: The Labyrinth of Death
file.description: Medium sized maze with Wizard textures.

file.author: Lord Asaki
file.title: Chunky Monkey Stew (April Fools 2002)
file.description: Tiny joke map with an arena fight.

file.author: Lord Asaki
file.title: April Fools II
file.description: Small city/metal level with balancing / trickjump-like sections.

file.author: J.F.Gustafsson
file.title: The last game
file.description: Three small maps representing one. They are somewhat medieval/metal themed for the most part and have quite a few deadly traps.

file.author: raven33 / Lilybug33
file.title: Dare to Dream
file.description:
Two small maps, a classic-style base themed intro and a castle themed conclusion. Uses custom music by Angryfrogs, custom skyboxes by Makkon / Sock, and some id1 and mg1 textures.

No custom start map or difficulty select is included, so use the console to load ("map lb_fall01") and configure (e.g. "skill 0" is Easy).

Note: map source files are included.

file.author: Unknown
file.title: The Lost Base
file.description:
Small, leaked linear Base map.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: The Solipsist
file.title: Logistics Central
file.description:
Around medium-sized base map. Extended version of the same map from the Q25 Limits Jam. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Copper 1.16 and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Unknown
file.title: Hello
file.description: Large unlit rooms alternating between very bright and very dark.

file.author: Unknown
file.title: Untitled
file.description: A series of four small maps with mixed textures and poor layout/construction quality.

file.author: Kevin Rogers
file.title: The 5th Level
file.description: Large maze-like and ugly base map.

file.author: Leafface
file.title: The Cesspit
file.description: Very small and dark atrium map. "Secret level of of the SP-game: "Far away from home"'

file.author: Leafface
file.title: The nowhere
file.description: Medium sized Wizard map. First map of the LFSP series. OK.

file.author: Leafface
file.title: Sneer of shit
file.description: Medium sized Wizard map. Second map of the LFSP series. OK.

file.author: Leafface
file.title: Toxic paradise
file.description: Large Medieval/ Wizard map. Third map of the LFSP series. OK.

file.author: Leafface
file.title: Warehouse
file.description: Large Base map. Part of the LFSP series (unit 2).

file.author: Leafface
file.title: Operation Central
file.description: Large Base map. Part of the LFSP series (unit 2).

file.author: Leafface
file.title: The Huntdown
file.description: Large Metal level with a lava trickjump section. Part of the LFSP series (unit 2).

file.author: Leafface
file.title: Mine entrance
file.description: Small Base-style hub connecting the three units of the LFSP series.

file.author: Leafface
file.title: The Purgatory
file.description: Medium to large Metal map. Secret level of the LFSP series.

file.author: Leafface
file.title: LFSP Start
file.description: Simple skill selection map of the LFSP series. It is supposed to link to lfsp1, however the target map filename is wrong.

file.author: Erik Robson
file.title: Lighthouse Assult
file.description: Single player mission consisting of three small to medium, farily plain Wizard maps with a few modified/reskinned monsters and some custents bits. The goal is to infilitrate and secure a medieval lighthouse compound. OK.

file.author: Qmaster
file.title: Return to Limbo - I
file.description:
Medium-sized "hipmetal" level with lightning gun combat against Vores and Scourges. Originally made in 2013. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Mission Pack 1: Scourge of Armagon (hipnotic)

file.author: Michele (miccar) Cardinale & Simone (Simon2) Filosto
file.title: Lost Island: The Island of the death
file.description: An Egyptian temple on an unknown island. Start map, medium temple map and small boss level, many cramped caverns and a dragon battle at the end. OKish.

file.author: Mark McClure
file.title: Level Mine
file.description: Medium sized stone complex.

file.author: Derek 'Lombard' Barr
file.title: The Ancient Fortress
file.description: Medium-sized medieval fortress. Comes with a start map and features a few new textures as well as a custom SNG model.

file.author: DaveDemon
file.title: LoCaLH
file.description: "A huge room where some monster is floating around really fast.... try and hit him, i dare ya."

file.author: Lombard & Goatlord
file.title: Lomgoat
file.description: Mini-campaign with three small SP levels: a base warehouse, a cathedral and a mine. It also comes with a start map, an additional DM map, and features all new textures as well as a modified palette giving monsters and items a new look. Ok.

file.author: nolcoz
file.title: Un Lugar Otro Que El Cielo
file.description:
Large abstract floating ikwhite level. Comes with a new model, sounds, a custom skybox and a music track. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.71 and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Dennis Katsonis
file.title: Lords of Chaos
file.description:
Huge hellish fortress using a combination of Apocrypha/Ogro/Zerstörer textures. Features a high monster count, a couple of technical additions, and a custom music track.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits and BSP2 support.

file.author: Richard Neff
file.title: The Lost Tech Center
file.description: Small plain Base map. Comes with a skill selection map. Barely average.

file.author: ZQ
file.title: The Lost Tomb
file.description: Medium-sized Wizard-textured tomb level. The map source is included.

file.author: Matt Sefton
file.title: The Lost World
file.description: Medium sized medieval map.

file.author: Sean Reed
file.title: Lair of the Loupe
file.description: Small medieval map with some Quad action.

file.author: Lane Powell
file.title: The Bonehoard
file.description:
Large blue/metal level with caverns, blood, bones and otherworldy parts.

Note: This map requires Quoth and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Lane Powell
file.title: Threat Assessment
file.description:
Small metal/base Coagula-type void level with a high enemy density.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.50 and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Leith SFAR
file.title: LS
file.description: A huge badly lit map with lots of style changes, many monsters right-in-your-face and gimmicky gameplay ideas.

file.author: The Lieutenant
file.title: Ad Infinitum
file.description: Small to medium IKBase-style map featuring modified Hell Knights.

file.author: The Lieutenant
file.title: Backwards Compatible
file.description:
Small industrial Rubicon-style base map with a few modified monsters. Also includes an updated version of lthsp1.

Note: This map has a sequel, lthsp3 ("Cruel Intentions"), which is designed to be played directly after lthsp2.

file.author: The Lieutenant
file.title: Cruel Intentions
file.description:
Third map in the LTHSP series: a medium sized spacious medieval castle featuring new Crossbow Knight enemies.

Note: This map has been designed to be played directly after lthsp2 ("Backwards Compatible"), with the player carrying over their weapons from lthsp2.

file.author: The Lieutenant
file.title: Dark Days
file.description: Fourth map in the LTHSP series, follow-up to lthsp3: a large spacious medieval castle with Crossbow Knights, modified Ogres and a few other custom things. Comes with a small start map. Nice.

file.author: The Lieutenant
file.title: Exodus
file.description: Fifth map of the LTHSP series: a small unique blue metal map featuring Crossbow Knights and, like the other LTH maps, supports colored lighting (which you might want to disable in this case).

file.author: Brian Hess a.k.a. Wendigo
file.title: Lunar Base
file.description:
Small moon base with custom textures. A deathmatch level with monsters.

Note: This map does not have an exit. A hotfix that adds one is available here.

file.author: Brian Hess a.k.a. Wendigo
file.title: Lunar Base 2
file.description:
Small moon base with custom textures. A deathmatch level with monsters.

Note: This level does not have an exit. A hotfix that adds one is available here.

file.author: Matt "Lunaran" Breit
file.title: Concentric Devastation
file.description: Large, professionally constructed mountain base with Q2MP1 textures and some custom monsters.

file.author: LZM
file.title: LZM Nuclear Research Labs
file.description: Small, weird base map with a few textures from Zerstörer (no exit).

file.author: Bryan L. aka Mungo
file.title: The Cobalt Palace
file.description: Small blue Metal map with easy gameplay but a very unique style.

file.author: Shamus Young
file.title: MadHouse
file.description: A house, terrible build quality and no fun. Bleh.

file.author: Stephen Parker
file.title: Maelstrom
file.description:
Mini-episode with four small to medium Wizard-style maps and a start map.

Note: In the third map, some teleporters may be malfunctioning in newer engines, leaving player/monsters stuck in the ceiling. Use noclip/fullbright temporarily to be able to proceed in these situations.

file.author: ijed
file.title: A Descent into Maelstrom
file.description:
3-map SP campaign for Nehahra.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Andy House
file.title: Magnet Interactive Studios
file.description: Small deathmatch level with a few monsters thrown in but no exit. It is based on the main office for Magnet Interactive Studios.

file.author: Poorchop
file.title: Rich Mahogany and Human Leather-Bound Books
file.description:
Large castle library in the mountains. It uses some Knave textures and comes with a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Kayne
file.title: Murder at the Disco
file.description:
Medium-sized nightclub level with several dancefloors, bars and VIP areas. Comes with an optional start map, a few external textures as well as a custom skybox, and some music tracks. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires the Malice TC and a source port with increased limits and BSP2 support.
Cannot be played from within the Quake Injector

file.author: Greenwood
file.title: Malvirta Station
file.description: Small to medium id-base level with traps. Vanilla Quake version of the SM209 entry.

file.author: Dia Westerteicher
file.title: Maniac11
file.description: Small beginner map with mixed textures and some rather unusual architecture.

file.author: Matthias Worch
file.title: DooM II Map01
file.description: Tiny base map. Another conversion of Doom 2 map01, albeit made from scratch and using Quake textures. The map source is included. Pointless.

file.author: Adib Murad, Breezeep, Daz, EricW & Tronyn, Exhelzar, ionous, Matecha, necros, Rick, Scampie, ShoTro, ItEndsWithTens, WarrenM
file.title: Func Map Jam 6 - Fire and Brimstone
file.description:
Map jam #6 - a community project at Func_Msgboard. The pack features 13 Fire and Brimstone-themed levels of varying sizes as well as a start map. It comes with a couple of skyboxes, and the map sources are included.

Note: Some of the maps require an engine port with increased limits; ericw/Tronyn's map requires 2PSB support. Additionally, support for fog and colored lighting is recommended. You will need to increase the default heapsize for some maps, see the comments for more information.

Note: A late entry by Daya can be downloaded here.

file.author: Bloughsburgh, ionous, ItEndsWithTens, khreathor, NewHouse
file.title: Func Map Jam 7 - Back to Base
file.description:
Map Jam #7 - a community project at Func_Msgboard.

The pack follows a Base theme and features five small to medium-sized levels, some of which add unique twists to the gameplay. A skill selection/start hub map is included.

Note: These maps require Quoth and an engine port with increased limits.
This file has been repacked for Quaddicted.
An updated version of NewHouse's map is available here.

file.author: Ondrejoda
file.title: Claustrophobica, FlatMap, A Place of Many Doors
file.description:
Three tiny, cramped beginner's maps. Walkthrough demos and the map sources are included.
[Cannot be run through the Quake Injector]

file.author: negke
file.title: Red Slammer
file.description: Medium-sized terracotta style map with classic gameplay, a built-in skill selection room and an additional alternative game mode.

file.author: negke
file.title: Runic Recycling
file.description: Medium-sized metal/runic style level with classic gameplay, a built-in skill-selection room and an additional alternative game mode.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Ultramarine
file.description: "Ultramarine is a blue gothic/industrial level using modified Quake3 textures. It takes the medieval/castle theme to another height in originality blue panels and light grey concrete brick. A trademark twisting layout that weaves through this large level as you enter and eventually exit the castle in a tough end battle. Custom monsters come included with Axeman, Gremlins, Rocket and Nail Ogres and the tough Baron gang."

file.author: Markie
file.title: Slip Tripping
file.description:
Retro style speedmap about dimension traversal for vanilla Quake. This is v2, which fixes a softlock in the original version. Map source is included.

"The plot of the map has you jumping back and forth between tech base and medieval lovecraft!"

file.author: Jean-Marc Gruninger
file.title: Mars 1
file.description: Medium sized Base map with a rocket/shuttle hangar. Must be played in Missionpack 1: Scourge of Armagon (hipnotic).

file.author: Mars
file.title: The Forgotten Nightmare
file.description:
Huge map featuring a cave system with a crypt beneath, a dungeon and some ruins; very high enemy count. It is based on the Progs_dump mod (included) and comes with a custom skybox as well as a few new sounds. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Psycho
file.title: Marsbase
file.description:
Quote:
Single Player: yes (mostly for walking through but i tossed a few monsters in to give you something to shoot at...Muahahaha)

file.author: Tim van Hal & Marco van Schriek
file.title: Lucifer's Path
file.description: Large Wizard map. Could use more detail, otherwise OK.

file.author: marty
file.title: marty's stuff
file.description:
Typical looks for that period. Some nice ideas.

Must be played in Missionpack 1: Scourge of Armagon (hipnotic).

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: The Masque of Red Death
file.description:
Large Medieval mountain fortress with extreme scale and horde combat.

Note: This map requires Scourge of Armagon and an engine port with increased limits. An updated version is available here.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: The Masque of Red Death
file.description:
Large Medieval mountain fortress with an extreme scale and horde combat. Unlike the previous version, this one does not require Scourge of Armagon.

Note: This map requires an engine with increased limits.

file.author: Mateusz 'MaTi' Piaskiewicz
file.title: Satarship Bunkier
file.description: Small Speedbase map - nicely constructed but very dark.

file.author: Mateusz 'MaTi' Piaskiewicz
file.title: Best of Vize
file.description:
Medium sized Q2base map - nicely constructed but dull lighting. Comes with a .lit file and a custom skybox.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: MortalMaxx
file.title: East Ardougne
file.description: Medium-sized Knave fortress. It comes with a custom skybox and a music track. The map source is included.

file.author: MortalMaxx
file.title: Corrupted Sector
file.description:
Medium-sized base map. Comes with a few new sounds, a custom skybox and a music track. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: David Jewsbury
file.title: Sir Mayard and the Mountain
file.description: These two maps have some nice touches but the negative aspects outweigh. The author tried to add some atmosphere by putting triggered messages into the level, unfortunately those are displayed too briefly. On the brushwork-side and technically only average. Monsters are more annoying than entertaining.

file.author: Oskar Resler
file.title: Mayhem
file.description: Small Wizard-themed map.

file.author: Mark Murray
file.title: Mayhem
file.description: Small Wizard/ brick map.

file.author: George Grotans
file.title: Maze 1
file.description: Small, ugly fullbright pseudo-maze.

file.author: George Grotans
file.title: Maze 1
file.description:
Ugly stupid stupid ugly maze.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Andrew Yoder
file.title: Ruins of Mazotac
file.description: Small green Wizard-textured temple ruins with some ancient machinery. The map source is included.

file.author: negke
file.title: Ascending & Descending
file.description:
Small medieval puzzle map based on the work of M.C. Escher. Gameplay focuses on finding keys and following hints to discover secret areas, which may prove frustrating for some players. The map source is included.

Note: There are a few compatibility issues with certain engine ports. See mce.txt for more information.

file.author: Matthew C. Mary "MCM"
file.title: Curse of the Pharaoh
file.description: Small Egyptian tomb. OK.

file.author: Ilkka Kurkela
file.title: The Mining Complex
file.description: Small to medium, nicely built Base-style mining complex.

file.author: JAR
file.title: MidKnight1
file.description: Very small map leading from a base through a canyon. Uses a few Doom textures.

file.author: Dennis Katsonis
file.title: Med Labs
file.description: Medium sized, confusing and often cramped Medieval/Metal/Base map with a few attempts at realism elements.

file.author: megaman
file.title: Wenl Mine
file.description:
Large mine cavern map; a remake of the third level from Descent 2. Exploration-style gameplay and many secrets.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Paul Roberts
file.title: MekBase
file.description: Very small map (three rooms) with mixed texture themes and a large battle mech.

file.author: Magnus Björkbom
file.title: Memories of a Grotto
file.description:
Large level inspired by E1M4-The Grisly Grotto, however with an abstract twist to its style, featuring somewhat cramped interiors, underwater and void sections. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: PuLSaR
file.title: Menkalinan
file.description: Very huge beautifully crafted egyptian temple, diverse and challenging gameplay.

file.author: DMagee
file.title: Mercy
file.description: Medium to large Wizard/Medieval map with a slightly ok'ish castle/church and an ugly Base bit at the beginning.

file.author: Speedy
file.title: Mescalito
file.description: Well designed outdoor/speedbaze-map. Quite alot of monsters, some traps and bunch of secrets for your quaking

file.author: sock
file.title: Metal Monstrosity
file.description:
Medium-sized vertical runic metal structures floating in the clouds. The map features enemies of the Base variety and has an integrated skill selection area. Additionally, it comes with a custom skybox as well as a few new sounds. The map source is included in the PAK.

Note: This map requires Quoth and an engine port with increased limits (as well as support for the -quoth command-line switch).

file.author: Chris Mayers
file.title: Hive, part II
file.description: Medium sized subway station infested by base monsters and Vores, a few new textures. It's OK, though the maintenance corridors become repetitive.

file.author: MetzMan
file.title: Roots
file.description:
Large level with a medieval castle, a base excarvation site leading to an otherworldly pyramid, and a tentacle monster exit. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support. It is unvised, so perfomance may suffer on slower machines.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: The Entrance & The Sanctum
file.description: Two small and very dark levels: a Wizard-themed house in a pond and a linear Metal map.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: The Cassandra Calamity
file.description:
Two large, detailed Base levels with a story, some new textures, skins and sounds, and nasty cyborg enforcers, along with a few other additions. The author encourages COOP play, too.

Note: The built-in unzip tool in Windows seems to struggle with this archive. You can use the free 7-zip to unpack.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: Chthon's Castle
file.description: Small to medium very dark Wizard map. Barely average.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: Nurgle's Vault
file.description: Medium sized plain Metal level with many monsters/non-stop action. Barely average.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: The Terror of Tzeentch
file.description: Medium sized plain Metal level with many monsters/non-stop action. Barely average.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: Suicide Staccato
file.description: Medium sized plain Base map with an outdoor water area.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: A Bishop's Bane (Domina Domino)
file.description: Medium sized plain Medieval map with a tower and a dungeon area.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: Prelude to Apocalypse & Mordrigor's Demise
file.description: Huge wizmetal medieval map with tense gameplay. Looks quite dated but it's fun nonetheless.

file.author: Marcus Dromowicz
file.title: Penumbra of Domination
file.description: Episode with four varied, medium to large Wizard maps, as well as a start map. Also features some modified progs, like rotation, breaking walls and cutscenes.

file.author: mfx
file.title: Pain in the Arch
file.description: Medium-sized underground ruins in Knave style with many tight spaces and initially limited supplies. The map source is included.

file.author: mfx
file.title: Mainframe Mayhem
file.description:
Large mountain base. It comes with a custom skybox and a couple of additional props. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Quoth and an engine port with increased limits. This is the third version; the previous versions can be found here.

file.author: mfx
file.title: Intermission / Kleins Bottle
file.description: A small mixed themed map for Q1, intended as a prelude for mfxsp8.

file.author: mfx
file.title: Termination Mental
file.description:
Small base level, a remake of the original Termination Central (E3M1). It comes with a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires Quoth and the following settings: r_novis 1, r_wateralpha 0.3.

file.author: mfx
file.title: Clean Cut
file.description:
Medium-sized idbase industrial facility with tight corridors, glass windows and pipes. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires r_wateralpha to be set to 0.3 and r_waterwarp set to 0 in order to make the windows look correct.
This is the fixed second version of the zip.

file.author: Mista Heita
file.title: Blood Colored Rust
file.description:
Medium-sized dark, orange industrial/military base map using modified idbase textures. Comes with a custom skybox. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Quoth 2 and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Jean-Marc Gruninger
file.title: The Middle Evil
file.description: Large medieval town in a thundery night with completely new textures and non-standard gameplay. To proceed, it's often required to find hidden buttons and use certain strategies to defeat the monsters (such as relying on infighting and conserving ammo). Not for everyone.

file.author: Justin, Kaepora Gaepora
file.title: The Arenas of Might
file.description: A simple arena with knights, not even an exit.

file.author: Ed Cope
file.title: Mines & Mayhem
file.description: Small mine level with slightly confusing progression and some kind of future amazon enemy with a rocketlauncher.

file.author: Denis Moeller (panza)
file.title: Mini
file.description: Very small Base map.

file.author: Jose C. Rodriguez (JCR)
file.title: Mire Prison
file.description: Small prison tract built into a dark mire cavern. The map source is included.

file.author: Marc Roussel
file.title: No campers palace, die with honor!
file.description: Smallish ugly mix-of-textures map. A demo and the map source are included.

file.author: (Hidden)
file.title: MiSsIoN: ImPosSiBlE
file.description:
Small mixed style map whose only highlight is an airstrike in the beginning (which is unfortunately downgraded by the lack of lighting on the jet). Barely average.

Privacy note: The author requested the removal of their public name so we do not display it here.

file.author: Bloughsburgh
file.title: A Horse Named Quake
file.description:
Small vertical medieval courtyard with a built-in skill selection room. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions.

file.author: bmFbr, dumptruck_ds, ZungryWare, matboe, Shamblernaut, 4LT, Asaki
file.title: Modding Jam 2022
file.description:
AI-themed mod jam with 7 mods, features new NPCs with unique behaviors:
- Leading-Shot Turret Mod by 4LT
- Neko for Quake! by Asaki
- Skaarj for Quake by bmFbr
- Chthon+ by dumptruck_ds
- Mama Shambler by matboe
- Chomps the Mimic for Quake by Shamblernaut
- Devil Demo by ZungryWare

Some of the mods have small test maps, and QC source code is included. See also: Modding Jam 2019

Note: this is more like a dev kit with 7 different mod folders. It will not work in Quake Injector, and mods must be manually loaded.

file.author: aDaya, BloodShot, ish, JCR, khreathor, Redfield, Scrama, Shamblernaut
file.title: Modding Jam 2019
file.description:
Modding jam event: eight small mods introducing new weapons, items, or gameplay features. Some of them come with test maps, new sounds and models etc. The mod sources are included.

[Cannot be run through the Quake Injector]

file.author: Neil Manke
file.title: Monastry
file.description: Medium sized, fairly plain monastry with a semi-explorational gameplay and some new textures.

file.author: PuLSaR
file.title: Project Monsterfree
file.description: This is a singleplayer map with no monsters, just traps and obstacles - similar to the Hazard Course training map from Half-Life. Uses Rubicon textures.

file.author: Tyrann
file.title: Moonlight Assault
file.description: Very large interconnected medieval castle with yards and outside areas - semi-nonlinear, explorational kind of gameplay.

file.author: Daniel Vogt (MoRbId)
file.title: Morbidity: 1
file.description: Medium sized Base/Metal map. Uses some DOOM2 textures and some other custom ones. OK.

file.author: Daniel Vogt (MoRbId)
file.title: Morbidity: 2
file.description: Small to medium custom Metal map with a Base bit at the beginning.

file.author: Marc Roussel
file.title: The mortal environment
file.description: Small linear Wizard/Metal level. OK.

file.author: Tuomo "Morpheus" Tomperi
file.title: The Castle of Morpheus
file.description: Large Wizard style castle with basic detailing and a dragon boss battle. OK.

file.author: Jarkko Heilio
file.title: Mountain Base
file.description: Medium-sized base in the mountains.

file.author: Jarkko Heilio
file.title: Mountain Base 2
file.description: This is the second version of Mountain Base, ostensibly being quite different in terms of gameplay.

file.author: Spipper
file.title: Shifting Planes Of Existence
file.description:
Medium-sized Knave-style level with button-operated movable "planes".

Note: This map requires Quoth 2.2 and a source port with increased limits.
An updated version of the map is available here.

file.author: Spipper
file.title: Shifting Planes of Existence (version 2)
file.description:
Medium-sized Knave-style level with button-operated movable "planes". This is an updated version of the level. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Quoth 2.2 and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Isaac Barry (aka Clorox)
file.title: Murder Inc.
file.description: Large interconnected base map with a unique theme and quite original gameplay. Uses a variety of new textures, e.g. IKBase. After arriving in a train, you have to infiltrate an enemy facility and work your way to the manager's office to blow it up.

file.author: Dmitry 'Manslay' Dementjev
file.title: Manslay's Acrobatics
file.description: Small Wizard style castle, made for SDA.

file.author: sock
file.title: Midnight Stalker
file.description:
Medium-sized metal dungeon in E3M6 mashup style with a built-in skill selection room. It also features custom item boxes. The map source is included in the PAK.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits. A standalone version optimized for vanilla Quake compatibility is available here.

file.author: sock
file.title: Midnight Stalker (v.2)
file.description:
Medium-sized metal dungeon in E3M6 mashup style with a built-in skill selection room. It also features custom item boxes. The map source is included.

Note: This is an optimized, stand-alone version of the level which stays within the vanilla Quake limits and does not require any special engine port. It does not include the custom item boxes from the previous version.

file.author: Bryan L. aka Mungo
file.title: Power Plant
file.description:
Medium sized fairly ugly Base map with a few rotating objects. Comes with a SP demo.

Note: This map has to be played with Scourge of Armagon.

file.author: Neil Haupt
file.title: Murder1
file.description: Small Wizard/Medieval map.

file.author: Steve Rescoe
file.title: Museum
file.description: Small museum with some custom textures and Quake art. Barely average.

file.author: digs
file.title: Mutant
file.description: A small abstract mixed texture map which partly homages Doom II's map 1 ("Entryway").

file.author: Denis Gusakov
file.title: Lost Underground Base
file.description:
Third place in a competition of the Russian magazine Game.exe.
Medium to large base map with a warehouse, a mech hangar and a submarine port. A singleplayer demo is included.

Note: Originally named "my level.zip", renamed to "my_level.zip".

file.author: Mike Drummond
file.title: Mykd1
file.description: Medium sized Wizard/Metal map. CTF is supported as well.

file.author: Peter Bisseker (tiddles)
file.title: Mymap & Garrison
file.description: Two medium sized metal maps.

file.author: necros
file.title: oH gOd!
file.description: necros' entry for the 100brush contest: a very small, ugly map using Quake2 and Zer textures.

file.author: necros
file.title: Castle Necrosis
file.description: Large medieval castle with many custom textures, new features from Custents and a small boss map. There is also a bunch of extended files available to enhance the appearance.

file.author: necros
file.title: Castle Necrosis (Extended Files)
file.description: Extended files for n3sp02_13: contains TGA texture replacements, skybox and music.

file.author: necros
file.title: At the Gates of Midian
file.description: Two maps: a large Metal/Wood fortress in the mountains and a small end battle arena, featuring some modified Fiends and Shamblers. Conveys a certain DOOM-like atmosphere.

file.author: nane
file.title: Catacombs of Misfortune
file.description:
Small dark linear catacombs.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: nadzia (narnar)
file.title: In the Foetid Vault
file.description: Small, dark vault level with tight corridors and custom textures.

file.author: Vondur
file.title: Nastrond
file.description: Very large and detailed Knave fortress.

file.author: Gary Marshall (Zedek)
file.title: The Navy Base
file.description: Confusing and poorly built map. Starts on a ship ("navybase") and requires finding hidden buttons to proceed.

file.author: ET
file.title: Nazihell
file.description: Small Wizard house with talking furniture. Pointless.

file.author: Noel Weer
file.title: Necroseum
file.description: Small and very cramped orange/brown metal level.

file.author: necros
file.title: The Rats in the Walls
file.description: Small oldschool brick level with a few DOOM textures.

file.author: necros
file.title: CS INVASION FLEET!
file.description: Metal-style remake of the popular Counterstrike map de_dust2, created for a "Parody"-themed speedmapping session. Worth a laugh for those who know the original map. OK.

file.author: necros
file.title: The Living End & Elder World Waystation
file.description:
Two-map SP unit: a large medieval dungeon in an underground lava cave (using rtGnosis textures), and a medium sized IKbase-themed stargate facility. It comes with a couple of new sounds and a custom skybox.

Note: These maps require Quoth.

file.author: necros
file.title: Crescendo Of Dreams + Surmounting Terror
file.description: Medium sized green DOOM marble/ wood level with a small end battle map.

file.author: necros
file.title: The Altar of Storms
file.description: Large ancient temple ruins hidden deep beneath a snowy mountain valley. The theme of the map is inspired by the Ayleid ruins from TES4: Oblivion. The map has all new textures, many modified or new monsters from Hexen 2 including a fearsome boss demon, and a custom quad-barrel shotgun.

file.author: necros
file.title: The Emptiness Without
file.description: Large unique Metal-style space map. Also appeared in one of the Coagula contests.

file.author: necros
file.title: Once Upon Atrocity
file.description: Large, spacious Q3Gothic-style fortress in a blood canyon, featuring some modified monsters and an evil dragon boss.

file.author: necros
file.title: Moldy Tower
file.description:
A medium-sized vertical map. It starts with a moldy green area from which you ascend into a mechanical exploratory part. After surpassing this you are awarded a tense boss fight. Lots of novel atmospheric effects thanks to the use of Quoth.

Note: This map requires an engine port with inreased limits.

file.author: Nebiont
file.title: Another Base
file.description:
Around medium-sized base level with a green metal section. It is based on the Progs_dump mod (included) and comes with a few new sounds/models. The map and QC sources are included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Necrobrood
file.description: "Necrobrood is a three map pack with new monsters, textures and skins. The theme follows on from Permutations of the Rotten with a very dark and morbid metal style using grotty brownish modified ID textures. A traditional Quake style but with a unique hand. A number of much stronger opponents with upgrades and improved AI to the Grunts, Enforcers, Ogres, Hell Knights and Shambler."

file.author: DaMaul & unknown converter
file.title: Grind Core
file.description:
Large ikbase level - neh1m4 from Nehahra converted for Arcane Dimensions.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions.

file.author: Nehahra Team
file.title: Nehahra
file.description:
17 maps by famous mappers, cutscenes, new monsters, great features. Comes with a custom engine. Extraordinary.

Note: You can turn off the new AI (side-strafing monsters) with nomonsters "1"

Note: This package was compiled by Spirit in 2008 because of the "mess of files" one needed to install, read the included readme_spirit.txt for changes. Mindcrime said it looked right but please report in if you spot anything faulty in the packaging.

file.author: necros
file.title: Dawn of Eternity
file.description:
Large Metal/gothic lava fortress with a bunch of modified and new monsters, as well as a medium sized, hard secret map. Very high monster count in both maps, compensated by slight changes to some weapons and ammo system.

Note: These maps have to be played in an engine with support for higher edict count (versions of Tyrquake are included).

file.author: necros
file.title: R_speeds be damned!
file.description: Small, unique geocomp metal map.

file.author: Dave Kelvin (Kevlar)
file.title: The NetherWorld
file.description: Medium sized Metal map.

file.author: Tronyn, Daz, aguirRe
file.title: The Night Journey
file.description:
This is an SP episode consisting of six medium to large egyptian/wizard style maps (and a start map) with reskinned monsters.
"[ It ] was originally created by Dustin 'Tronyn' Geeraert and Darren 'Daz' Weekes and released sometime in 2003. Unfortunately, it was unfinished and had e.g. a lot of entity and progression problems." Therefore aguirRe fixed the maps up and re-released this version. The final map nj4 is still missing.
Gameplay is pretty hard. This pack has to be played with Q1MP2: Dissolution of Eternity.

file.author: Bonn
file.title: Nightshift
file.description:
Large base map with some nightly outside areas. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Shaun [Kona] Ross
file.title: Nihilore: The Mechanical Empire
file.description: Nihilore is a dark industrial two-map nightmare using a strong mix of custom textures. This Mechanical Empire is brought to life with rusting metal beams and buttresses holding together a brown brick city. Your enemy empire is strictly human themed, with dogs backed with improved Enforcer AI and four kinds of Human Grunts - all with new skins.

file.author: Brenda Ellen Perdion
file.title: Nike
file.description: Five small to medium sized realism maps with new textures. The mission is to infiltrate a 1960's Nike radar and missile base at night in order to obtain classified information. Uses custents.

file.author: ViolentJ (Jeff Farris)
file.title: Nitemare
file.description: Medium sized base with a rocket bay. Bland.

file.author: Guilherme Nemeth
file.title: The Machinery
file.description:
Large dark industrial map using IKbase textures. Comes with a custom music track by the author. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Geoffrey Overdorff
file.title: No Turning Back
file.description: Small Base? map with custom textures.

file.author: Steven Norrie
file.title: Nozza's Palace
file.description: Very small and very bad map.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert et al
file.title: Soul of Evil: Indian Summer
file.description:
Medieval/fantasy episode consisting of five medium to large maps - sequel to Soul of Evil. Also features new and modified monsters, weapons and items as well as a story in the vein of SOE unfolding throughout the maps, many custom textures, sounds and skyboxes. Gameplay is somewhat non-linear and very hard.
Enhanced skins are available: regular and DP version.

Note: These maps require an engine port with increased limits.
An updated version of the episode is available here.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert et al
file.title: Soul of Evil: Indian Summer (update)
file.description:
Updated version of nsoe, comes with a new map.
Medieval/fantasy episode consisting of five medium to large maps - sequel to Soul of Evil. Also features new and modified monsters, weapons and items as well as a story in the vein of SOE unfolding throughout the maps, many custom textures, sounds and skyboxes. Gameplay is somewhat non-linear and very hard.
Enhanced skins are available: regular and DP version.

Note: These maps require an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Bruno Fabbri (zbidou72)
file.title: Null Bearing
file.description:
Large realism map set in a port. It uses custom textures and comes with a custom skybox. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: zbidou72
file.title: Null Bearing Redux v1.0
file.description:
UPDATE, 5 October 2022: new version v1.2 has re-enabled infighting. This version is obsolete.

Large industrial dock-themed map with lots of exploration, using Makkon and MG1 textures. This is an updated overhaul / redesign of the author's previous release Null Bearing (2020). Map source is included.

Requires Alkaline 1.1+ (NOT included).

"12 red squid statues have been - moderately - hidden throughout the map. Break them all to gain access to the super secret. [...] Some fights can be initiated from different vantage points, some of them advantageous."

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: zbidou72
file.title: Null Bearing Redux v1.2
file.description:
Large industrial dock-themed map with lots of exploration, using Makkon and MG1 textures. This is an updated overhaul / redesign of the author's previous release Null Bearing (2020). Map source is included.

Version 1.2 re-enables infighting and makes some encounters less brutal.

Requires Alkaline 1.1+ (NOT included).

"12 red squid statues have been - moderately - hidden throughout the map. Break them all to gain access to the super secret. [...] Some fights can be initiated from different vantage points, some of them advantageous."

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: Nyarlathotep
file.description:
Two medium-sized experimental vertical maps with a unique flesh-temple theme and very uncompromising low-gravity gameplay.

Note: These maps require Drake and an engine port with BSP2 support.

file.author: Obi-Wan
file.title: Prepare for HELL
file.description: Small to medium Wizard map.

file.author: Obi-Wan
file.title: Office of the dead
file.description: Medium sized Metal map in a canyon, with a Base bit at the beginning.

file.author: Obi-Wan
file.title: Blood of the Martyrs
file.description: Medium sized Base map with somewhat confusing 'find-the-button-then-the-bars'-type of gameplay.

file.author: Rick Lipsey
file.title: Castle of Oblivion
file.description: Large interconnected Metal castle with a sense of exploration.

file.author: Rich Carlson
file.title: O B L I V I O N
file.description: Small space map with several floating platforms. Originally supposed to be the secret level of Ion Storm's Anachronox, but scrapped in later stages of the development and released a couple of years later. OK.

file.author: Ruin
file.title: Oblivion Newton John
file.description: Small Speedbaze-themed level. The map source is included.

file.author: Whitewind
file.title: Odyssey One
file.description:
Large Wizard map. Can only be played in an engine with increased limits due to an excessive amount of lightmaps.

Get the fixed version instead: odyssey1_v2

file.author: Whitewind (+Bengt Jardrup)
file.title: Odyssey One
file.description: Large Wizard map. Originally created in 1998, this version has been rebuilt by Bengt Jardrup (aguirRe) to make it playable in modern engines.

file.author: Greenwood
file.title: Off Base
file.description: Around medium-sized idbase map.

file.author: The Omnimancer
file.title: Corporate Takeover
file.description: A tower with hordes of monsters on each floor, connected by an annoying lift. No details whatsoever, neither any point in playing it.

file.author: Chris Williams
file.title: Offspring
file.description:
Small ugly level with custom textures and uninspired gameplay.

Note: This map has to be played with Scourge of Armagon.

file.author: Ankh & id Software
file.title: ogitreV taruggiZ
file.description: An upside-down version of Quake's original E1M8, created for an SDA contest. The GPL map source is included.

file.author: Tony Boyer
file.title: Ohzarm
file.description: Medium sized base map with a few new textures.

file.author: Michael Cullum
file.title: The Old City
file.description: Small to medium-sized subterranean 'city' with Medieval textures.

file.author: Mika Piirainen & Jouko Maksimainen
file.title: The Old House - the beginning
file.description: Very small, dark Wizard house. The start level of the then supposed to be forthcoming episode Paralyzed.

file.author: necros
file.title: Old ones
file.description: Two very small Base maps which were already made in 2000 and also served as demo maps of some sort.

file.author: ORL
file.title: Laboratory X
file.description:
A huge green base map with new textures and very hard gameplay (no difficulty settings, tight on ammo). The texture wad is included.

Note: This map requires and engine port with increased limits.

file.author: ORL
file.title: Orlmap Series 2: The first half
file.description: First half of a SP episode. Three medium sized canyon/ swamp/ Medieval temple maps and an unfinished Base map - many new (partly strange) textures. OK.

file.author: ORL
file.title: Conflagrant Rodent
file.description:
Large Medieval/terracotta-themed temple ruin in a canyon. High monstercount, hard gameplay. The texture resource wad is included.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: ORL
file.title: Cataractnacon / Zeangala
file.description:
Two large abstract base levels, "a lengthy journey through a non-linear H.R. Giger-themed flooded scrapyard". The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require an engine port with increased limits and expanded map boundaries. Currently, only RMQ (included) and Quakespasm (version 0.92.0 or later; set "sv_protocol" to "999") are capable of running them.

The maps can only be played on either Easy or Hard skill setting.

file.author: ORL
file.title: Laboratory X & Neighboring Alcazar's
file.description: Two old maps released for archival purposes: Laboratory X (oms24), a huge underground base with strange comic-style custom textures, and Neighboring Alcazar's (oms25), a medium-sized orange medieval fortress inside a canyon, which follows the same theme as Conflagrant Rodent.

file.author: MadFox
file.title: OnePair
file.description:
Pretty big weird-castle-like map in wizardish textures.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Ranch Soil (hexcalk)
file.title: Untitled
file.description:
Unlit arena map with 300+ monsters. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Scott McNutt
file.title: Operation Condor

file.description:
Large sci-fi gothic mountain prison for vanilla Quake inspired by Dark Souls, with textures by Makkon. Difficulty settings are not implemented. Map source is included.

"Even if you escape; there's no escape. A relatively linear map designed somewhat vertically and taking heavy inspiration from the Tower of Latria/Irithyll dungeon levels from the Souls series, but with a dystopian/cyberpunk twist. There are two endings - can you find them both?"

file.author: Madfox
file.title: The Gorge
file.description:
Large base themed map surrounded by cliffs and caves, an adaptation / conversion of the level "Mountain Gorge" from the game SiN (1998). Originally presented at the 20th anniversary QEXPO 2016 (via qexpo2016.com).

"... the improvements of the Q2 engine like turning lights and raising lava isn’t possible in Quake. Also it wasn’t possible to rescale the level, as a quarter size would have been sufficient. After several proofs with leaks I decided to take the scale for granted as it covered up the demon fiends in good conditions. Flavoured up with some animating statics it serves up well for 20 years of Quake. Plays as easy as a corned taste of popcorn."

After unzipping to /q1gorge/, start manually via console: "map q1gorge"

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

Custom start map with built-in difficulty select is included.

Note: These levels require Quoth 2.2 and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: skacky
file.title: Quenching Urges of Constant Killing [DEMO #2]

Second demo release of a Quoth slaughter episode in the making. It features the first three of "about 10 stupidly hard and completely unfair slaughtermaps" and comes with custom background music as well as a few new textures.

file.author: brassbite, Danzadan, Daya, HexenMapper, Kres, Naitelveni, NewHouse, Pritchard, Spud, Topher, Vingal
file.title: Quake Upstart Mapping Project 2017
file.description:
QUMP is a project designed to get newcomers into mapping for Quake. Most of the mappers involved had never made a Quake map before, or had only made a few. Some of the maps are more seasoned mapper's first attempts from long ago.

Ten small to large levels in varying themes/styles and a start hub map to access each of them. Comes with three custom skyboxes and an ambient music track. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Artistical, Breezeep, dumptruck_ds, Elithium, Fairweather, Hardcore Mazu, ionous, Ing-Ing, JCR, Pinchy, Marandal, NewHouse, onetruepurple, skacky, Spipper, Ukko, ww, Yoder, ZungryWare
file.title: Coffee Quake
file.description:
Community pack featuring 74 (!) small levels across four episodes following the classic Quake themes. Each map was made within two hours and has an average playtime of 3-5 minutes - well-suited for the occasional coffee break. The pack comes with a start map and a remix/remake of the original end map as well as a music track and some demos. The map sources are included.

Note: Some of these maps require a source port with increased limits and/or BSP2 support.

file.author: Kell & necros
file.title: Quoth
file.description:
Quoth is an expansion pack for Quake 1 single player.

It is not intended as a series of thematically connected maps with additional custom content, as other packs are. The intention is to provide quality custom content for Q1 mappers and players in a single pak file. There are maps included in the pak, but there are also larger maps using the content already released separately by both Kell and necros, and more maps will surely follow.

Its features include technical additions for mappers, new monsters, and a couple of new weapons/items (additional information).

Currently you can play the first two maps of Quake rebuilt and remixed with Quoth monsters. The game will fail to load e1m3quoth because that map does not exist (yet). There are some test maps included for your enjoyment.

This is version 2.1 - a patch to version 2.2 is available here and version 2.2 (full) is available here.

file.author: Preach, necros, Kell
file.title: [NUKED]
file.description:
"Welcome to the third edition of Quoth 2. This is a spit-and-polish release, with some new features to play with, but the emphasis on refining the Quoth 2 content, re-balancing some monsters, fixing old bugs, and keeping Quoth as lightweight as possible."

Note: This release was nuked, because it does not include the correct files. → The proper release is available here.

file.author: Preach, necros, Kell
file.title: Quoth 2.2 [PROPER]
file.description:
"Welcome to the third edition of Quoth 2. This is a spit-and-polish release, with some new features to play with, but the emphasis on refining the Quoth 2 content, re-balancing some monsters, fixing old bugs, and keeping Quoth as lightweight as possible."

This is the full version. The smaller version 2.2 patch to update an existing 2.1 installation is available here.

file.description:
