It features modified and new enemies/bosses, weapons and misc. objects, and is based on the Arcane Dimensions devkit (included). The setting is inspired by Dark Souls and Bloodborne, among other things.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits and BSP2 + protocol 999 support. At the time of release, only Quakespasm 0.93.2 can run it without issues.

file.author: Jon Richter
file.title: Ravenous
file.description:
Smallish castle with a library and 'digestive dungeon' beneath. Comes with a custom music track and a few screenshots. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: raven33 / Lilybug33
file.title: Ravisod
file.description: Mini-episode with two around medium-sized base levels and a start map. The map sources are included.

file.author: G. Pastor
file.title: RAZ
file.description: Rather poor and short rectangular-cave map.

file.author: Robert "Fat Controller" Cruickshank
file.title: The Frater Fracas
file.description: Medium sized IKbase map.

file.author: Robert "Fat Controller" Cruickshank
file.title: Swamp & Towne
file.description: A medium sized, dark and hostile swamp, and a large medieval town with a few custom textures. The second map centers on the cult of Koth.

file.author: Robert "Fat Controller" Cruickshank
file.title: Fat Controller's Old Maps
file.description: Actually the only SP map in this pack is RC0: COMING OUT PARTY from 1998. It is a quite hard and evil base map. Has some mean traps so make sure you save often.

file.author: Jesse van Dijk
file.title: Runner's Delight
file.description: Six SP/DM maps of varying sizes and themes, designed specifically (but not exclusively) for speed-running. Comes with some custom progs, e.g. rotating objects, and a start map.

file.author: Jesse van Dijk
file.title: Runner's Delight (BUGFIX)
file.description: "This patch fixes a bug in RDE's original progs.dat: When you record a coop demo on rdend, there were one or two (depending on the skill setting) hellknights who did not teleport in when you picked up the nailgun. Now they appear as they should."

file.author: J.F.Gustafsson
file.title: Far beyond reality
file.description: Medium sized Wizard with a small cavern bit.

file.author: Andrew Yoder
file.title: Recursion
file.description: Small Knave-textured space map with exploration/rune-hunting; the map restarts itself when collecting each rune. The map source is included.

file.author: Kell
file.title: Red 777
file.description:
Large interconnected red Knave-style castle with excellent construction and an insane number of secrets.

Note: This map requires Quoth.

file.author: Redfield
file.title: Unknown Kadath
file.description: Medium-sized 'classic-style' medieval level with a church and lava-filled caverns beneath. Ok.

file.author: Steve Wilson
file.title: The Red Room
file.description: Small Wizard-like map with a few custom textures. According to redrum.txt, this is the deathmatch version of "Valley of the Wind" (wind.zip).

file.author: Markie
file.title: Reliquary
file.description:
First "alpha" version of a mod based off of Copper with some new and modified weapons, such as a pistol and triple-barrelled shotgun, and more challenging gameplay. It comes with two levels plus a start map: a medium-sized sewage facility and a large medieval castle dungeon. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Gotshun
file.title: Requiem
file.description:
Singleplayer campaign featuring four large levels as well as a start map. It appears to be a very close tribute/remix of Honey, following the same theme of tall brick structures, and corresponding design/layout traits. Additionally, there is a rebuilt version of Quake's E1M5.

Note: These maps require an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Thobias "Loke" Fast
file.title: Fortress of Resurrection
file.description: Small symmetrical medieval level with a base exit.

file.author: mfx
file.title: Arlyeh Center for Heart Diseases
file.description:
A rebalanced version of mfx's map from Retro Jam 1: a medieval building nestled in a rocky cavern and fronted by a lake of slime. Features traps and tough combat.

Note: This map is meant to be played with the Retro Jam 1 pack.

file.author: ericw, mfx, Scampie, Skacky, sock
file.title: Retro Jam 1 - Medieval/Castle Theme
file.description:
Impromptu map jam following a "retro" medieval/castle theme: five small maps by ericw, mfx, Scampie, Skacky and sock. It comes with optional medieval-style item models, and the map sources are included.

Note: A rebalanced version of mfx's map is available here, and a fixed version of Skacky's map is available here. An expanded and polished standalone version of Sock's map is available here.

file.author: Skacky
file.title: Dysnystaxis (...A Chance Meeting With Somnus)
file.description:
A fixed version of Skacky's map from Retro Jam 1 (fixes an issue that made it impossible to load saved games): A small map set in a medieval courtyard and the surrounding buildings. Features somewhat non-linear gameplay.

Note: This map is meant to be played with the retrojam1 pack.

file.author: Skacky, sock, RickyT23
file.title: Retro Jam 2 - Fantasy Brick Cities in the Skies Theme
file.description: Speedy map jam following the theme "Fantasy brick cities in the skies": three floating maps by Skacky, Sock and RickyT23. It comes with optional medieval-style item models.

file.author: FifthElephant, skacky
file.title: Retro Jam 3 - Vertical Metal/Runic Theme
file.description:
Third retro map jam: two "Vertical metal / runic"-themed maps by FifthElephant and skacky. The map sources are included in the pak.

Note: A "DLC" pack for Retro Jam 3 with three additional maps is available here.

file.author: ionous, negke, skacky
file.title: Retro Jam 3 DLC
file.description:
Three vertical metal/runic-themed maps - late entries to Retro Jam 3, ironically labeled "DLC". The map sources are included.

Note: ionous' map requires a source port with BSP2 support; skacky's map requires a port with increased limits.

file.author: ericw, FifthElephant, ItEndsWithTens, PulSaR, TextFish, Scampie, Skacky, Zwiffle
file.title: Retro Jam 4 - Episode 4 Tribute Theme
file.description: Four-day 'retro' map jam following an Episode 4 tribute theme. The result is eight small, dark and brutal levels by various authors. The map sources are included.

file.author: DeeDoubleU
file.title: Ascension
file.description: Small medieval/Episode 4-style level, originally started for Retro Jam 4. The map source is included.

file.author: PuLSaR
file.title: The Elder Reality
file.description:
Medium-sized Elder World-style map that features at least one room from each level in the fourth episode of Quake (except for E4M1). An expanded version of the author's Retro Jam 4 entry.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

This is the version with minor cosmetic fixes. Original file a27e2f42a2a42eb50eb99e6255db9494 is in the trash/ directory.

file.author: Bloughsburgh, Breezeep, ItEndsWithTens, NewHouse, QMaster, Shamblernaut, skacky
file.title: Retro Jam 5 - The Wind Tunnels theme
file.description: Fifth "retro" map jam held at Func_Msgboard, following a E3M5/The Wind Tunnels theme, resulting in seven small to medium-sized levels. The map sources are included.

file.author: Bloodshot, Bloughsburgh, Breezeep, Danzadan, DOOMer, dumptruck, FifthElephant, ionous, Khreathor, Lane Powell, MukOr, Naitelveni, NewHouse, onetruepurple, PuLSaR, skacky, Shadesmaster
file.title: Retro Jam 6 - Egyptian theme
file.description: Sixth "retro" map jam - featuring 17 small to medium-sized Egyptian-themed levels by various authors. It comes with custom visuals for the items, several skyboxes, and the map sources are included.

file.author: negke
file.title: Egyptgington
file.description:
Medium-sized Egyptian pyramid level, originally started for the Retro Map Jam 6 community event. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires either a source port with increased limits, or needs to be run as a mod using the included progs.dat file.

file.author: Danz, Chris Holden, Eduardo Sánchez Barrios, Entsoy, Greenwood, ish, iYago, Radiatoryang, RickyT23, Scythe, Zigi
file.title: Retro Jam 7 - Koohoo Theme
file.description:
A pack of 10 Koohoo themed Mesoamerican temple maps made in two weeks, for vanilla Quake. Custom start map is included, and map source is included.

Note: some maps may need a source port / modern engine with increased limits.

see also: past Retro Jam packs

file.author: Taskmaster
file.title: Retinal Tear
file.description: A very well designed medieval map that could easily be one of the good old Quake maps by id. With better lighting and sexy brushwork this would have gotten the "Excellent" rating.

file.author: Daniel Remar
file.title: Deepest Oblivion
file.description: Dark oldschool dungeon level, originally made in 2019.

file.author: Daniel Remar
file.title: Citadel of Fire
file.description: Dark oldschool lava temple level, originally made in 2019.

file.author: Rhoq
file.title: Mars Base Excavation Incident
file.description:
Large Doom-style level using original Doom textures. It starts out in a remake/conversion of E1M1 and provides a journey through various base and underground/marble temple areas, effectively using a Doom-like layout. Comes with a custom skybox and a music track.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Rhoq & negke
file.title: Court of Fools (single player version)
file.description: Smallish white brick level with a garden and a lava-filled atrium; the single player version of rhoqtdm1. The map source is included.

file.author: Rhoq & negke
file.title: Vivat Rex Lividum (single player version)
file.description: Small to medium-sized blueish medieval level; the single player version of rhoqtdm2. The map source is included.

file.author: Qmaster
file.title: Stalwart Stone
file.description: Small Ebon-style level based on E4M4. The map source is included.

file.author: David White (NiX)
file.title: Rings2
file.description:
Very small arena combat map. Pointless.
Map source is included.

file.author: Chris Burgess
file.title: Escape the Base
file.description:
Small to medium Base map. OK.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Chris Burgess
file.title: Escape the Castle
file.description: Small to medium Metal map. OK.

file.author: Tyrann & negke
file.title: Dark Ritual (single player version)
file.description: Medium-sized nightly industrial base where a dark ritual is being performed; the single player version of ritual, though slightly expanded. The GPL map source is included.

file.author: Cocerello
file.title: Work is a Nightmare
file.description:
Large turtlemap with some freedom of choice in progression and plenty of short side areas, for vanilla Quake. The map features coop spawn points and has deathmatch support, and even Omicron bots play decently.

A late entry to Retro Jam 7 - Koohoo Theme. Map source is included.

file.author: Tyler McNamee
file.title: Tyger's Lair
file.description: Small and pointless whatever.

file.author: RickyT23, Speedy, Spirit, Willem, Zwiffle
file.title: Remix Map Pack
file.description:
Results of the 2008 remix competition at Func_Msgboard: five remixes/remakes of original id maps.

e2m1rmx by Spirit
e3m4rmx by Willem
e3m5rmx by Speedy
e4m1rmx by RickyT23
e4m7rmx by Zwiffle

Running the pack from a mod directory is optional - if one wishes to access the maps from the included start map.
(Some maps are released under the terms of GPL: sources)

file.author: super
file.title: Reign of Ra
file.description: Very small level using sock's Egyptian textures.

file.author: Kevin Rohling
file.title: Hello
file.description: Huge plain rooms, hard, silly.

file.author: Gregory Keen
file.title: The Roritor Level
file.description: Medium sized Metal/Base laboratory with a few custom textures such as paintings and blackboards. Loosely based on the movie "Brain Candy".

file.author: vIE888
file.title: Retribution of the ConeScript
file.description:
A medieval/fantasy episode with 11 small levels. It is hub-based and features an RPG-like 'quest' gameplay. Comes with a complete set of replacement sounds and music.

Note: This episode requires Nehahra and it is recommended to use the Darkplaces engine.

file.author: Scott McNutt
file.title: Royal Warriors
file.description: Small Wizard tower-like map. Nothing special.

file.author: R.P.G.
file.title: Quake Condensed
file.description: Mini episode consisting of five small polished-up speedmaps, each following one of Quake's native texture themes.

file.author: R.P.G.
file.title: Penile Devastation
file.description: Medium-sized detailed Metal map.

file.author: Hrimfaxi, ijed, mfx
file.title: Rubicon Rumble Pack
file.description:
Four very large industrial/base maps based on Rubicon 2. Includes a start map and introduces some new gameplay elements.

Note: These maps require an engine port with BSP2 support.
A patched version of the map telefragged is available here.

file.author: Zied Rieke
file.title: Reload
file.description: Short episode with five small Base maps. The mission is to infiltrate some bioforge facility, retrieve a genetic code stored on a keycard and return to entrance slipgate.

file.author: XeNoN
file.title: Return to Earth
file.description:
Four maps that gradually become more elaborate and sophisticated, mirroring the author's growth as a level designer.

Note: this file was repacked by Spirit.

file.author: John "metlslime" Fitzgibbons
file.title: Rubicon
file.description: Large rusty metal/industrial complex with custom textures, a few code tweaks, a start map and a cool Zelda tribute secret level.

file.author: metlslime & czg
file.title: Rubicon 2
file.description: Three-map base/industrial campaign with new textures, three new monsters, and a few other additions.

file.author: Rodrigo HernandeZ B.
file.title: Ruliano
file.description: Large stone map with many custom textures, several new monsters such as agents and cyborgs (?), a few new weapons, and some custom progs like rotation and cutscences. All text messages are in Spanish. OK.

file.author: distrans
file.title: Recurrent Rumours
file.description: Large Wizard map with quite a bit of thematic varation.

file.author: c0j
file.title: Typhon's Dead Underworld
file.description: Small runic level with an additional skill selection map. The map source is included.

file.author: Rcktrob
file.title: Rune Keep
file.description: Non-transparent water version of runekeepgl: a large, detailed Medieval fortress.

file.author: Rcktrob
file.title: Rune Keep
file.description: Transparent water version of runekeep: a large, detailed Medieval fortress.

file.author: Bloughsburgh
file.title: Rune of Blood
file.description:
Mini-episode consisting of three small levels and a start map. Some of the author's very first maps.

Note: These maps require Quoth.

file.author: Connor Fitzgerald
file.title: THE RUNE-RUN
file.description: Oh well, a sda (speedrunning) map. Ugly looks etc. If you desperately need something to play then go ahead, otherwise you won't miss anything by not playing this. ;)

file.author: super
file.title: Runic Fear
file.description: Small to medium-sized runic level with an interconnected layout.

file.author: Miss Bubbles
file.title: Unholy Ossuary
file.description: Medium-sized classic Episode 3-style runic level.

file.author: Jonas N.P. Lindstrom
file.title: The house of Sadlark (2)
file.description: Medium sized cramped odd Metal etc map.

file.author: Jonas N.P. Lindstrom
file.title: The Base of Sadlark
file.description: Medium sized base map with many oddly or unaligned textures.

file.author: Jonas N.P. Lindstrom
file.title: The domain of Sadlark
file.description: Medium sized Wizard/Metal/Hiptemple map. Some buttons are hidden in secret areas.

file.author: Jonas N.P. Lindstrom
file.title: The House Of Sadlark
file.description: A city courtyard / temple type map with heavy emphasis on RED textures, although e3 metal style is also present in some temple areas. Architecture and gameplay are vintage Sadlark-style: small and cramped with emphasis on small, efficient groups of enemy in extremely narrow confines. Enemy surprises abound everywhere. There are a few death-traps, but of the entertaining rather than frustrating variety.

file.author: Jonas N.P. Lindstrom
file.title: The sacrifice of flesh
file.description: Largish Metal map divided into four 'chapters'.

file.author: Jonas N.P. Lindstrom
file.title: Dig me no grave
file.description: Medium "non linear (sort of) Sadlark metal style map."

file.author: Jonas N.P. Lindstrom
file.title: Temple of Amon-Sadlark
file.description: Largish Egyptian-style temple with tombs, a few traps, and so on.

file.author: Jonas N.P. Lindstrom
file.title: The four runes of Sadlark
file.description: Smallish hub map, each branch in a different texture style. Nice.

file.author: Unknown
file.title: Satanden
file.description: Smallish bland Wizard/ Metal map with large rooms and very few monsters.

file.author: Stijn Raiguel
file.title: Satan's Cathedral
file.description: Medium-sized blue cathedral. Slighly buggy and may run slow on older machines.

file.author: Scragbait
file.title: Scragbait's Estate
file.description: Large medieval brick estate with subterranean water caverns. It also includes a small start level and an unfinished end map.

file.author: YooShin Yang
file.title: Sadistic Blue
file.description: Small and cramped blue brick level in Azure Agony style with many Quad secrets.

file.author: The Solipsist
file.title: Swarm Breach Torrent Fight
file.description:
Medium-sized base map; a maze of dark corridors with exploration/invasion-based gameplay. The map source is included.
"Swarm Breach Torrent Fight is a Quake adaptation of Space Beast Terror Fright by Nornware. The map uses procedural variation to populate each area, the map provides a complete game mode intended for cooperative play."

Note: This map requires Copper 1.16 and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: SgtCrispy
file.title: Can't Stop Me Now
file.description:
Small oldschool base level.

Note: An updated version is available here.

file.author: Scampie
file.title: Dead Memories
file.description: Medium-sized idbase map with many crates and a critical slipgate malfunction.

file.author: scar3crow
file.title: The Ensnared Horizon
file.description:
Medium-sized Ebon fortress/metal-themed level. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Noel Weer
file.title: Schist
file.description:
Episode consisting of 5 medium sized levels, a start and a secret map, some new textures and sounds, and custents stuff
The first few maps are bases in snowy canyons, the last few otherworldly castles.

file.author: NCMark
file.title: Quake City
file.description: Medium-sized dark city/realism map with backyards, warehouses and sewers.

file.author: J.F.Gustafsson
file.title: Scoop of chaos
file.description: Small base map with an AAC in an outdoor area, a pumping station and a tank. OK.

file.author: Michael Reed
file.title: Scorn Quake Level
file.description: An ok-ish blue metal map, quite confusing at moments but overall quite entertaining to play.

file.author: Qmaster
file.title: Ire and Abbeys
file.description: Very small ruined cathedral with a graveyard and arena combat. The map source is included. An early map by the author from 2009.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: Star Scream
file.description: Small, intense Coagula space map.

file.author: Zied Rieke
file.title: Severe Exposure
file.description: Small to medium-sized base/industrial facility with a slightly nonlinear touch to gameplay.

file.author: Daryl Deep
file.title: Seaview
file.description: Small submarine base; features some material ripped from other mods, e.g. Scourge of Armagon and Zerstörer.

file.author: Peter van Wingerden
file.title: The House of Seraphim
file.description: Medium-sized puzzle map with Hipnotic/Metal textures. The layout is cramped and fairly nonlinear, the gameplay relies heavily on finding secret areas and hidden buttons.

file.author: Inforatt (?)
file.title: Series 1
file.description: Episode with six small to medium, poorly contructed and leaked maps in various texture themes.

file.author: Hrimfaxi
file.title: Sewage devastation
file.description: A big green swampy sewage system. Build in short time in a speedmapping fashion.

file.author: Francis Fearon
file.title: The Sewer
file.description: Small sewer map with a few custom textures and lava columns?!

file.author: Brian Kline (Larry)
file.title: Seweage Playground
file.description:
Small to medium Base-themed sewer map with lots of pipes and an outside area.

Note: This map has to be played in Scourge of Armagon.

file.author: Andrew Yoder, Artistical, Axebeard, Burnham, Greenwood, khreathor, MortalMaxx, Nolcoz, Pinchy, Ryan Trawick, Ubiquitous
file.title: Quake Sewer Jam
file.description:
Community mapping pack with 11 sewer-themed levels and a start map based on the Extras mod with a few additions, among which are two new enemies. It also features custom skyboxes and a few music tracks. The map sources are included.

Note: Some of these map require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Brett Wilcock
file.title: Slaughterfest 97
file.description: Large 2D-ish map with an ugly hodgepodge of texture themes and architectural ideas. And a Baywatch poster...

file.author: Steve Clarke
file.title: Notlob's Parting Shot
file.description: Medium to large Wizard castle.

file.author: Steve Clarke
file.title: Notlob's Residence
file.description: Medium sized, plain Wizard map. Somewhat of a sequel to sgc3.

file.author: Steve Clarke
file.title: Notlob's Base
file.description: Base map.

file.author: Steve Clarke
file.title: Notlob's Castle
file.description: Medium sized Wizard castle.

file.author: Steve Clarke
file.title: Notlob's Moonshot
file.description: Large, somewhat non-linear/hub Base map.

file.author: Rain Rannu (Spacegod)
file.title: Tale of Abbot's Rune
file.description: Short story-driven SP "hub" with 3 maps. Very original style and gameplay!

file.author: Ben Horsley
file.title: Star Gate Quest
file.description: Short base map, some good ideas but overall pretty bland. Comes with sounds from Half-Life which don't really fit (the weapon sounds at least). It also got a tiny skill selection map.

file.author: Steve Rescoe
file.title: Shadow over Innsmouth
file.description: Large medieval village with a few new textures and reskinned monsters. Somewhat of a sequel to "Village of Dread".

file.author: Steve Rescoe
file.title: Shadow over Innsmouth (GL)
file.description: This is the GLquake version of shadow supporting transparent water.

file.author: Alan Troup
file.title: Shaft of the Soulless
file.description: One room with a "water elevator", struts and monsters. Very boring.

file.author: David Hocking
file.title: Shafted
file.description:
Small speedrunning map.
A nice challenge for speedrunners, but pointless for regular players.

file.author: Chris
file.title: Sham
file.description: *Very* small (and very early?) wizard level. Map file is included.

file.author: Shambler
file.title: Crown Of Thorns
file.description: Very small map with a blue castle in a canyon. Comes with a custom skybox.

file.author: Shambler
file.title: Warmth Of A Dying Sun
file.description:
Medium-sized Egyptian-style level. Comes with a custom desert skybox.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Shambler
file.title: The Age Of The No Penis Mapper
file.description:
Small joke map of sorts; a phallus worship shrine erected inside a slimey green cavity.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Shelvid_
file.title: Equivocal Facility
file.description: Small to medium-sized military base with nightly outside areas. The map source is included.

file.author: Sidhe
file.title: Dorghael Arhlannen
file.description:
Medium-sized ikwhite-themed temple with nice gameplay and a boss-fight.

Note: This map requires Quoth.

file.author: Jordan Barington
file.title: The Shining
file.description: A house without textures.

file.author: Glenn French
file.title: Shadow Keep
file.description: Very small Wizard map with a water area.

file.author: Marc Laidlaw
file.title: Chapel Shoggoth
file.description: Small to medium chapel with a graveyard and caverns beneath. Lots of back and forth running between the rooms.

file.author: Étienne (Blood Man) Bégin
file.title: Shoot
file.description: Very small and very pointless Medieval map (+ a skill selection map and three demos) unnecessarily bundled in a .pak. Source is included.

file.author: Ben Watson
file.title: Shoradar
file.description: Small level, a fort and a castle with abstract blue interiors in a canyon. Low ammo balance.

file.author: RickyT23
file.title: Three Towers And A Sick Base
file.description:
Large open base map set inside a lava canyon.

Note: This map requires Quoth and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Neil Manke
file.title: Silhouette of Darkness
file.description: A medium sized medieval map with new textures, gameplay focuses largely on discovering secrets.

file.author: Qubix
file.title: Security Base
file.description: A small base map. The brushwork is promising but the gameplay is a bit boring.

file.author: Qubix
file.title: SIMMER2
file.description: Nonstop Grunt Slaughter! The map is nice, some beautiful worked elements and good monster placement. You won't get a lazy moment. Also this map features a very good custom skin on the grunts.

file.author: Andrew Yoder
file.title: Simplex
file.description: Large green jungle temple with some puzzles involving ancient machinery. Sort of a sequel to Ruins of Mazotac. The map source is included.

file.author: Chris Holden
file.title: Sinister Cistern
file.description: Around medium-sized blood cistern level using terracotta-style custom textures. The map source is included.

file.author: DragonsForLunch, Entsoy, Heresy, Mazu, Naitelveni, Newhouse, PalmliX, Qmaster, RadiatorYang, Rooster
file.title: Sinister 625
file.description:
Community mapping event in celebration of Quake's 25th anniversary: nine large levels in varying themes + a starting hub, all following the "625" rule of using only six different textures (6 for June), featuring two surprises and five enemy types (2 and 5 for 25 years of Quake). They run on the Progs_dump mod (included) and come with additional sounds, models, skyboxes and music tracks in two formats. The map and qc sources are included.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.
An updated version is available here.

file.author: Bill Graham/billcat
file.title: Vampire Sisters
file.description: Absolutely ugly and stupid medium sized map.

file.author: Sid
file.title: The Turkey Shoot
file.description: A shooting range with bouncing monsters. Fun for a couple of seconds.

file.author: skacky
file.title: Conference of the Shamblers
file.description:
Huge Knave-style fortress with many enemies and secrets. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Quoth and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: George Grotans
file.title: SkyMaze
file.description:
Leaked, ugly and symmetrical maze with sky as walls.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Neil Manke
file.title: The Slaughterhouse
file.description: Small to medium-sized realism map with custom textures, set in a slaughterhouse, complete with bloody slaughter areas, freezer, and manager's office.

file.author: RickyT23
file.title: Slave to a Machine
file.description: A large tech/industrial base map using Daikatana, Doom3 and Half-Life textures.

file.author: SgtStabStabs
file.title: Enter Sleepgate
file.description:
Medium-sized base map.

Note: This map requires Quoth.

file.author: Bruce W. Krueger
file.title: Slipgate research complex
file.description: Medium sized base map with horrible texturing and lighting (passages needed to proceed hidden in pitch black areas).

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: Sludge Factory
file.description:
Two industrial/slime-themed maps with custom textures and horde-based combat: a large factory in a canyon and a small oil rig on an ocean of slime.

Note: These maps require the Drake mod and an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: generic, Pulsar, Zwiffle
file.title: Speedmapping pack 100 - Unthemed
file.description: Unthemed / 3 SP maps / generic, Pulsar, Zwiffle

file.author: negke
file.title: Down the ratbit hole
file.description:
Medium sized medieval library map using Knave textures - made for the SM100 turtlemap event.

This is a newer version than the one included in sm100turtle.zip. It has a critical bug fixed that could crash the game under certain circumstances.

file.author: Cocerello, digs, DOOMer, FifthElephant, Scampie
file.title: Speedmapping pack 175 - Koohoo's Castle
file.description:
Koohoo's Castle / 6 SP maps / Cocerello, digs, DOOMer, FifthElephant, Scampie. This is the later release by sock with the maps not in a pak file, no additional media and sock's entry removed.

Note: Alternative versions of Cocerello's maps are included for use with Scorge of Armagon and Dissolution of Eternity.

file.author: Cocerello, DOOMer, Drew
file.title: Speedmapping pack 176 - Quantity over Quality
file.description:
Quantity over Quality / 3 SP maps / Cocerello (Quoth), DOOMer, Drew (Quoth)

Follows the same theme as Speedmapping Pack 67.The source for Cocerello's map is included.

Note: Cocerello's map and Drew's map require Quoth.

file.author: Cocerello, digs, Doomer, Shamblernaut
file.title: Speedmapping pack 177 - Escher
file.description:
Escher / 4 SP maps / Cocerello (Quoth), Doomer, digs, Shamblernaut

Speedmaps inspired by M.C. Escher. "Break your brain" (sm177_digs) by digs is a high quality map that could easily hold its own as a full release. The others are standard speedmaps. The source for Cocerello's map is included.

Note: Cocerello's map requires Quoth.

Note: Some of these maps probably require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: 4LT, Artistical, Dantescanline, dumptruck_ds, Greenwood, H4724, Hardcore Mazu, ionous, ish, negke, Nyoei, onetruepurple, quasiotter
file.title: Speedmapping pack 207 - Ceremonial speedmaps
file.description:
SM207: 13 SP maps inspired by Ceremonial Circles. Some map sources are included.

Note: quasiotter's map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Artistical, Comrade Beep, Chris Holden, Dantescanline, Greenwood, Hardcore Mazu, ionous, ish, JCR, MarkieMusic, MortalMaxx, Naitelveni, Qmaster, quasiotter
file.title: Speedmapping pack 208: Caves, Canyons & Crevices
file.description:
SM208: 14 SP maps set in or around canyons and caves. Two of them use custom skyboxes and a music track. The map sources are included.

Note: Some of these maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Greenwood, Ing-ing, Konair, quasiotter
file.title: Speedmapping pack 209 - Traps
file.description:
Speedmapping pack 209 / Traps theme / 4 SP maps + start map. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require Arcane Dimensions 1.71 and a source port with increased limits and/or BSP2 support.

file.author: Amrik, Apollo, FrikaC, Gibbie, Mystery8, Vigil
file.title: Speedmapping pack 20 - Unthemed
file.description: Unthemed / 4 SP, 2 DM maps / Amrik, Apollo, FrikaC, Gibbie, Mystery8, Vigil

file.author: Burnham, Chris Holden, Doom Pope, Entsoy, Gnemeth, Greenwood, Markie Music, Naitelveni, quasiotter, Radiator Yang, Shadesmaster
file.title: Speedmapping pack 210 - Overgrown
file.description:
SM210: 11 SP maps with an "overgrown" theme. Comes with a few custom skyboxes. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require Copper and some of them a source port with increased limits and/or BSP2 support.
[Cannot be run through the Quake Injector]

file.author: Bloodworks, bmFbr, Cunnah, Greenwood, Naitelveni, quasiotter, zigi
file.title: Speedmapping pack 211 - Moving parts
file.description:
Seven smallish maps with moving objects. They are based on the Copper mod (included) and come with custom skyboxes and two music tracks. Some map sources are included.

Note: Some of these maps require a source port with increased limits and/or BSP2 support.

file.author: DragonsForLunch, dumptruck_ds, Giftmacher, Greenwood, iLike80sRock, Naitelveni, Qmaster, zigi
file.title: Speedmapping pack 212 - Deathmatch Remix
file.description:
Eight deathmatch levels remixed for single player, most of them based on the stock DM maps. They run on the SMP mod (included) and come with two skyboxes plus a music track. The map sources are included.

Note: Some of these maps require a source port with increased limits and/or BSP2 support.

file.author: alexUnder, allcaps, bmFbr, dumptruck_ds, gnemeth, Greenwood, h4724, Mazu, MortalMaxx, Nyoei, zigi
file.title: Speedmapping pack 213 - Low Gravity
file.description:
Two-day speedmapping event following a "low gravity" theme with 10 small to medium-sized levels and a start hub. It runs on the SMP mod (included) and comes with a custom skybox and a music track. The map sources are included.

Note: Some of these maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: AlexUnder, Breezeep, ChrisHolden, DanteScanline, DragonsForLunch, DraQu, EduardoDeadPixel, Greenwood, iLike80sRock, JaycieErysdren, Konig, Mari Mk.V,, Mazu, Mememind, Moesh, Mrtaufner, Nostalgick (burnham), Omni, Pinchy, pqp, Riktoi, The_kovic, zigi
file.title: Speedmapping pack 214 - Prototype textures II
file.description:
23 small to medium-sized maps using khreathor's Prototype texture wad and Dumptruck's SMP progs (included). Comes with a custom music track. The map sources are included.

Note: Some of these maps probably require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Arnau, Comrade Beep, Brendy Caldwell, Chris Holden, dumptruck_ds, gnemeth, Greenwood, Mazu, iLike80sRock, iYago, Magnetbox, Markie, Pqp, Quasiotter, Riktoi, Scythe
file.title: Speedmapping pack 215 - Quad Run
file.description:
An assorted pack of 15 levels made in 48 hours for a community speedmapping jam, all centered around the Quad Damage powerup.

Built with the Speedmapping Progs dev kit, already included.

Custom start map has built-in difficulty select. ZIP includes map source.

Note: probably requires a modern source port / engine with increased limits.

file.author: 4LT, Chris Holden, Cocerello, ish, Newhouse, ZungryWare
file.title: Speedmapping pack 216 - Communal Paint Bucket
file.description:
A pack of 6 levels made in 48 hours for a community speedmapping jam where participants had one day to make textures, and then one day to make a map with only those textures. (Textures by ZungryWare, Chris Holden, 4LT, ish, riktoi, wiedo, JaycieErysden, iLike80sRock, quasiotter, therektafire, and MissLavender.)

Built with the Speedmapping Progs dev kit (already included).

Custom start map has built-in difficulty select. ZIP includes map source.

Note: probably requires a modern source port / engine with increased limits.

file.author: alexUnder, Chris Holden, DariusGi, Greenwood, Mazu, ish, iYago, Newhouse, riktoi, Yoder, VuRkka, zigi
file.title: Speedmapping pack 218 - Episode 4
file.description:
Eleven small classic-style / vanilla maps made in 48 hours, all themed after Quake episode 4 - The Elder World.

Custom start map is included, as well as map source.

Note: some maps may require a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: alexUnder, Chris Holden, cript, DraQu, Mazu, ish, Mista Heita, muk, omni, Pinchy, SFAriel, stickflip, wiedo, ZungryWare
file.title: Speedmapping pack 219 - 40oz Bounce
file.description:
15 small / medium sized maps made in three days, with one design constraint: only 40 monsters or less. Built on Copper v1.19 (already included) and map source files are included too.

Note: there is no custom start map, so levels must be loaded manually via console.

Note 2: the map sm219_ish2.bsp is in a hidden folder, and must be manually moved into the root of the /maps/ folder to play it.

file.author: Gibbie, Misyu, NaNe, Tron, Vigil
file.title: Speedmapping pack 21 - Wood and stone, containing at least 1 bridge
file.description: Wood and stone, containing at least 1 bridge / 5 SP maps / Gibbie, Misyu, NaNe, Tron, Vigil

file.author: 4LT, Adib, Alekswithak, Burnham, ChrisHolden, Doritos420, Dataram57, Eber150, Esrael, Fairweather, HrnekBezucha, ish, Joober, Krak, Lapax, Leoim, Mazu, Mrtaufner, Nolcoz, Omni, Pinchy, Poopfiend, Riktoi, Stickflip, Sze, zigi
file.title: Speedmapping pack 220 - Prototype Jam 3
file.description:
28 levels + custom start map, offering a variety of map sizes and gameplay themes. All maps were made in 1-2 weeks, using the Prototype textures by Khreathor. Built on Copper v1.19 (already included) with some extra Prototype-themed assets (models, UI) by Kebby. Map source files are included.

See also: SM214 Prototype Jam 2, SM206 Prototype Jam 1

Note: probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits and BSP2 support.

file.author: Alekswithak, lzj125, omni, Mazu, riktoi, Greenwood, mrtaufner, gnemeth, Colossus, Pinchy, Shadesmaster, ChrisHolden
file.title: Speedmapping pack 221 - Bridges
file.description:
A pack of 12 bridge-themed maps made in 48 hours with some custom music, built on Copper v1.19 (already included). Map source is included too.

There's no custom start map for this release, so you must manually load the levels via console (prefixed with "sm221_") and make sure to set your desired skill level too.

Note: probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: than
file.title: Title
file.description: This map was originally made in two hours for the 24th Speedmap pack. For those who don't know, Speedmapping is simply to make a map in a set timelimit.The timelimit for this map was 100 minutes so I obviously failed :( Anyway, I made the architecture with 10 minutes left and added monsters in the following 15 minutes but was then blighted by compile problems and then stupid quake crashes. The first version of the map that was released (sm24_than) had no lighting, more bugs and worse gameplay. I quite liked the map so I decided to spend a little more time on itand re-release this special edition forQExpo.
