file.title: Speedmapping pack 98 and 99 - Complex
file.description: Complex / - / 10 SP maps / bambuz, generic, tron, zwiffle, voodoochopstiks, neg!ke, than

file.author: bambuz
file.title: Speedmap 98 bambuz
file.description:
Unthemed / 1 SP map / bambuz
Original pack: sm9899_pack"

file.author: Aardappel, Cybear, Damaul, iNaNe, BlackPope, Scampie, XeNoN
file.title: Speedmapping pack 9 - Unthemed
file.description: Unthemed / 7 SP maps / Aardappel, Cybear, Damaul, iNaNe, BlackPope, Scampie, XeNoN

file.author: Aesopolis, AlexUnder, Chris Holden, Greenwood, ish, RickyT23, Shadesmaster, stickflip, Yoder
file.title: Speedmapping pack 217 - Remaster Textures
file.description:
Nine small / medium maps made in a week using MachineGames' new textures for the rerelease. A variety of themes and styles, has something for everyone.

Based on Copper mod (already included). Custom start map, MAP source, and QC source code is included.

Note: probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: DraQu
file.title: Eye Sore
file.description: Small purple-bricked castle level. The map source is included.

file.author: LuGia, Mazu, NewHouse, Smilecythe, uKKo, VuRkka, zigi, Immorpher
file.title: Torrent of Impurities (Epäpuhtauksien Virta)
file.description:
Finnish mappers episode jam 2, the sequel to Realm of the Lost: seven large maps in varying themes, based on the Copper mod (included). It also features four new monsters, a new boss, a few new sounds and music tracks.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Ing-ing, Mazu, Naitelveni, NewHouse, Smilecythe, uKKo, VuRkka, zigi
file.title: Realm of the Lost (Menetettyjen Valtakunta)
file.description:
A Finnish mappers episode jam based on the Copper mod (included) with nine medium to large maps in varying themes, including a start hub and a secret level. It also features a few new sounds and music tracks by Immorpher.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits.
An updated version (1.13) is available here.

file.author: Fix, MargSabl, Mazu, Myki, NewHouse, omni, Pinchy, riktoi, VuRkka, wiedo, zigi
file.title: SMEJ Jam
file.description:
Community map pack inspired by SMEJ and SMEJ2: nine small to large levels plus a start/hub map in varying themes, mostly set in snowy Finnish landscapes. It is based on the SMEJ2 mod (included) and features new enemies, models, custom textures, skyboxes and music tracks. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits; Mazu's map additionally requires BSP2 support.

file.author: Scott McNutt
file.title: SM Levels Pack for QUAKE
file.description: "The SM Levels Pack for Quake is a Partial Conversion utilizing some of the best QC mods that one can find. Some of the enhancements are the Chase Cam, Heads Up Display, a new Player Skin, a Flashlight, Flares, Ejecting Shotgun Shells, Gyro's Indecisive BOT for DeathMatch play, EarthQuakes, Rain, more Ambient Sounds, Exploding Walls, Gib Fountains and a few select NEW monsters. They are Willy the Spider, Snakeman (2 different types) and 2 surprise monsters. Most of Quake's original monsters have been modified in some way. I also added a few new weapons. The Pulse Rifle, Cluster Bombs and some Poison Gas Bombs are just waiting to be used on those who stand in your way. There are also a few other surprises." - 7 SP maps, including start and end map, 1 DM map

file.author: negke, Zwiffle
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo 2006 #1 - Ten years later
file.description: Ten years later / 2 SP maps / neg!ke, Zwiffle

file.author: bambuz, generic, lurker, negke, Zwiffle
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo 2006 #2 - Episode 1 in one map
file.description: Episode 1 in one map / 5 SP maps / bambuz, generic, lurker, neg!ke, Zwiffle

file.author: negke, rudl, TextFish, Zwiffle
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo2008 #1 - Dreamscape
file.description: Dreamscape / 4 SP maps / negke, rudl, TextFish, Zwiffle

file.author: lurker, negke, Omus, Text_Fish, Zwiffle
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo2008 #2 - City in a forest
file.description: City in a forest / 5 SP maps / lurker, negke, Omus, Text_Fish, Zwiffle

file.author: negke
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo2008 #3 - Tilted
file.description: Tilted / 1 SP map / negke

file.author: adamllis, HeadThump, Lunaran, Omus, Spirit, sielwolf
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo2008 #4 - Teleporter madness
file.description: Teleporter madness / 6 SP maps / adamllis, HeadThump, Lunaran, Omus, Spirit, sielwolf

file.author: Entar, negke, Preach, Zwiffle
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo 2005 - The Emerald City
file.description: The Emerald City / 3 SP maps, 1 DM map / Entar, neg!ke, Preach, Zwiffle

file.author: Drew, generic, negke, Zwiffle
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo 2005 - Miyazaki
file.description: Miyazaki / 4 SP maps / Drew, generic, neg!ke, Zwiffle

file.author: digs, Drew, Text_Fish, Trinca, ZealousQuakeFan
file.title: Speedmapping pack QExpo 2011 - 15 years tribute
file.description: 15 years tribute / 5 SP maps / digs, Drew, Text_Fish, Trinca, ZealousQuakeFan

file.author: Artistical, Bal, Chris Holden, Burnham, Fairweather, Gnemeth, Greenwood, h4724, khreathor, Markie Music, Mazu, MikeC, Mista Heita, Newhouse, Pinchy, VoidForce
file.title: Speedmap Snack Pack
file.description:
Episode of 14 smallish speedmap-like levels in varying themes. The maps are based on the Copper mod (included) and there is a custom music track. The map sources are included.

Note: Some of these maps require a source port with increased limits and/or BSP2 support.

file.author: Fairweather & Markie, Jaycie, Voidforce, Burnham, ILike80sRock, Scythe, C0j, Radiatoryang, Bal, Wiedo, Zungryware, AlexUnder, Zigi, Grue, Mazu, Ish, Riktoi, bmFbr, Newhouse & Yoder
file.title: Speedmap Snack Pack 2 - Cosmic Hunger
file.description:
Speedmap jam pack of 19 levels from 21 authors organized into 3 episodes, all made within 48 hours. Mappers could choose from 4 themes (Cr8 base, Egypt, Firetop Mountain, or Knave) with specific weapon progressions. Most maps range from small to medium sized, and can be played from shotgun start if desired.

Contains custom start map with difficulty select. Built on Copper mod (included already). Map source is included too.

Note: This mod requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Tan Sian Yue (aka. BUBBAH)
file.title: BUBBAH's SNAKEPIT!!!
file.description:
Medium sized Medievalish map meant to be played with Bubbah's Snakeman mod.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Shamblernaut
file.title: Organic Dissociation
file.description:
Medium-sized toxic sewer/industrial base map.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.
[rezipped for Quaddicted]

file.author: Shamblernaut
file.title: Cloisterfuck
file.description:
Large cloister/castle map combining Wizard/Medieval/Metal textures. Somewhat inspired by E2M5. It comes with a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Ben Horsley
file.title: The Castle of Hell
file.description: Small, snowy map with Hexen II textures. Nothing special.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: Soul of Evil
file.description:
"Soul Of Evil is a primarily single-player Quake game, although it also supports deathmatch, cooperative, arena mode (a new type of gameplay), as well as botmatches."

Two excellent Wizard-style SP episodes with modified and new monsters, many custom textures, and seven additional deathmatch maps.

file.author: aguirRe
file.title: Soul of Evil: Indian Summer (Skins for DP)
file.description: Optional monster skins for Soul of Evil: Indian Summer. These are for the Darkplaces engine.

file.author: aguirRe
file.title: Soul of Evil: Indian Summer (Skins, glquake)
file.description: Optional monster skins for Soul of Evil: Indian Summer. These are for GLQuake engines (TGA format).

file.author: Neil Manke
file.title: Soldier of Fortune, Inc.: Episode One
file.description: Military realism mod. All custom textures, modified and reskinned monsters, friendly soldiers and some other stuff. Includes the first of three maps: a small jungle canyon/village leading to the entrance of a secret biolab facility. It is connected to sofsp2.

file.author: Neil Manke
file.title: Soldier of Fortune, Inc.: Episodes Two and Three
file.description: Military realism mod. Second part of sofsp1 (required to play!) including both the second and the third map of the mission. The interior of a secret biolab facility with mutated animals, and, again, the canyon for the retreat.

file.author: Vondur
file.title: Solarfall
file.description: Large Wizard/Ebon Fortress level. Comes with a start map.

file.author: Tronyn, PM, Tyrann, necros
file.title: Something Wicked This Way Comes
file.description:
Three-map singleplayer campaign of epic proportions: A huge arcane demon fortress built into a mountain, complete with a canyon start map and a bloody boss arena. The levels are based on the Drake mod (included) which features a plethora of new monsters and items. Many secrets and hard gameplay.

Note: These maps require a source port with BSP2 support as well as increased limits.

file.author: Graham Davis (OrbItaL)
file.title: The Source of Power
file.description:
Mini SP campaign consisting of three medium sized outdoor levels (+ start map) in Wizard/ Canyon/ Egyptian style. Uses custents and has a few new monsters like improved Grunts/ Ogres and Mechs. OK.

Note: The maps are only playable in DOS/ Winquake or a high-limit engine. For regular GL engines, download the fixed version instead: sop_v2.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Graham Davis (OrbItaL)
file.title: The Source of Power
file.description:
Fixed version of sop123 by Bengt Jardrup.

Mini SP campaign consisting of three medium sized outdoor levels (+ start map) in Wizard/Canyon/Egyptian style. Uses custents and has a few new monsters like improved Grunts/Ogres and Mechs. OK.

file.author: Derek Lawrie
file.title: Spongebath Of Satan
file.description: Medium sized Medieval/Metal map with a somewhat interesting "lightshow" at the beginning.

file.author: Qmaster
file.title: Shrine of the Fiends
file.description: Very small level based on E4M3, mostly populated by fiends. An early map by the author from 2008. The map source is included in standard and WC format.

file.author: Sonnenblume
file.title: Soul Complex
file.description: Base level. The map source is included.

file.author: Tony 'Frogger' Boyer
file.title: Staging Point
file.description: Medium sized base map.

file.author: MortalMaxx
file.title: Secrets of the Keep
file.description:
Huge town at nighttime with a castle and a big cathedral. It uses custom textures and comes with few new models, sounds, a custom skybox as well as a music track. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Paul Murphy
file.title: Technophobia!
file.description: Crude spaceship map. Has some hard and awkward puzzles.

file.author: Gilt
file.title: Symbiotic Pipe Dream
file.description: Very small curvy industrial sewage deathmatch map with monsters.

file.author: Speedy
file.title: SPD
file.description: This level was inspired by Doom2 map01. Grey-blue textures, Base-style.

file.author: spirit & negke
file.title: Zeal & Fury (single player version)
file.description: Small Wizard level; the single player version of spirit1dm3. The GPL map source is included.

file.author: Squeezit
file.title: Squire of Time
file.description:
Episode with eight mostly small oldschool levels including a start map, each in various classic Quake themes. It comes with custom music tracks by Alientale. The map sources are included.

Note: One of the levels (sq5) requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Sergey Rupasov
file.title: Into the Dark
file.description:
Large blue, somewhat E2M5ish fortress with several outside areas and a dark platforming section. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: JPL
file.title: SRC: The Slime Refinery Complex
file.description: A base map dressed in Doom 3 textures. Pretty dark and hard.

file.author: JPL
file.title: SRC2: Slime Refinery Complex - Quoth2 Version
file.description: Basically the same as src but using Quoth 2. Slightly different layout and gameplay.

file.author: Ankh
file.title: The Sewage System Massacre
file.description: Quake's E4M1 - The Sewage System with medieval monsters. Quite hard. The GPL map source is included.

file.author: RickyT23
file.title: Stark Monstrosity
file.description: A rather unlinear huge base map with outdoor parts. And you should use a decent engine like Fitzquake.

file.author: Neil Manke
file.title: Starship
file.description: Medium sized starship with all new custom textures, slightly tougher and reskinned monsters, and a few extra progs.

file.author: Neil Manke
file.title: Starship 2
file.description: Sequel of starship: a medium sized, plain map set on an icy planet with low gravity. Features new textures and reskinned/ modified monsters. OK.

file.author: Esrael
file.title: The Subterrestrial Hangar
file.description:
Small idbase level set in a miliary base/hangar. It features three distinct route choices: normal combat, permanent quad damage, and slime maze, and is supposed to be the first map of an episode focusing on these route mechanics. It comes with a few custom models, and the map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Brian Morgan (Duley)
file.title: The Stone of Tear
file.description: Medium sized stone castle with a few Metal elements.

file.author: Brendy Caldwell
file.title: Under A Stone Blanket
file.description:
Small tomb / crypt brick map built within a 1024^3 volume, textured with Makkon and based on Progs_dump (included).

Note: skill 0 (Easy) is not implemented, will play like skill 1 (Normal)?

Watch the author's design breakdown video on YouTube. Map source is included.

No custom start map, load via console command "map brendy3".

file.author: Tony Newton
file.title: The Stores
file.description: Medium sized Base map, a storage building with a power generator.

file.author: Ben Watson
file.title: Stormswift
file.description: Small and ugly hodgepodge of textures with a Star Wars shuttle prefab at the end.

file.author: mariteaux
file.title: Temple of the Strange
file.description: Medium-sized level starting out in a ruined temple leading onward to areas with various texture themes. Comes in two versions: one with colored lighting and one without. A demo and the map sources are included.

file.author: Tigger-On
file.title: Strom
file.description: Episode with nine small, poorly designed and ugly maps (including a start map, a secret map called penis.bsp and two DM maps), two reskinned monsters and a rain effect.

file.author: Peter Bisseker (tiddles)
file.title: The Last Strong Hold
file.description: Medium sized industrial base map (second version).

file.author: Brainstorm
file.title: Dis'z stupid!
file.description: Very tiny SP/DM map in the shape of a Quake rune.

file.author: Andr04x
file.title: Sub Base
file.description: Around medium-sized map with a Knave-textured courtyard, a blue subterranean church and a base. Comes with a custom skybox. The map source is included.

file.author: Sul
file.title: Sul's Dark Tower & Pit of Damnation
file.description:
A medium to large wizard pyramid. Contains (optional) laser cannon mod and a somewhat neat looking start map.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Sul
file.title: Sul's Wrath of Despair
file.description: Medium sized wizard map with optional exploration bits.

file.author: Unknown
file.title: Maze of torture
file.description: Dark stone maze.

file.author: digs
file.title: Supmut
file.description: Small map with tough arena fights in a couple of brick rooms.

file.author: Darren (Rex_Noctu) Johnson
file.title: Supply Base
file.description: Medium sized boxed Base maze with an ugly crate area and lots of darkness.

file.author: Suzanne 'Trashbang' Will
file.title: The Stars We Lost To Grief
file.description:
A small wizard / runic themed map built within a 1024x1024x1024 volume. The author's first release for Quake. Map source is included.

Note: this map requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: Suzanne 'Trashbang' Will
file.title: Head Reattachment Trauma
file.description:
Small short linear single player sci-fi base map with Makkon textures. The author's second release.

"My second Quake map after The Stars We Lost To Grief. This was an attempt to stay small-scoped and reasonable without confining myself to the strict boundaries of a 1024-unit map. It got a little out of hand, but not nearly as much as usual - that's progress, I guess."

Note: requires a modern engine / limit-removing source port. Map source file is included.

file.author: Suzanne 'Trashbang' Will
file.title: The Warmest Body In The Room
file.description:
Small dark semi-linear single-player map with minimalist brushwork and texturing. Map source is included.

"Tried to make something look alright with as few textures as possible. Yes it's dark."

NOTE: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits and colored lighting.

file.author: Tom Jackson (Paradox)
file.title: Swinfen Hell
file.description: Small town with a few simple houses and trees. Extreme portal errors make the map almost unplayable.

file.author: Nello (PSYCHO)
file.title: Somewhere in Time
file.description: Medium sized plain Wizard map with a water hub and a chapel.

file.author: Ubiquitous
file.title: Symphony of Science
file.description: Medium-sized dark underground laboratory.

file.author: Michael Contorno
file.title: Tab1: The Beginning
file.description: Medium-sized plain beginner map with mixed textures.

file.author: Qmaster
file.title: Thunderbolt Proving Grounds I
file.description:
Medium-sized green metal map with lightning gun-focused combat. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Stuart Maine
file.title: Teleportation Central
file.description: A quite unique "teleporting map" that require a lot of exploration and curiosity. Neat.

file.author: Trinca
file.title: The Tomb of Chak Toh Ich`ak
file.description: A big mayan city.

file.author: Trinca
file.title: The City of Angels
file.description: Medium-sized curvy metal castle. Originally meant for a mod but then turned into a regular map.

file.author: Peter "Da Oregon Pimp" Tew
file.title: The Doctor's Abode
file.description: Small, very plain Base map. Barely average.

file.author: TDK Team
file.title: The Demon King
file.description: Large scale partial conversion with non-linear explorational gameplay, set in a medieval/fantasy world (complete with village, castle, church, forest, temple, etc) - 14 maps in total, modified monsters, and more. Very original and nicely constructed.>

file.author: Trinca
file.title: The Death Lair
file.description:
Medium-sized brick/metal dungeon. OK.
The map source is included (Quark format).

file.author: Unknown
file.title: Tech Death
file.description: Small, dark, poorly constructed base map with a few technical devices to kill the monsters.

file.author: Tim Elek
file.title: Technophobia: Unfinished maps
file.description:
Two unfinished sci-fi base-themed maps with all-new textures, modified cyber monster skins and a few new sounds. Only added for archival purposes.
[Cannot be run through the Quake Injector]

file.author: T.H. Johansen (TJ)
file.title: Altar of Pain
file.description: Medium sized boxed Metal map.

file.author: T.H. Johansen (TJ)
file.title: Slime Ground
file.description: Medium sized woodbox map

file.author: T.H. Johansen (TJ)
file.title: Spawn City / Water World
file.description: Two medium sized Wizard/brick levels featuring Snakeman, Manga Babe and Willy the Spider monsters. Average at best.

file.author: T.H. Johansen (TJ)
file.title: Into Oblivion/Nostalgia
file.description: Two medium sized maps and a small secret map featuring Snakeman, Manga Babe, Willy the Spider and Raptor monsters. Scourge of Amargon is required as well.

file.author: T.H. Johansen (TJ)
file.title: Halls of Artemis / Apollo's Domain
file.description: Two medium to large maps with Metal/Hipnotic textures and some monsters from Dissolution of Eternity.

file.author: Jan Jakubovic
file.title: Temple of Death
file.description: Large somewhat nonlinear Wizard level.

file.author: Lka
file.title: Tempio (Temple)
file.description: Two small maps: first one is the outside of a temple and functions as a skill selection map, second one is the bland interior.

file.author: HS Xsniper (Michael Rogers)
file.title: The Temple Of Doom
file.description: Small, leaked map with a mix of Base/Metal textures and poor brushwork.

file.author: Fredrik 'PeyloW' Olsson
file.title: Temple of Tourment
file.description: Small Wizard temple in a canyon with a prison/ torture chamber beneath.

file.author: Mr Ed
file.title: The Temple
file.description: Medium sized temple with Maya and Hexen2 textures.

file.author: KenChennar alias Orl
file.title: Ter Shibboleth
file.description:
Episode with five huge, uniquely themed levels: a beach resort under a Golden Gate Bridge, a puzzle map set in an industrial storage facility, an Asian temple, a twisted otherworldly fortress, and a western mining town. Most of the maps use custom textures; the texture wads and the map sources are included.

Note: These maps require an source port with severely increased limits and BSP2 + protocol 999 support, such as Quakespasm 0.93.0 or higher.

file.author: KenChennar alias Orl
file.title: Ter Shibboleth: Drake Redux
file.description:
Redux version of the previously-released Ter Shibboleth Part 1 and Part 2, featuring various changes including a port of the first five maps to Drake.

Episode with eight huge, uniquely themed levels: a beach resort under a Golden Gate Bridge, a puzzle map set in an industrial storage facility, an Asian temple, a twisted otherworldly fortress, a desert mining town, a snowy village in the mountains, the city of Paris (complete with Notre Dame and the Eiffel tower), and an ancient Roman city next to a colosseum. Most of the maps use custom textures; the texture wads and the map sources are included.

Note: These maps require an source port with severely increased limits and BSP2 + protocol 999 support, such as Quakespasm 0.93.0 or higher. The memory heapsize needs to be set to around 1.5 GB!

file.author: KenChennar alias Orl
file.title: Ter Shibboleth Part 2
file.description:
The sequel to Ter Shibboleth, follwing the same boundary-pushing vein in three huge levels with impressive vistas: a snowy village in the mountains, the city of Paris (complete with Notre Dame and the Eiffel tower), and an ancient Roman city next to a colosseum. The levels run on the Drake mod which is included.

Note: These levels require a source port with increased limits and BSP2 support as well as server protocol 999. The memory heapsize must be set to at least 1 GB.
Due to the large open areas and no optimization (VIS), a considerable impact on performance should be expected.

file.author: czg
file.title: Terra
file.description: Episode with six medium-sized base and Wizard-themed levels, and a start map.

file.author: Qmaster
file.title: Terracity
file.description:
Huge underground necropolis in a Medieval/terracotta theme. It features the gremlin from SoA and has special optimizations for coop gameplay. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Dustin "Tronyn" Geeraert
file.title: The Terracotta Terror
file.description: Small terracotta-colored Coagula-style space map. Very nice.

file.author: sock
file.title: Chaotic Trinity
file.description:
Around medium-sized level using developer textures; a test map for AD's Chaos mode. The map source and the texture wad are included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.81.

file.author: zbidou72
file.title: Temple of Teuthis
file.description:
UPDATE, 20 April 2022: an updated version is available (teuthisv2.zip) which adds better compatibility for regular Quakespasm and Ironwail source ports.

Large dark underwater base / temple adventure map with lots of exploration. Textures by Makkon, built on extras_r5 mod by Khreathor (already included) with features like ladders. Make sure to save often, and save powerups until you really need them.

Map source is included, but there's no custom start map or difficulty settings. Load manually in console with "map teuthis"

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits. Probably won't work on regular Quakespasm, for best results use Quakespasm Spiked or vkQuake.

file.author: Leo Slayer
file.title: The Evolution
file.description:
A series of 5 small short maps for vanilla Quake from a beginner mapper back in 2000. Variety of different settings and themes, from an ice cavern to a dark castle.

Skill levels aren't included, but it's all probably more on the Hard side of things. The author advises: "Do not run around blind corners, and only use rockets when only you need it. [...] Save often."

file.author: Anders "Backspace" Persson
file.title: The Forgotten Level
file.description: Medium sized Wizard map. OK.

file.author: Anders "Backspace" Persson
file.title: The Fierce Livid
file.description: Large Metal windtunnel map. OK.

file.author: Anders "Backspace" Persson
file.title: This Feels Lurid
file.description: Large Metal runic map. OK.

file.author: Anders "Backspace" Persson
file.title: The Final Level
file.description: Large Base map. Custom progs include rotating fans. OK.

file.author: Marc Roussel
file.title: The Gate
file.description: Small Metal level. OK.

file.author: Paul Keefner
file.title: The Journey
file.description:
Large medieval lava castle map in a classic style; the author's first release. Difficulty settings aren't implemented (they're all the same). Map source is included.

Note: probably requires a source port / modern engine with increased limits.

file.author: vaf
file.title: The Metal Shrine
file.description:
Small Metal/runic map with a base part at the beginning.
[repacked for Quaddicted]

file.author: Phillippe Anchondo
file.title: The Base
file.description: Very small, leaked, absolutely horribly constructed Base map.

file.author: Repo
file.title: The Crypt
file.description: Very small Metal-style crypt.

file.author: Markus Klar
file.title: The Fly
file.description: Medium sized Base map with an original and unique twist: the illusion of walking on multiple plains - nine years before Prey. Very nice.

file.author: RickyT23
file.title: The Hand That Feeds You
file.description:
Large, interconnected base in the mountains with a lava cave beneath. It comes with a custom skybox.

Note: This map requires Quoth and a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Glenn Ancheta
file.title: The Ledge
file.description: More or less one Wizard-textured room with a few monsters.

file.author: Phil Hammond
file.title: Welcome To The Mill
file.description: Very small, very dark, very plain, and very pointless blueish maze-like map.

file.author: Stuart Maine
file.title: The Lava Mines
file.description: Medium sized Wizard map with awkward lighting in places the player is required to find buttons. Fairly poor.

file.author: Daniel Svensson
file.title: Themix
file.description: Small mixed texture map.

file.author: vIE888
file.title: The Myths
file.description: Episode with six small maps of varying themes and a few new monsters.

file.author: Mike Biggerstaff (Miko)
file.title: ThePit
file.description: Smallish mixstyle map with many long corridors, misaligned crates and an interesting glowing light effect in the main room. Comes with three demos. Map source is included.

file.author: Attila Csernyik
file.title: The Pit
file.description: Medium to large nukage processing base built into a mountain - all custom textures; strong Half-Life flair. (This is the non-speedrunning version of the map)

file.author: Gunnar Saethre
file.title: The Psychotic Installation
file.description: Smallish, nonlinear Wizard-style level with long corridors, originally designed for deathmatch.

file.author: Dann Thombs
file.title: The Pyramid
file.description:
Small, leaked white inside of a pyramid.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: N.I.B.
file.title: The Tomb
file.description: Medium sized, fairly plain Wizard 'tomb' with a few water areas.

file.author: phillipt
file.title: This Is The End
file.description: Small base map with all unaligned textures. The map source is included.

file.author: Stuart Presley
file.title: The Hall of Trilogy
file.description: Small, simple medieval map. Nothing special.

file.author: Mike_C
file.title: Through the Gates of the Silver Key
file.description:
Medium-sized oldschool-style brick dungeon level. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: WarrenM
file.title: The Hell That's Coming
file.description: Medium-sized medieval map with fairly linear gameplay and some monster modifications.

file.author: Thuby
file.title: Embrasure
file.description:
Small shadowy medieval-themed castle map.

Note: difficulty settings are not implemented (all skill levels play the same.) Map source is included.

file.author: Peter Bisseker (Tiddles)
file.title: Realm of Tiddles
file.description:
Seven small / medium classic maps made in 1998-2001 by Peter Bisseker, also known as Tiddles. A variety of themes (base, rogue brick, wizmet) in an early yet distinct style.

All levels were released separately, but were intended to lead into each other. This release is a modern repackaging by historical map appreciator Greenwood, curating all of Tiddles' single player maps together into a convenient episode. Three curation notes about this release:

1. Base X2 has been repurposed as a start map, and does not have built-in difficulty select. Make sure you manually set your skill level via console, e.g. "skill 0" is Easy.
2. The second-to-last map Garrison was supposed to lead into a last map called Rift which ended up being a deathmatch map. So instead, Greenwood has swapped in Jackboot Hero as the last level (renamed it as "rift.bsp") which perhaps makes for a better ending anyway.
3. All the maps have co-op spawns / are co-op friendly.

file.author: Tigger-On
file.title: Crap from Tigger
file.description: A mini campaign with 3 small and dark SP levels and a start map. Uses many custom textures, e.g. from Quake 2 and Doom. A demo is included. No masterpiece, but still playable.

file.author: Tigger-ON
file.title: Stray Cat
file.description: Small DM map with SP settings: an enemy base with a warehouse bit beneath. Uses Quake2 and other custom textures.

file.author: Naitelveni
file.title: The Master's Tools Will Never Dismantle the Master's House
file.description:
Late entry for the Doom Tintin Jam: a medium-sized DOOM3 base map with hell areas. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Doom Tintin Jam or Arcane Dimensions and a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.
[Cannot be played through the Quake Injector]

file.author: DMK
file.title: Titan
file.description: Small base map with many deadly traps, set on the moon Titan.

file.author: Glenn Ancheta
file.title: Tightrope
file.description: Very small and very pointless stone map.

file.author: Sascha Otterbein (mne[MON]ik)
file.title: The Monolith Complex
file.description: Large base map with a unique theme. Somewhat lacking in detail, and gameplay that may be confusing to some because it relies on exploration for the most part, but still kind of an interesting map. Nice feature: Reinforcements teleport in if the mission is not completed in within 15 minutes.

file.author: Stuart Presley
file.title: Trilogy Military Installation
file.description: Small Base map. OK.

file.author: HeadThump, Speedy, Trinca, Zwiffle
file.title: QExpo 2006 Turtlemap pack
file.description: Results of the QuakeExpo 2006 turtlemap event: 4 around medium sized SP maps of varying themes by HeadThump, Popacabra, Trinca and Zwiffle.

file.author: Jon Seigel
file.title: The First Attempt
file.description: Medium to large Metal level.

file.author: DeathMethod
file.title: Temple Of Anubis: Judgement Of The Dead
file.description: A very nice medium sized egyptian map. It has a somewhat similar vibe like Return to Dust. And it features a fun zombie quad massacre.

file.author: ZQ
file.title: The Temple of BLOOOOOOD
file.description:
Large blood temple. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: Scott McNutt
file.title: Tower of Death
file.description: Very small Wizard room with multiple stories. Pointless.

file.author: YukiRaven
file.title: Temple of Azathoth
file.description:
Medium-sized red runic style temple.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Esrael
file.title: Temple of Quake
file.description:
Small to medium-sized runic-style temple with a graveyard in rocky surroundings. The level can be finished fairly quickly, but in order to visit all areas and get better equipment it requires exploration and secret-hunting. The map source is included.

Note: This is an updated version that addresses several technical issues. The unfixed original version is available here.

file.author: John Dreese
file.title: The Tohnsay Predicament
file.description: Medium-sized lava cavern with a base part. OK.

file.author: John Parr
file.title: Temple of Lightning
file.description: Small white medieval map with Hipnotic textures and lightning effects, has to be played with Scourge of Armagon.

file.author: Tobias Person
file.title: The Tomb
file.description: Small Wizard/Metal map - a tomb with a chapel above and a lava cavern beneath.

file.author: Peter Bisseker (tiddles)
file.title: Tomb
file.description: Small to medium, linear, dark Maya-style map.

file.author: Tonhao
file.title: Empire of Disorder v2.2
file.description:
UPDATE, 29 September 2022: v2.3 fixes multiplayer bot .nav waypoints (deathmatch only) for KexQuake, download here.

An episode of 9 small maps with various classic themes (base, medieval, wizard, runic, brick, etc.) for vanilla Quake, but also works well in Copper / with co-op support.

After installing, start the episode via console command: "map eod_intro"

"Old rumors say that whoever picks up the Rune of Greed will be the next emperor of the Empire of Disorder. You decide to go on this journey, with this goal, and nothing can stop you..."

Note: may require a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: Tonhao
file.title: Somewhere
file.description: Episode with six medium-sized levels including a start map and a boss map. Each level follows an individual textures theme/style: a base, a metal/runic sewer, an Ebon castle, a stone/brick fortress, and a void map.

file.author: Madfox
file.title: Tormentarium
file.description:
Large metal-style industrial facility surrounded by caverns; features a few custom map props.

This is the second version, the first release named torro.zip can be found in the trash/.

file.author: Daniel Gómez (Ratón)
file.title: La Torre Abandonada
file.description: Small medieval map. The author's first Quake release.

file.author: Gyro Gearloose
file.title: Torture
file.description: Small Wizard/Metal map with torture chambers and some neat masks.

file.author: Andrej 'MC' Kacian
file.title: The Tower
file.description: Two boxed base maps with ugly texturing and bad lighting. The mission is to make one's way up a tower and escape through the hangar.

file.author: Jarkko Heilio
file.title: Tower Of Darkness
file.description: Medium sized leaked tower map with mixed texture themes.

file.author: Andrew Yoder
file.title: Toybox
file.description: Three small, experimental levels with cartoony textures and gameplay focusing on exploration and movement. The map sources are included.

file.author: ijed
file.title: The Palace of Fear
file.description: A dark turtlemap remake of e4m4. Built in a week so nothing too special. Uses Quoth entities, so you need that mod installed

file.author: MadFox
file.title: Gravey Trail
file.description: Medium sized metal/dungeon map.

file.author: Fimbul K
file.title: Train Station
file.description: Around medium-sized base level set in a train station. It uses Quake II textures and runs on the Progs_dump mod (included), and comes with a couple of new models and sounds. A texture wad and the map source are included.

file.author: distrans, Scragbait, negke, Preach, aguirRe, Asaki
file.title: Travail - A Quake Journey
file.description:
Large-scale Quake mission with 15 SP levels (including a start map and two secret maps), custom textures, a few new monsters and items, as well as some additional deathmatch maps.

Additional files: soundtrack, reworked skins.

file.author: aguirRe
file.title: Travail: Reworked Monster Skins
file.description: Reworked monster skins for Travail "just filtered a bit to bring out more details and colours".

file.author: Trinca
file.title: Escape
file.description: Smallish Metal/ Wizard map. Map source is included.

file.author: Trinca
file.title: Forgotten Tomb
file.description: Large Knave-style tomb level with graveyards, dungeons, fairly dull lighting and tough gameplay. Map source is included. OK.

file.author: Trinca
file.title: Underground Base
file.description: Large Base map with spacious rooms, linear progression, a very high monster count and a few custom enemies. Comes with a start and a boss map. Map sources are included.

file.author: Equim (Martin Alderson)
file.title: Trinity
file.description: Small realism map with three houses, a car, a truck and a pitch black boat. Barely average.

file.author: Luke Higgins
file.title: The Ruiner's Revulsion
file.description: Smallish Wizard castle with a handful of custom textures.

file.author: vIE888
file.title: The Snowy Dream
file.description:
SP campaign for Nehahra with three small to medium-sized maps: a base, caverns with an ancient temple beneath, and a snowy village floating in the void. It uses modified textures from RTP and comes with four new music tracks.

Note: These maps require Nehahra.

file.author: Simitar
file.title: The Sword of Ares
file.description:
A robot total conversion with 18 small to medium sized levels (incl. start map), all new textures, monsters, sounds, everything. It seems to be consistent in quality and theme (which is very 1998-like, think Malice), but also very strange.

Note: This is the full version (not just the shareware levels, as written in tsoa.txt).
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: nolcoz
file.title: The Secrets of The Mansion
file.description: "Medium sized medieval and base map".

file.author: Rudolf Kremers
file.title: The Grinding of Teeth
file.description: Small Metal level.

file.author: Ace
file.title: Temple of the Secret Society
file.description: Fairly large Wizard map.

file.author: eber150
file.title: Ten Thousand Days In The Fire
file.description:
Medium-sized runic-themed map, built for Copper (NOT included).

The author's second release. Map source is included.

file.author: Juha Koiste
file.title: The Temple of Torment
file.description: Very small wizard map.

file.author: Dilvish
file.title: Tut (ankhamon)
file.description: Medium sized Egyptian-style map.

file.author: Pingu
file.title: Twelve Minutes
file.description: Small to medium Wizard castle with Base and underground areas. The mission is to get in, retrieve the lightning gun and escape in under 12 minutes - after this time reinforcements will arrive.

file.author: Ludovic Texier
file.title: The Warfare Warehouse
file.description: Small Base map. Barely average.

file.author: Twisted Matrix
file.title: Twisted Christmas
file.description:
"Single player Quake level, specially designed for VRGN's Christmas gift to you!"
"Rid the mall of all of Evil Santa's creepy toadies and free Good Santa so that everybody gets their presents this year. Christmas is riding on yourshoulders, soldier."
Medium sized map with new textures and monsters - best adaptation of the Christmas theme so far. (Also contains a QW deathmatch version of the map)

file.author: Lunaran, Scampie
file.title: Underdark Overbright
file.description:
An episode with seven medium-sized levels plus remixed/remake versions of the original start and end maps. Mostly Wizard/Medieval/Runic style textures; the map sources are included. The episode accompanies the release of the Copper mod and serves as a showcase for the changes.

Note: These maps require Copper Quake and a source port with increased limits (as well as support for alpha textures).

An updated version is available here.

file.author: Lunaran & Scampie
file.title: Drowning in Space
file.description:
Modified version of the first level from Underdark Overbright, making it partially submerged. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Copper.

file.author: Lunaran, Scampie
file.title: Underdark Overbright - Version 1.1
file.description:
Updated version 1.1 of Underdark Overbright:
An episode with seven medium-sized levels plus remixed/remake versions of the original start and end maps. Mostly Wizard/Medieval/Runic style textures; the map sources are included. The episode accompanies the release of the Copper mod and serves as a showcase for the changes.

Note: These maps require Copper and a source port with increased limits (as well as support for alpha textures).

file.author: Dylan Barber
file.title: Underhalls
file.description: Small Base level - remake of DOOM II map02 "The Underhalls". Map source is included.

file.author: Matt Sefton
file.title: The Underworld
file.description: Small Base map with an outdoor area.

file.author: Tronyn & PM
file.title: Unforgiven
file.description:
Epic fantasy episode with three huge levels, hardcore horde battles with many new monsters and bosses, several new and modified weapons and items from the Drake mod (latest version is included). It also comes with a start map, custom skyboxes and background music.

Note: This episode requires an engine port with increased limits. The max_edicts value has to be raised to 2048 if supported.

file.author: Inky
file.title: Church Of The Unholy
file.description:
Medium-sized oldschoolish medieval church complex with Hexen II-vibe puzzles. Comes with modified models/sounds and gameplay features, and custom music tracks. The map and qc sources are included.

Note: This map requires the FTE source port.
An updated version is available here.

file.author: bmFbr, Burnham, Cunnah, Doom_Pope, Greenwood, Konig, Mars, Mista Heita, Mihu, Rhoq, Skorly, VuRkka, zigi
file.title: Unused Jam
file.description:
Community map pack with 12 level + start map using unused id textures from timfixed.wad. It comes with two custom skyboxes and a music track. The map sources are included.

Note: Cunnah's map requires a source port with increased limits and Mars' map needs BSP2 support.

file.author: Utah
file.title: Death's Taste
file.description: Small Wizard castle.

file.author: Rodrigo HernandeZ B.
file.title: UteM 666 el regreso a una pesadilla
file.description: Around medium sized pseudo-realism map, featuring some new monsters such as the Manga Babe. Barely average.

file.author: Bloodshot, Giftmacher, ish, JCR, muk0r, MUZBOZ, nyo (Nyoei), PinchySkree, Pritchard
file.title: Underwater Jam
file.description:
Underwater Jam - a community map pack featuring nine (under)water-themed levels by various authors. They use different texture styles and some custom monsters/assets.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Zied Rieke
file.title: Vivisect Six
file.description: Fairly large, plain base level with a flying enforcer and non-linear gameplay.

file.author: Peter Bisseker (tiddles)
file.title: Steel Valour
file.description:
Small gritty industrial map.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: MadFox
file.title: VeniVidiFutzi
file.description: Large greek-themed medieval town with a venice-style canal and cavern areas beneath. It also features a few new and modified monsters: crossbow knights, skeletons and Granito.

file.author: Markie Music
file.title: The Containment Centre
file.description:
Small base level; a remake of the first map of the game Viscerafest. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.71.

file.author: Wright Bagwell
file.title: The Vigil
file.description: Small Medieval map with focus on arena combat.

file.author: Rickard Edén (Nephilim)
file.title: Hell
file.description: Large underground dungeon in hell. Features new textures and reskinned monsters - for this, the color palette was changed which results in color changes on all monsters and items, a greenish tint mostly. It also makes the level look darker and the status bar harder to read, so players might want to consider deleting the "gfx" directory in order to see better (note that this will make the lava appear pink).

file.author: Steve Rescoe
file.title: Village of Dread
file.description:
Medium-sized level, a medieval village with a waterfilled canyon. Comes with a few new textures and a medieval-style replacement for the exploding barrel.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Virtus
file.title: Deathmatch Maker Demo Episode
file.description: This is a single player campaign that came with the Virtus Deathmatch Maker map editor (not included) to serve as an example of its potential. It features 12 small to medium-sized levels in two episodes and a new boss enemy. First episode is mostly base, second episode realism-themed, with maps including a lab, a prison, a subway station and an office building.

file.author: Darin McNeil
file.title: Vision of Hatred
file.description: Small Medieval map with lava cavern bits showing off the cutscene code developed by the same author. The 'Cutscene Construction Kit' (.qc source files and documentation) is included.

file.author: nolcoz
file.title: Void Town
file.description: Smallish city/realism map with a few new textures. The map source is included.

file.author: Trace Stuart
file.title: Eruption is immanent!
file.description: Very small temple built around a volcano. A deathmatch level with single player settings, but no exit (only a message). Barely average.

file.author: George Grotans
file.title: Virtual Reality Quake
file.description:
"No Shooting Is Allowed In This Module. - Sneak past the guards." Rather dull as you can simply rush through the rooms.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Anonymous users, Coffee Achiever, DiamondBlack, Streaky
file.title: Violent Rumble 1.00
file.description:
Community mapping event organized at 4chan's retro videogame board: 11 large levels including a start map and a secret map, following a variety of styles and texture themes. They run on a custom mod that combines enemies, weapons, items and assets from both official mission packs, Quoth, Arcane Dimensions, RMQ and Progs_dump. As such, it comes with many new models, sounds as well as skyboxes and custom music tracks.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: VuRkka
file.title: Forever Lost
file.description: Around medium-sized blue puzzle dungeon made for cooperative play (cannot be completed solo).

file.author: VuRkka
file.title: Blackened Call
file.description:
Small Metal/runic level.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Lukasxd
file.title: Windy Temple
file.description: A small map featuring some sort of floating structure. The author's first Quake map.

file.author: Tobias Reichert
file.title: The Fate for Walhalla
file.description: Large map with mixed texture styles, many traps and some puzzles.

file.author: BassLexa
file.title: War Church
file.description:
Large, spacious military base/stronghold fortifying an old church. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.
[Cannot be run through the Quake Injector]

file.author: Taskmaster (Warren Marshall)
file.title: The Warehouse
file.description: Medium sized base map with a slightly above id-level amount of unaligned textures and some oddly scaled crates.

file.author: Ozric
file.title: The Warpgate
file.description: Medium sized Wizard map with a sense of exploration.

file.author: ijed
file.title: Warp Spasm
file.description:
Probably the most evil and hostile atmosphere a Quake release ever had. This episode is built upon Quoth code and monsters. It comes with "dark ambient" music which adds to the feeling. The levels are huge, and the number of monsters in each one is extreme. An essential release, but clearly not for everyone.

Note: This episode requires Quoth and an engine port with raised limits. A modified version of GLQuake is included.

file.author: Benjamin S. Clower
file.title: Water Torture
file.description: Small brick map with upward/downward water tubes.

file.author: Unknown
file.title: Waterways
file.description: Small and very dark level consisting of two rooms connected by a drain pipe, possibly designed for deathmatch.

file.author: Erik Robson
file.title: Waterworks
file.description: Medium sized blue brick cistern map with pipes and a Base bit.

file.author: Trinca
file.title: Wicked Base
file.description: Huge and spacious base map.

file.author: Ondrejoda
file.title: The Wizard Base
file.description: Small brick building inside a cavern. The map source and a walkthrough demo are included.

file.author: K.S.
file.title: Weird comic art Quake
file.description: Small to medium sized blue brick map. Very basic in terms of looks and gameplay, however there are many original machines, animated bits and mapobjects. Some funny features here, worth a look for sure.

file.author: EraserX
file.title: The Weapon Factory
file.description: Small Base map - a weapon factory producing aircrafts, tanks and submarines. Neat idea, but poorly executed.

file.author: Michael Reed
file.title: The Well of Lost Souls
file.description: Medium sized metal/wizard level with a few traps.

file.author: Miss Bubbles
file.title: Well of Lost Souls
file.description:
Small to medium-sized map inspired by E4M2- The Tower of Despair.
[repacked for Quaddicted]

file.author: Andy Baird
file.title: Wetbase
file.description: Large space base with many custom textures. There are many potentially interesting bits one may expect to find in a base like this, such as officers quarters, mess hall, kitchen, and generator rooms, however, the choice of textures and style is often quite odd.

file.author: Marc Roussel
file.title: Eat this...
file.description: Small medieval/metal level with a rocky outdoor area. Includes the .map file and a demo.

file.author: whirledtsar
file.title: Adrift
file.description:
Small abstact blue void map using custom textures. The texture wad is included.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.7.

file.author: Jon "Starbuck" Miles
file.title: Whisperer In Shadows
file.description: Small egyptian style turtle map.

file.author: Willem (Warren Marshall)
file.title: White Room
file.description:
Medium sized base map with a unique concept: "keep the usual shapes but take away the textures." A biohazard outbreak at this facility adds lots of blood to the mostly white textures.
This file was repackaged by Spirit. You can find the original .zip in the trash

file.author: Charlie Wiederhold
file.title: Timebomb & Salvation
file.description:
Two maps: a small unfinished base level (timebomb), and a small metal level with extremely nasty traps (salv). Salvation is a "love it or hate it" map, save often and try some of the usual secret finding techniques to finish it. Both require the SOA pack.

The "nice" rating is for Salvation, Timebomb seems Average.

file.author: Windaws
file.title: Barbican Of Hell
file.description: Small runic level. The map source is included.

file.author: Steve Wilson (Thundermug)
file.title: Valley of the wind
file.description:
Two medium sized, boxed maps with a story and cutscenes. The base bit sucks, the wizard parts are so-and-so.
Only just OKish.

file.author: wind_f
file.title: The Temple of Nightmares
file.description:
Medium-sized elder world map with medieval and wizard elements, classic vanilla id1 style. The author's first release. Map source file is included.

"My first map. I did my best here to make the map as enjoyable as was the id soft. original maps. [...] hard difficulty (skill 2) is recommended for best experience."

Note: requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits. "Tested on ironwail, quakespasm and remaster."

file.author: Hrimfaxi (Drew), Zwiffle (czg)
file.title: winterpack2005-2006
file.description: Two maps build from the scraps of other mappers: Hrimfaxi used Drew's scraps for a large egyptian/mayan map called "Egyptian rhapsody!" Zwiffle used czg's for a ikblue map called "Teacups - are my intentions".

file.author: Rick Lipsey
file.title: The Well of Wishes
file.description: Medium sized, interconnected and largely nonlinear Metal map. Very nice.

file.author: Tom Cleghorn aka Murgatroyd
file.title: The Wishing Well
file.description: Small to medium horizontal Wizard with different texture combinations is each room. Features Willy the Spider.

file.author: iYago
file.title: What Lies Behind
file.description:
Small metal/runic level. Comes with a custom music track from Quake64. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: Kayne
file.title: Wrath of Ahnkii
file.description:
Large Egyptian-style map. Comes with a custom skybox and a music track. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.
An updated version is available here.

file.author: Daryl Deep
file.title: Wolf3D
file.description: E1M1 of Wolfenstein 3D, complete with original textures and confusing layout. Uses some SOA entities. For die-hard retro fans.

file.author: Rutabaga
file.title: Wolfenstein3D e1m1
file.description: Extremely bad conversion of Wolfenstein3D's first map.

file.author: Spoot
file.title: Wroth
file.description:
A short / medium sized base-themed map with modified grunts and enforcer monsters. Based on progs_dump 2.0 devkit (already included), and inspired by Mountains of Insanity.

No start map, run "map wroth" via console to play.

Known bug: "the second blue enforcer in the water who is supposed to drop the silver key will sometimes (rarely, but it happens) drop the key through the wall" -- if this happens then restart / reload, sorry.

file.author: Dick Nelson
file.title: Welcome to Ogre tower
file.description: Very small metal tower with a crusher trap.

file.author: Remilia Scarlet
file.title: Xala'noth - Part 1
file.description:
Medium-sized level using GothicDM and Knave textures and featuring strong colored lighting. It comes with a start map, a custom skybox and a music track by the author.

Note: This map requires Arcane Dimensions 1.70+ and a source port with increased limits.
Cannot be run from the Quake Injector!

file.author: xlarve
file.title: The Citadel of Sinners
file.description:
Very large fortress/citadel with many corridors and ambushes. Comes with a small skill selection map.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.
[Does not work with the Quake Injector]

file.author: xlarve
file.title: The Subconscious Fear
file.description:
Large 'techno-dungeon' with many corridors and ambushes.

[Does not work with the Quake Injector]

file.author: xLarve
file.title: The Sector Four
file.description:
Huge base map, a labyrinth of tight corridors with ambushes.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits
[May not work with the Quake Injector]

file.author: xlarve
file.title: The Level Six
file.description: Large base map consisting of tight corridors with ambushes.

file.author: xlarve
file.title: Seven
file.description: Small medieval level made in a classic style for vanilla Quake. Map source is included.

file.author: xlarve
file.title: xlarve's dream
file.description:
Large Metal/runic/mixed-tex dungeon with relentless arena combat in small rooms and tight corridors. 500+ monsters in total.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Bal, Bloodshot, Ing, ionous, Ish, JCR, Krampus, Naitelveni, negke, Pinchy Skree, Qmaster, Queenjazz, Rhoq, Scampie, Shambler, Shotro, Spipper, Strideh
file.title: Xmas Jam 2018
file.description:
Annual Xmas mapping event. This pack features 21 small maps in varied styles where all gameplay takes place within a 1024x1024x1024 space. It includes a start map and is powered by the Arcane Dimensions devkit + some additional content. The map sources are included as well.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits
(screenshot courtesy of sock)

file.author: Chedap, Comrade Beep, Fairweather, Glans, Greenwood, Heresy, ionous, JCR, MortalMaxx, Naitelveni, Nolcoz, Nyoei, onetruepurple, Pinchy, Qalten, Shadesmaster
file.title: Xmas Jam 2019
file.description:
Annual Christmas mapping event. This pack features 17 small maps in varied styles where all gameplay takes place within a 1024x1024x1024 space. It includes a start map and is powered by the Arcane Dimensions devkit (included) + some additional content. The map sources are included as well.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits

file.author: Artistical, Bal, Chris Holden, Comrade Beep, DragonsForLunch, entsoy, Greenwood, grome, Heresy, ionous, ish, muk, Naitelveni, onetruepurple, Pinchy, Qalten, QMaster, quasiotter, Shademaster, Strideh, vbs
file.title: Xmas Jam 2020
file.description:
Annual Christmas mapping event. This pack features 19 small maps in varying styles where all gameplay takes place within a 1024x1024x1024 space. It runs on Arcane Dimensions 1.8 (included) and comes with some additional content like sounds, models, skyboxes and music tracks. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: ChrisHolden, Greenwood, Grue, Heresy, ionous, ish, JCR, Krak, Krampus, Magnetbox, Makt, Mememind, Mrtaufner & Radiatoryang, Mykee, Naitelveni, Omni, Pinchy, Repator, Riktoi, Scythe, sock, Textfish, Wiedo
file.title: Xmas Jam 2021
file.description:
Annual Christmas mapping event. This pack features 25 "small" maps in varying styles where all gameplay takes place within a 1024x1024x1024 space. It runs on Arcane Dimensions 1.8 (included) and comes with some additional content like sounds, models, skyboxes and music tracks. The map sources are included.

Note: These maps require a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: XeNoN
file.title: Centurion
file.description: A fairly large canyon with several Q2base buildings. Originally started as a 100brush map, it eventually turned into a 'proper' map. Map source is included.

file.author: Rich "xen" Thorne
file.title: Realm of the tetris overlord
file.description:
A few tweaks and improvements made to sm9_xenon, including better lighting, gameplay and detailing.
Small but nice map in q3gothic flavour.

file.author: Speedy
file.title: Explore or Die
file.description: Around medium sized base map with Cr8 textures and somewhat non-linear gameplay relying on exploration (for ammo). Comes with a custom skybox and support for colored lighting.

file.author: Greenwood
file.title: Castle Zanthu
file.description:
Medium-sized castle using Daikatana E3 textures. Comes with a custom skybox and a poster screenshot.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits.

file.author: sock
file.title: The Horde of Zendar
file.description:
Large medieval city at nighttime with a strong focus on exploration and route choices. It comes with custom medieval-style items. The map source is included in the PAK.

Note: This map requires an engine port with increased limits.

file.author: Nihilism Unlimited
file.title: Zerstörer - Testament of the Destroyer
file.description:
"Be very scared... Zerstörer is here to destroy you, and is arguably the meanest Q1 SP episode around. A 7-map partial conversion with excellent new graphics and superb effects, cool weapons and interesting monsters. The maps are varied and continually interesting, but Zerstörer is really outstanding for the amazing atmosphere: bleak, inhospitable, and often truly scary. Very creative, very engrossing - again, unmissable."
-TEAMShambler

Additional files: patch 1.1, zerend hotfix, teaser demo.

file.author: Nihilism Unlimited
file.title: Zerstörer v1.1
file.description: Zerstörer patch: progs.dat / qwprogs.dat version 1.1.

file.author: Nihilism Unlimited
file.title: Zerstörer Demo
file.description: A short non-interactive demo setting the tone of the events about to unfold in Zerstörer - Testament of the Destroyer.

file.author: efdat, HeadThump, negke
file.title: Zerstörer Turtlemap Pack
file.description:
A pack of turtlemaps for the Zerstörer mod made by efdat, HeadThump and neg!ke.

  • Love in a bunker, baby! by efdat

  • Hold of the Troglodyte by HeadThump

  • Aderlass by neg!ke

file.author: zigi
file.title: A Verdant Dawn
file.description:
Large murky medieval fortress inspired by Foggy Bogbottom and The Forgotten Sepulcher from Arcane Dimensions. Comes with a custom skybox and a music track. The map source is included.

Note: This map requires a source port with increased limits + BSP2 support.

file.author: zigi
file.title: Disposal Of Otherworldly Monsters
file.description:
A large Doom themed map, using the SMEJ2 progs (already included). Contains music from Doom 2 OST. Map source is included.

"... a remix of my QBB1 map [Quake Builder Community Blockout Project #1] [...] Monster count 121 / 175 / 200 and 8 secrets."

Note: start map is not included. Load manually in console via "map zigisp2"

Note 2: probably requires a modern engine / source port with increased limits.

file.author: mukor, sock, Zombie
file.title: Zombie Jam 1
file.description: Results of an impromptu speedmapping/jam session following a "medieval E1M2 style brickwork and about 20 monsters" theme. The map sources are included.

file.author: Giftmacher, mukor, scar3crow, sock, Zombie
file.title: Zombie Jam 2
file.description: Results of an impromptu speedmapping/jam session following a "lifts and zombies and 20ish monsters" theme. The map sources are included.

file.author: Andrew Aksenov
file.title: ZOOM9
file.description:
First place in a competition of the Russian magazine Game.exe.
Small base map with modified monsters, custom level mechanics and a few new sound effects.

file.author: Zwiffle
file.title: Perversion of Gun
file.description: "Pretty awful, dark, cramped, linear base/metal map, using Cr8_Set tex." - Fairly small and dull lighting, but nice design.

file.author: Zwiffle
file.title: Geometric Map of Horror
file.description: Some speedmap with Q3A textures by Zwiffle.
